The input jack makes the sound crack and has 4 connections so if you are playing on a console all that is hanging off of your controller. I have to much to say that is bad. Just buy something else’s. Save your money. Unless you want to spend money on something that does not do at all what it says it does
title: Trash

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: So I bought this product to replace a worn wireless headset I had been using that was randomly blasting static in my ears at times. When it arrived i hooked it up to my computer, usb for the LEDs, and the audio jack splitter for my HD audio on my computer. Tested the sound quality by listening to some music streams on youtube that i like to listen to while i work, had no issues there, but then i went to test the mic in game. I started up the game, tested to make sure the game was picking up on the mic, which it was, but when i joined my friends and started talking to them, they informed me that the mic was getting alot of feedback, and they could literally hear themselves through it. I went into my settings to try and fix it, maybe turn down the sensitivity or change the audio format. Nothing fixed it, and the only time they didn't get feedback was if the mic sensitivity was so low that they could not hear me. I talked with a support personnel from amazon and they set up a replacement order. I sent it back and they shipped the replacement in 2 days. Today I got the replacement, plugged everything in, brought up my audio settings and started playing the music again, and the mic was worse than before. The mic was at 50% sensitivity and it was picking up on everything. I'm terribly upset with this product and its mic quality. Never buying a Runmus product again.
title: Bad Mic

author: MonsDomain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: As all of the other reviews on here states, this headset is a great headset for the low price point. Materials are sturdy, primarily made of a thick plastic or a TPU. Sound quality is excellent, and the microphone is loud and clear, picking up only the voice of the player. Aesthetics are nice, the volume/mute functions are great, and the sound separation for picking up footsteps in shooters is awesome!But not exactly what I'm looking for...The only con I can say is comfort. It is not extremely uncomfortable, but my ears and some parts of my head felt still and a little sore after a gaming session. The padding on this headset is excellent all around, but the ear cups are not angled for my head specifically, I'd like more tilt on the ear cups for a better, more comfortable fit and feel. Also, this headset is about as heavy as other headsets (if not, heavier), but the distribution of weight made it uncomfortable for longer gaming sessions.Overall, I enjoyed this headset for the time being, but essentially I'm going to go with another option on the market. No knock on RUNMUS (or Onikuma, the branding on the headset) as I can see the quality in their products at such an affordable price. This headset wasn't for me but it may be for you!
title: Great all-around headset, comfort slightly lacking

author: Jon K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: *Edits*10/23/2020-The mic is poor at least on mine, I am frequently told that I cannot be heard, or understood-Long term comfort = GoodI play 8 hours at a stretch, no issues-Sound is dominated by the bass, which might sound like a good thing for some people, but it's  not even particularly good bass.The mic and volume control are not in a good location on the cord, just barely hanging on your lap, and it is a fairly large and heavy piece, it can be very distracting*End of edit* My understanding is this company offers incentives for good reviews.  I cannot comment on that, as I didn't look into their offer, but they do have a card offering products, or a $15 amazon gift card for reviewing their product.Hmmm, I'm always looking for exceptional value, but I mostly get disappointed. So far, this is the case with these.First impressions: They are pretty well engineered for $27. Even so, they have an unidentifiable, slightly cheap appearence. The more I look them over, this impression seems to dissipate, and I'm getting over it. I think its possibly the appearance of micAppearence: The fit and finish is generally nice. The chrome bits are done well. All the parts fit tightly together. They seem well thought out, except that they are pretty large. The first thing my wife said, was to ask me if I was directing air traffic. The strain reliefs slightly cheapen the appearence,  but I overlook that, because its better to have them, than not.Comfort/Ergonomics:They fit nicely on my head, which isfairly large. I can't imagine many heads that would be too large, as each cup has about another 1" or so of travel. The extentions have a nice "clicky" adjustments that should stay put.The cups are pretty large in diameter, and fit easily around my average sized ears. The cups aren't terribly deep considering the size, if your ears stick out, it could potentially pose a problem,  my ears just barely clear. A slight push, and they touch.The cups are soft and cushy, and I expect they will be comfortable for long sessions. I'll update on that. Same with the headband pad, which is nice and deep and soft.They are generally light enough.The mic can be rotated up and out of the way, and has detents to keep it well positioned. The mic boom is plenty rigid, and can bent in, or away from your mouth.Sound:The reason for 3 stars at this point is the sound. It's maybe a bit better than one would expect for the cost, but its still lacking. The bass is okay, more than expected, but not very punchy. There is something missing above the bass region, they are kind of lifeless, especially for music, which I know isn't their purpose. It's sort of like you're under water.  I'm guessing this will show in game play, like hearing enemies well. Another thing I will report on, and adjust my rating. There may or may not be a little change with break in. We shall see...I can't report on the mic sound quality yet, but I will.
title: Not bad for $27, but sound quality suffers

author: Kenneth W Jamison Jr.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
review_content: Let's start off first with the fact it comes with an adapter that when you plug it in you hear nothing. But if you unplug that and just plug in the regular jack it works fine and the noise cancellation is really good. However if you move at all the staticky is over powering. I might have been able to get over that but while gaming not a single person could hear me even when their headset volume is all the way up. It sounds like you are going through a tunnel or super far away. Not a good product, returned mine the day after I received it.
title: Not A Good Headset

author: Journeyman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: The in-line "adapters" are as useful as $#!%. My old USB headset (one line btw) hooks up to my PS4 & works flawlessly. I bought this headset b/c of the reviews, & it gets 1 star b/c I can't select "0" & because it is quite comfortable... but comfort doesn't amount to $#!% if it doesn't even function as anything more than glorified headphones. I don't understand how this headset has such high reviews, but be warned that if you're wanting to use this for a PS4, the USB doesn't work (after trying it, I looked at the instructions, & even those tell you that the only thing you can do is plug in the headphone 3.5mm jack to the controller, which only gives you audio ~ no mic).Next, I tried it on my computer (to avoid having to send the $#!% thing back & order a replacement... but sure enough, even with just the headphone cable & USB (for power) hooked up, it wouldn't connect the mic. This $#!% headset needs ALL THREE cables hooked in to serve as a headset w/ mic. Ummmm... no. I'll stick to my USB3 (single line) headsets that can do what this headset needs 3 cables / jacks to accomplish.
title: Useless as a Console (PS4) Mic Headset

author: Peter L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019
review_content: Disappointed by empty promised! My kid was so excited. I wrote:Hi,It has been 7 days from Nov 15 and I haven't seen the free headset yet.  Please confirm with tracking number. ThanksSincerely, Peter LeThis email from Cassie:Hi,It has been 7 days from Nov 15 and I haven't seen the headset yet.  Please confirm with tracking number. ThanksSincerely, Peter Le-------- Original message --------From: review@runmus.netDate: 11/15/19 12:15 AM (GMT-08:00)To: Peter Le <pdl@duclinh.com>Subject: Re: FW: Thank you for reviewing RUNMUS Gaming Headset Xbox ... on AmazonHi，Thanks a lot for your kindly review! I have sent the free gift to you.If you didn't receive it within 7 days, please feel free to contact us again.Sincerely,CassieI'm please that the sound quality is good.  It pickuped the slightest background noise in the game. Recommended by current Bose headsets user. 5 stars.
title: Great for kids! UPDATED EMPTY PROMISED

author: Brett B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
review_content: Worked for a couple of days then the product, (the microphone specifically), became completely unusable from an audio perspective.I can hear the sound from the game through headphones, but nobody can ever hear anything but static on my end if anything at all.I’ve gone through numerous trouble shooting rabbit-holes, tried a variety of different controllers, and even had friends bring their hardware and it doesn’t work on any of them.If it was still eligible for return I would send back immediately. Best I can do now is try to warn others.
title: Microphone doesn’t work. You’re getting what you pay for.

author: Astrid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: I bought these headphones for my son as a gift and he was super excited for them, However when he opened it and tried to use it and the headphones were defective and only one side worked. Now I cannot return them because it’s literally 3 days after return date. I just wasted money on headphones I cannot use. The headphones seems great if they worked.
title: Defective Headphones

author: Brandie D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: Not a fan of this headset at all! I currently use the HyperX Cloud X’s for my Xbox, and they are amazing! Sound quality is GREAT, and I’m on my 2nd pair, after beating my other ones up for 3yrs. With that said, Hyper X headsets aren’t cheap, and when I started playing my PS4 again, I needed another headset, so I found these RUNMUS headsets, and the reviews weren’t bad. The Hyper X headset worked, but I hated having to rearrange my set up and swap headsets with controllers, laziness 100%.I’ve had these for almost a week, and I am just not satisfied with them at all. The sound quality is decent, but the non-comfort and bulkiness of the headset outweighs the sound. Also, the adjustable sides are cheap plastic, so one side of my headset arrived out of position, and won’t go down the entire way. They don’t adjust smoothly, so I’ve kind of just keep them at their original position, for fear they would breakPROSsound quality is clear and crisp, but that’s to be expected with noise canceling headsets.CONSHUGE/BULKY: They feel like they weigh my head down.TOO TIGHT! These push against the side of my head and give me a headache. They also push my glasses into the side of my face, and are extremely uncomfortable after 1/2hr of playing.The CORD setup: The volume/mute section is bulky, and awkward. There are extra pieces just hanging around when using it with a controller, so it’s annoying to have those extra things just hanging around and in my way, on my lap.I would not recommend this headset for adults, or for gamers who play for extended periods of time, they just aren’t quality enough to fit the standards of comfort, or performance. For children, maybe they would be better, as kids break things, these are cheap, and perhaps would be a good starter pair for a kid.One last thing to mention. I think it’s stupid to have lights on a headset, making them compatible with controllers/consoles, and then only making the lights work when using them with a PC. That just seems like a huge waste! The lights are nice, but they are absolutely worthless to me at this point.Definitely spend money on a better headset, you won’t regret your choice to spend a little extra money for quality.
title: TOO Cheap, better for starter headset FOR KIDS.

author: Cyber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: I'm coming from an old PS4 gold headset that's now 5 years old and literally held together with electrical tape from where the folding hinges have broken. This headset had excellent reviews, and plenty of them, so I thought it was time to finally retire my old pair and get some new, crisp, clear sounding headphones. I've been considering getting a new pair for over a year now, but the PS4 gold headset is top notch sound, and I've yet to find another headset that beats them out. Well, that statement still stands.I was excited when the delivery was made for this headset. Boy was I excited. I finished my work for the day, plugged them in, and spun up a game which conveniently has a pretty dynamic main menu soundtrack, so I was ready for a concert. Then I heard the truth. I audibly said "Wow, this is garbage" and sat staring with my face contorted in disgust for a solid minute before plugging my old faithful PS4 gold headset in. Mind you, this is also all happening on a PC. I use the PS4 gold headset on both gaming platforms. When I switched back to my old headset, the sound difference was shocking. I know this is a cheaper headset than the PS4 gold by far, but I was given the gold headset as a gift, and today I learned how much the price makes a difference. The bass is WAY overbearing, and it sounds so artificial it's literally painful to listen to. This set will be returned immediately. Such a disappointment.
title: Terrible Sound, Not balanced at all, Ridiculous cable configuration

author: Joey Kot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_content: I had a pair of TB head which were great and still working, but i wanted something i could use on my XB1 and PC moving forward. I searched a while at some high end sets and being an avid gamer i was willing to invest into a $200 wireless model, but decided to give these a shot first with an option to return. I was impressed to say the least! I'm not certain if the sound it 7.1, honestly cause i never have heard 7.1 headphones -  but i can hear things coming behind me and beside me without issues! These things are big, but light weight, the materials are solid but flexible. the mic drop has a small satisfying click each movement down and the cord was plenty to reach my pc and still have wire left to move around after spazing out over getting killed ha! Its not all rainbows and sunshine.... the LED light is useless, to me atleast, and needs to be powered by USB. The cord aforementioned is long, which is great for PC but a pain in the tuckus for xbox or switch. The adapter/volume in-line with the braided cable is heavy and awkward, so much so that when it drops from the table or my lap i can feel the tug on my headset. the set comes with a mic\audio Y cable too, which was a nice addition although i didn't need it. All in all i am thoroughly impressed with these, especially at the price point. I explore many headphones and speakers for value and sound, to me its what makes brands like aiwa or anker so stellar. when you roll the dice on off-brand devices you typically roll snakeyes but every once in a while you stumble across that gem -  this is that gem. if youre in the market for great sounding and a solid mic headset for xbox\ps\nintendo AND PC -  this is an absolute steal. if your in the market for a headset for just xbox\ps -  this is an absolute steal. If this company turns them wireless, i'll be the first person to throw money at them. RUNMUS  should be on everyones radar moving forward.
title: What a steal!

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
review_content: So we bought two.  One for each xbox per kid in the house.  Both have the adapters for the new xbox controllers.  They worked for a while (one month).  Now there is a crackling sound in both of them that is super annoying.  I thought the boys were being extra sensitive until I listened to fornite with them on.  They are right.  They no longer sound good.  They were bought about 2 weeks apart, both through amazon and each are hooked up to separate controllers on separate Xboxes.  Ah well.  To the trash they both go.
title: We bought two sets and, well to the garabge they go after a month...

author: Kaznasty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
review_content: These headphones sound great and are very comfortable to wear! While I haven't tried them yet for extended sessions (4hrs+), I can tell that I'm going to have no issue with them whatsoever. The padding is exceptional and the cord is very tough, especially at the connection points which is the first area to wear out on most headphones.My only complaint about these is the very odd connection requirements needed. I was hoping that I could use these for PC gaming with just a USB connection but sadly, that is not the case. For a desktop computer they need to be connected to a USB (for the lights, I assume), 3.5mm mic jack, and 3.5mm headphone jack. This seems very excessive and unnecessary and actually disables me from being able to use these on my laptop as the headphone jack is on the opposite side of my USB ports.Overall, wonderful quality and I'm sure it's exceptional for console gaming if you're okay with two additional wires dangling, but please consider your port setup on PC before purchasing.
title: Great Quality Headphones with Subpar Jack/Port Setup

author: M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
review_content: When I first read the reviews it looked really good. I'm an xbox gamer and I needed a new mic quick for less than the specialized ones. The first month was great, the sound was amazingly clear along with my mic. 5 days after the return policy window ended it started fading in and out and would only work when the cord was bent a certain way. I'm desperately searching for a new mic now, meaning I will go up into the 60 dollar range verses 20 because this one was my second mic. I carefully stored the mic and only used it for gaming and its life ended real quick. Go a little higher or buy a different mic because this one sh*t the bed real quick.
title: Broke within a month

author: Eric M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
review_content: ugh...where do i even start?im just gonna dive right in. these sound TERRIBLE. its like ultra cheap 90's era earbud sound, if even that good. its just SO terrible. i plugged them into my pc, flip on some music and within 10 seconds, unplugged them, pulled the little adapter off as i can use that for a different headset (my Astro A10's sound 1,000,000x better but need the adapter to use the mic) and threw them out. basically, $20 or so for an adapter. i did notice that when i put them on, before i turned the music on, things got real quiet and isolated, so thats good and they werent uncomfortable for the time i had them on. ill even go as far as to say theyre more comfortable than my Astro A10 headset is though, so theres that. that literally the only good things i can say about these. they are NOT 7.1. at best, theyre 2.0 stereo and sounded more like mono than stereo. so yeah, i absolutely would NOT recommend these to anyone. save your money. get something better that doesnt sound like nails on a chalkboard when sound is played through them. seriously.
title: you get what you get for $20

author: H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2018
review_content: FINAL UPDATE: Today, after 5 months of owning this headset, it finally bit the dust. The connecter at the controller had, as previously mentioned, come undone from the braided cabling, and the bare wires finally had enough and sound was only coming from one ear. Although initially impressive, this product is not made to last, with a full life cycle being 5 months in my case.Pros: good sound, great price,  long braided cable for durability and reach, very comfortable and lightweight, ratcheting mic boom, comes with 3.5mm splitter and USB for various applications.Cons: plastic material is very thin and feels weak, especially the head band, it feels like any amount of torque could snap it. However for the price, if that's the only obvious cost saving measure, I'm happy.Overall very satisfied with the product.UPDATE: After a few months of owning this product, there has been some deterioration and quality flaws that have become apparent. Namely, the braided cable not being very secure into connectors, the braid has come out and frayed, leaving only the bare wires holding on to the connection. It still works but it's a matter of time before the wires break due to stress.
title: If you're looking for a cheap temporary headset, go for it. This is not a long term product.

author: Tamra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: I was excited to try these out after reading all of the reviews! This headset has nearly 30k reviews and majority of them are great reviews! When I got them in the mail and opened the box I found a card that says FREE GIFT! All you have to do is leave a review and you get to choose a free gift. One of the options was another headset just a different color. This immediately alarmed me. I said omg, that’s why this thing has so many good reviews!! I thought I just got scammed. Of course, I too wanted that free gift so I left a review before I really even gave them a try. I said they were great before I even knew if they were. After receiving my FREE headset and testing the headset for a week, I am going to give my true and honest review. The sound and mic work good. I wouldn’t say they are amazing because let’s be honest, they’re $40! But nevertheless, they do the job! They are comfortable to wear! They do feel a little cheap but that’s expected seeing as how they are made of plastic. I think as long as you’re not overly rough with them or throw them, you will be fine. I got these to use on my IPad so unfortunately I don’t get to use the light feature unless I want to play on my iPad right next to a usb outlet. The cord is super long, I definitely didn’t need that but someone on console or pc it would be perfect. I would recommend these for sure!
title: Free gift of you leave a review? My HONEST review!

author: Nichole G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: Comfort: Pretty comfortable, a little clunky like most, but it doesn't take too long to forget you have it on. Plenty  of padding.Sound quality: Really clear, leaning towards the low and mid frequencies, which I found that this works well with  fps where the weapons don't sound to harsh because that. The surround sound works well.Build Quality: Seems sturdy, good quality plastic. Doesn't come with a case or stand so you'd probably would want  to get that to protect it. It's sturdy but if you accidentally sit on them (see story of my life) I can see  them breaking, like most headsets.Microphone: People have mentioned that its very clear, and they have no problems hearing me. However, the  only complaint I've heard, although it's not a major one, is that when you speak the other person  hears the ambient noise around you. Not too bad, but noticeable. When not speaking the noise  cancelation works really well.Features: Pretty standard, volume and mic switch. The usb is ONLY for the lighting effects, nothing else. Setup  was a breezeOverall: 4.5 Stars. Other than the issue mentioned, this is a very solid headset. Well built, comfortable, good  sound, clear mic. If this broke I wouldn't have a problem buying this again.
title: Very Good headset for a reasonable price!

author: Cincyt11
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
review_content: Purchased this for my new Xbox one in Jan. 19. After plugging them into the controller nothing happened. I read some of the questions and saw where it was suggested to use a different control... That worked. Sound was great! Head set felt good on head. About a month in with maybe 3 hours a week using some minor crackling could be heard. Not a big deal it wasn't constent. By June the crackling was worse and now the head phones sometimes work. If I turn my head, sound goes out. Can't wiggle any connections to fix. Just stops working. Then randomly it Comes back on... needless to say I am disappointed. These have potential but they let me down. I will purchase a different brand from another supplier.
title: Stopped Working in 5mth with little use.

author: LCC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2019
review_content: This headset seems rather sturdy for something of this cost, which is a nice perk.  I'll elaborate further on the quality:Pros:Audio is good and balanced, not too much bass which plagues some of these cheaper headsets.Comfortable, puffy ear muffsSolid buildQuiet adjustments (could just be me, but I've personally always hated when the adjustments have loud plastic clicks)Longer than average audio cordCons:LED lights don't work when plugged into the switch (minor inconvenience at best)Hard to transportWhat's this for?As it should be, this is obviously for gaming. Audio has always been an important factor in gaming. I played around an hour of Cadence of Hyrule with this headset and the audio quality is respectable. Overall, I recommend this for anyone playing on a PC or console.Notes:No compatibility issues on the SwitchI'll update this review in 6 months seeming as a product such as this should last longer than that timeframe.
title: Comfortable and Good Audio

author: Carly Kalkauski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: You get what you pay for as they say. We'll start with the good things: the surround sound works quite well, the bass is impressive for such a cheap set of headphones. I've never had any issues with my mic sound, it comes in just fine.The bad? The noise cancelation is terrible. You can still hear around you unless you're at full blast, which, by the way, is weirdly quiet. I was replacing a headset whose mic gave me issues but the headphones themselves still worked really well and I *immediately* could not get over the huge volume difference between the two. Better watch it if you do put the volume up, however, because my teammates told me frequently that they could hear my game sounds "through my speakers". Nope, those are just my poorly insulated headphones. And maybe the weirdest thing is if you use the mute function that's built-in with these headphones, it apparently sounds like a "little mouse" is living in my headset. It got so bad that they eventually asked me to just leave my headset unmuted when I went AFK.But, honestly, compared to some other sets I've seen for the price, these are okay. If you don't want to throw down a lot of cash and you want a decent headset for gaming, these might work. After all, they're... fine.
title: They're... fine.

author: Jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
review_content: I purchased these to replace my Xbox headset, I was happy to see they came with adapters for all platforms (Xbox, PC, Nintendo Switch etc). They’re lightweight and have great sound quality. The noise cancellation is very good compared to Xbox brand headphones, I’m sure my wife is going to unintentionally scare me a few times before I get used to them.The one reason I don’t give them 5 stars is because on the description and picture it shows that they light up, which I was excited to see, and I now realize they only light up when being used with a PC. I still would have bought them but it would have been nice to know before.This is only my first day using them but so far so good! If they can stand the test of time and hours of wear I plan to put them through I’ll be buying them again in the future!
title: Great headphones

author: MIGUEL ANGEL VALDEZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: First off, I haven’t used a mic/headphone setup like this for gaming (PS4), only the stock earbud/mic that comes with the console. To my friend’s request, I decided to order this considering the good reviews and extremely low price. Once I received it I realized how big they were but I didn’t care considering it was just for gaming. I tried them out immediately and had no luck getting the mic to stay off when I wasn’t talking so I ended up having to keep the mic off and started a replacement order thru Amazon. They sounded great but the mic was upsetting. I ended up randomly restarting my console, and low and behold, the mic worked perfect and everyone said it was quiet again when I didn’t talk. Cancelled the replacement and have been happy with it ever since. I even tested them connected to my laptop to listen to high quality sounds tests and they were amazing! My wife even tried them and she said it sounded like the sound was coming from around her throughout the room and not even from the headphones. Ear cups and head rest are extremely comfortable too. Highly recommend this product!**UPDATE**The original mic issue has been starting up again. All my friends hear is a high whining static noise. I’ll tap on the sides of the speakers and mic while unplugging and then they seem to work. It just sucks having to deal with that, haven’t had these very long.
title: Great Product at a Great Price! Mic Issues now

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
review_content: I was looking for a headset to replace a Sony Gold wireless headset used with a PS4. As an aside, don't get the Sony Gold. Sound is meh, microphone is not good and people constantly complained about voice quality. Bad build quality, too. Once an earpad comes off, good luck getting it to stay back on absent superglue.Anyway, I looked around and decided to give these a shot. Man, what a difference! Great sound quality, great microphone quality. They are big and bulky, but they are also super comfortable. There are no complaints from people who have worn these for five-hour COD sessions. Going from wireless to wired was a bit of a compromise, but the sound quality of these is so good that you don't really notice the cable. Bottom line is that if you aren't looking to spend a lot for a gaming headset and don't insist on wireless, this is a GREAT alternative.
title: Just as Adverstised

author: Aaron W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
review_content: I bought these from reading the reviews of people claiming these work and sound just as good as top quality headsets. I don’t think it’s that great of quality, it’s pretty good and I must say it’s better than many other wired headsets, but nothing compared to the high quality ones.It doesn’t have any noise cancellation because I still hear my wife talking about whatever in the background while I’m playing COD. I do hear players footsteps, and it does help me determine if somebody is running behind me, or what side they are on.I thought the headset would light up the whole time it’s connected, which it doesn’t. It only lights up when the usb is in.When I’m playing on Xbox any movement with the wire will cut out the audio for a second or 2, but I don’t have this issue with ps4.Overall I think it’s ok if you want something good and cheap, but if you’re a gamer you might want something a bit better
title: 3 out of 5 stars

author: Plasma Man
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: Good:1. I was a little surprised at the attractive style and comfortable fit of this headset - even though it is a little heavier than other headsets that I have had in the past.2. It has a robust, sturdy cord that will probably stand the test of time.3. The headset cable is wired with a split between USB connection and audio jack. Great idea.4. They include an optional audio splitter connector to separate the sound line from the microphone (useful for some computers).5. The LED (I got red) on the side is attractive and no overly bright at night.6. The ear pads fit very comfortably over the ears - no more of that pinching or pressing pains after hours of play.Disappointments right out of the box:1. The USB did not work with three different computers that I tried (Mac, Win10, and Win8) or my XBox. The device was not recognized on any of these systems. I emailed Run Mus about it a couple times over several days, but never received a response.2. The sound with the split sound/microphone jack connected to my computer would have lots of static and crackles.3. The microphone did not work at all.4. When plugging the single audio jack into my iPhone to test the headset, the sound would cut out every few seconds and sometimes it would trigger the "Siri" as if it was emulating the Home button push on the iPhone. It fits tightly, but may have a slight offset that causes it to engage some of the iPhone functions.5. I tried the audio jack in one of my Xbox controllers, which is outfitted with a standard audio jack output. I could only get sound out one of the earpieces and no microphone.6. I did not notice any sound canceling whatsoever. It's possible that the static sounds were attempting to do the sound cancellation, but it definitely wasn't working.
title: Good padding, Fair sound, Slightly heavier than similar headsets, USB and microphone didn't work

author: Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: I was pleasantly surprised by this inexpensive headset. The sound quality is robust and immersive. It works just as well for music as it does for gaming. The amount of bass exceeded my expectations as well. The headset is fairly lightweight and rather comfortable, so after a few minutes of wearing them, they almost seem to disappear. The mic sounds good too. I tested by recording my voice then playing it back and I was pleased with crispness of the playback. They also don't seem too loud for others nearby. I tried listening to music at a comfortable volume and my wife couldn't hear it from only a few feet away.I bought these for use with a PC and PS4. The cord is long so you have plenty of room to move around. The cord also has a Velcro strap attached to it so you can bunch up some of the length if you don't want it dangling (which is nice when using the PS4 since you are plugged into the controller so you don't need all that length). You will need to plug in the USB connector if you want to LEDs to light up. This means you can't effectively have the LEDs lit up when gaming with a PS4 (this is not something I care about personally) since there is no USB plug on the controller itself.Overall, for the quality at this price, I see no reason to spend more money on another headset. I would definitely recommend this to someone looking for a good gaming headset.
title: Solid Quality

author: Mr. Bursaw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
review_content: After 4 years of the same headset it was time to upgrade. Except, great gaming headsets are spendy. Plus reviews weren't very strong and constant for me to fork over big amounts of cash. Durability and sound are definately at the top of the list. Why pay a lot for a headset that doesn't last? So after doing research I decided to try out my Run Mus gaming headset. What I got was a very hefty (size) and pretty lightweight headset that lights up because I spend hours in a room by myself but I gotta have cool lights with very thick covered cords that are very long. It definately looks the part for the fraction of the price. I am still in the process of my first week of usage and the break in period. What I can tell you after 4 days is that my old headset was definately worn out. I am finally getting used to these and the experience and quality is pretty solid at the price point for these. It comes down to usage and what one does with a headset. Yes there will be trade offs because you get what you pay for, but that doesn't mean by any means these are bad. Think of it like this, if you wanted to get into a great pair of headphones for a young/first time console owner/gamer, I think the price these are at is the right way to go. That way, if something better comes along down the road, then it really didn't hurt you in the wallet. I think for what you get its worth the try. Beware though, someone like me coming off a pair of ancient gaming headphones the audio still takes getting used to for a 7.1 surround with Run Mus because the quality is better.BTW- Invest in Dolby Atmos app to unlock the power in these headphones.
title: Budget Headset that doesn't break the bank

author: Richard A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
review_content: I've had this headset for 3 months now and have had no issues with the build quality. It is definitely made to last. I have dropped it and accidentally yanked on it a few times and it is still working fine.I have one of the newer Xbox controllers that doesn't require the adapter in order for this to work. However, without said adapter, the volume on this headset is very, very low even at the highest volume setting. It's kind of a bummer because the adapter is more expensive than this headset at almost twice the price but I would not use it without one. The difference is night and day.The noise cancelation is fairly poor but that's not really an issue unless you're gaming in a crowded room. I lounge while I play & hold my controller about 6" from my chin and my friends can hear my controller rumbling through the headset. They also hear my dog whining or making noises. Again, not really an issue since the room is mostly quiet and I only play game audio through the headset, itself. Also, the mute switch on the headset wire makes an audible noise through the headset when flipped. I can't hear it but my friends can.The biggest issue that I have with the headset is that when first plugged in, you are only heard very faintly for several seconds before the volume becomes normal. Anytime I change the batteries on my controller during play, I don't even bother trying to speak to my friends until about 5 seconds pass because they always complain that they can barely hear me until about that time.
title: Works well, just not on its own.

author: The Amazon Car Guy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: I waited a bit before writing this review, so I could see how much I like this headset.I love it.The sound quality is amazing, I can hear distance depth better than I have been able to with any of the other headset in our home.I’m just an average guy, no professional, but the difference this headset makes in your gaming experience is fantastic. I’m able to find people and get more kills just from the difference in the sound quality from this headset (averaged 3-4 a round and easily pull off 8-10 now only change was switching to the K2)My wife sits next to me while I’m playing, and previously I’d have to switch the mic on and off so she could talk to me, but the noise cancellation works well enough that it doesn’t pick up her voice at a normal volume even right next to me.It’s light weight, super comfortable, and my ears don’t end up on fire after a good session.This thing is durable too, I got it in a manor most would complain about (the box was completely crushed) but the headset was not effected in any way what do ever I was really impressed. Another reason I waited to write the review, and nothing has surfaced as an issue.It’s a game changer for me, I liked it so much I bought another one and had it sent to a family member, and got another for my kids.Really impressed with the quality, and you can’t beat it with the price.Especially since I paid more for the other ones we have and this one out performs them hands down.If your looking for a headset, buy this one it’s worth it.
title: This is the headset you want

author: Willie G.R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
review_content: I will be honest, I was not expecting too much out of this headset when I ordered it; although after having read some of the reviews, I had hope, and that hope paid off.  First of all, for the Switch, which is the main reason I bought these for, I have to say that I never thought games could sound so amazing.  True, there's a slight muffling of sounds here and there, but you put those on, and you feel like you are inside your game.  Every sound effect, every song, every clip, clap, boing, or thud, this headset lets you pin point their exact location.  It's great for Animal Crossing, Resident Evil series, Mario series, Touhou series, Senran Kagura series, Dead of Alive Extreme 3, even Pokemon and Bioshock collection, and, heaves, even NES and SNES games feel more immersive.  However, keep in mind that, on Switch, the mic is useless unless you hook up your tablet for chatting while playing.On PS4... it's the first time I felt that I was playing in a room with a surround sound system.  The sound, surprisingly enough, comes clean and crisp, aside form a slight bit of muffling, but other than that, games like Kingdom Hearts 3, Touhou series, Tomb Raider, Child of Light, Project Diva series, Uncharted, Batman series, and Resident Evil series, it's frighteningly immersive too.  I highly recommend these headphones to anyone.One downside is they make your ears warm up a bit when you turn on the LEDs, and they are a bit heavy and clunky.  Minor details.
title: A really good surprise on performance

author: M. Froh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: I bought these as one of the only headsets available in late March 2020 (as everyone started working from home).The included USB adaptor didn't work for me, at all. So, I ended up using the 3.5mm analog mic/headphone cables for about two days. Then I was in a video call, speaking to a large group of people, when everyone started wincing. Someone sent a message over the meeting chat, saying that my microphone was blasting nothing but static. I literally threw the headphones across the room and went back to using my laptop's built-in mic and speaker. Absolute garbage.Today, I received a letter from the seller trying to "thank" me with a $20 Amazon gift certificate if I write a review. I'm writing this review, but they can keep their $20.
title: USB didn't work. Microphone started barfing static in the middle of a meeting.

author: Socal.S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
review_content: With all the positive reviews and features, I really wanted to like these but, unfortunately, I felt that the sound was terrible. The surround sound worked, but the sound is terrible. To me, they sounded distant and muffled/grungy. There is a lot of plastic with these which is probably why the sound isn't what it should be. The plastic makes them feel hollow and cheap, in my opinion. They definitely cover your ears and felt rather comfortable. Unfortunately, I couldn't last a game with them.
title: You get what you pay for

author: The Jerk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: I took a chance on these since the price was good.  What can I say, they work.  I had Turtle Beach wireless before for a couple years and literally holding them together with Gorilla Tape before they finally bit the dust.  These RUNMUS have none of the little features of Turtle Beach (surround sound, bass boost etc), the wire-up is clunky and messy and not well designed (for ex. you can't run and charge the PS4 controller and the headset at the same time while also playing) and the sound is stunningly average at best.  In fact it's a little - no a lot-  mushy in the bass department.  If you don't have a lot of money to spend, and you don't really care about the quality of your gaming sound then these will work just fine.  If you have a little money to spend, or you care about quality sound...you'll never be happy with these.  Mine are already in a box going to Good Will - I've had them for two days.
title: Inexpensive, and it shows.

author: Jacob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2019
review_content: I'm don't have too much too much to compare this to, but i do know that this headset is much better than a 60$ Razer Headset that I bought about a year ago. This headset sounds pretty great! I tested the mic a little and i am pretty satisfied with it. I would definitely recommend this headset to anyone that wants a quality sound, microphone, and experience for fairly cheap. The headset is pretty big, but i think that it is a fair price to pay.Update:After using the headset for the past month a few of my early opinions have changed a little. The headset is fairly large and feels kinda clunky. The sound quality is still really good and worth the price. The downfall I have noticed the most is the quality of the microphone. My voice sounds slightly muffled and the microphone seems pretty sensitive towards noses that a pop filter would normally help filter out. The microphone tends to pick up a lot of what's going on in the room as well. In my opinion the headset is adequate if you are on a tight budget, but I would probably suggest maybe going a different route unless you don't care too much about using the microphone or the large form factor.
title: Decently Satisfied

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_content: I have had countless pairs of headsets, from the $10 pair the console gives you, to a $150 set.For $25, I should give it a 5-star review but alas, I cannot.  This headset is everything you expect out of an affordable headset and more.Like I said, this should be a 5-star review because it works great.  They do everything a headset should and more at the price-range.  They cancel out almost all environmental sound, they are sturdy, 4 out of 5 on comfort, the microphone works well and is clear, and has lasted longer than every headset I have owned.My complaint is only that I have worn the upper echelon of headsets so I know what sound can be produced.  The game that I have quarrels with while wearing the headset is PUBG.  I imagine this will be the case with any similar game that you may rely on sound to have an advantage.  Remember, I went from a $150 pair, (microphone no longer works) to this headset.  I got spoiled by being able to call out all enemies before any of my teammates.  I am no-longer the first person hearing said enemies.
title: For $25, I should really give it a 5-star.

author: S &W Nelson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: I loved this headset when I 1st got it around christmas and it definitely works well.I have had very few problems with it and the majority of the time it worked like a charm.However I feel its important to mention the few downsides of this headset. I have kind of big ears and after wearing this headset for extensive hours, it started to hurt my head and ears. Now this isnt too much of a problem but if you are looking for a good quality headset that you will be wearing for streaming or just professional gaming, this might not be the best choice.There have been 2 times where I have plugged it in and it didnt work. All o did was fiddle with the aux cord end and waited for at most 5 min then it would start to work again.Last thing that is more recent is a weird kind of static noise that goes off whenever the cord connected to the controller is shuffled around a bit and also where the cord connects to the headset. This is minor but it still is a little annoying. It has never interrupted my gameplay, but then again, if you are a professional, this may not be the best.Now I love this headset because it was great and I upgraded from earbuds.A few things that some people may run into is that this headset could be too big for small kids because I'm 17 and have it on the lowest setting, again it hurts your ears and sometimes my head after extensive hours of use, and the lighting effect only works really if your xbox/ps4 is right next to your hand because the USB that lights up the headset is right next to the aux cord with little flexibility. But I dont care for the lights. However if you were using this for PC, then it should work fine.This is a quality headset. I would say it isnt top tier for headset but Definitely above average.
title: Quality headset, but I wouldn't confidently suggest for a professional gamer

author: Andrei Perciotto
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
review_content: The unit I got had obviously been used before being sent to me, I guess that’s fine.Sound quality is subpar but in line with the cost. It’s ok for gaming since you can definitely determine if the sound is coming from left or right, but would not recommend for movies or anything with dialogues. Voices sound weird with these.There are 2 audio jacks, one for audio and one for mic and I can’t get the mic to work when the sound cable is connected to the ps4 controller.Quality is ok, the lights are a plus if you are into that. Mic mute button is also a plus. I would definitely invest a bit more money and get something more expensive but for the price, they are ok.
title: Ok

author: Dirty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
review_content: So, first off...good pair of headphones for a great price.  The sound is good, they are comfortable (huge plus for me), and nice looking.Just 2 issues I had with them (fairly minor):1.  My ears started to sweat after about 5 minutes of wearing them.  So, I had to kinda air my ears out a bit by moving them off my ear a little for air flow.2.  The mic piece is not easy to move with one hand.  Now, I don't want it to be super loose but I want to be able to move the microphone without my entire headset going the same way I'm moving the mic.  I had to use my other hand to hold onto the headphones while moving the mic up.UPDATE:  After some time wearing the headphones during cooler weather with the temp down an additional degree...sweating has not been a problem.  I've been able to wear them for an hour or so without any issues of sweaty ears/head.
title: Good Headphones / Couple Personal Issues

author: Daniel Fana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2018
review_content: I use these headphones for Xbox Gaming. The headphones themselves are pretty bulky and heavy to wear so they can be pretty noticeable. They are comfortable on the ears, not so much on the head. But the sound quality is great. A little too bass heavy for my taste, but a lot of people really like that so I won't knock it. There is a very very slight buzz but when you're gaming, you don't notice it at all. Your voice comes in crisp and clear to others hearing you.The only thing I'm genuinely disappointed on is the light feature. It seems like this is made more for PC Gaming because the USB cable is VERY short. The way the entire cable works is that it is run as a single cable from the headset and then splits into two different cables towards the end. One is the 3.5mm jack to plug into the Xbox controller. The other is the USB drive, which is used to power the lights on the headset. When it is split, the distance is very short, less than 1 foot I'd say. So it makes the USB/light feature utterly useless when using on a console. Very disappointing in that aspect. Now I just have a dead weight hanging off the controller while playing. I highly recommend this for PC gaming, not so much for console gaming.
title: A little heavy, but great sound.

author: MasterAP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_content: Picked up this headset because I had a poor experience with comfort from a different brand.This headset is incredibly comfortable to wear. The earmuffs don't squeeze my ears and cause headaches like some other headsets. The headband has nice cushions that give this headset quite the comfortable aspect to gaming.The sound is immersive. Everything comes through clearly. The microphone captures and relays chat in a crisp and clear quality. I have not noticed any static or delay.This headset has a split end. One is the 3.5mm audio plug and the other is for a USB port. This split is only about two or three inches apart. You have to plug in the USB to turn on the colored lights. So if you want to play with the lights on, you have to have your controller right next to your console. That is very awkward. I'm guessing the USB plug is primarily for PC play.For the purposes for which I ordered this headset, to chat in Xbox One gameplay, this headset provides an excellent quality experience.I would recommend this for any general Xbox One gamer.
title: Comfortable Fit!

author: Cruzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: I love the sound of these headphones and wish I could give them 5 stars, however let me just start by saying the padding is very comfortable on the ears, so you can wear these for some time without any discomfort. The sound quality is superb! I used them when playing video games and I can hear the surround sound clean and clear, with a nice ambiance. Unlike other headphones that are too snug/tight around the ears, these feel like they give a little  space inside which allows your ears breathing room so they don't feel compressed. This also allows for that surround sound to be heard nicely. Being an Audiophile I'm a stickler for sound quality and these deliver!The only problem I came across is a short in the jack which began to cause loud static when plugging it into the controller in less than a month of receiving it. In that time I didn't even use it much, so I shouldn't be having this problem this early on. As of now they are rendered useless. Other than that, I would probably get these again because the sound quality is really that good. I just may ask for an exchange, or refund being this seems to be a manufacturer error, and I would hope the issue with the jack will not repeat itself with another pair, otherwise if it did, I would return to change my rating to 1 star for poor manufacturing and performance.UPDATE:The seller provided great customer service and sent me another pair at no charge. I am changing my rating to 5 star as these do not have the same issue and sound spectacular!
title: Great Sound, but Short Lived. - UPDATE!

author: iAmElectric
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: I purchased three of these headsets for all three of my children as Christmas gifts for use on Xbox One S. Since all three kids have their own Xbox One controllers, these headsets plug straight into the controllers and allow them all to play local multiplayer games together without all the noise from the game disturbing my wife and me.However, there are those times when the kids are in bed asleep that I slip on one of these headsets and play Forza Horizon Motorsport 7 myself. Playing this game with this headset is an entirely better level of gameplay than without. I’m impressed with how this headset makes me hear ever sound of the racetrack and tell which side another car is trying to pass me. Plus the passive noise isolation does an excellent job of blocking out external noise. I can never play Forza Motorsport again without “borrowing” one of my kids’ RUNNUS headsets. It really makes me feel like I’m really in the game!Oh, I almost forgot to mention how affordable these were and the quality of build. These headsets feel very sturdy and seem durable enough to survive regular use from my three kids. Although only time will tell how durable they actually are, they sure don’t feel flimsy or cheap like other headsets I’ve tried. It’s surprising how well built they are for the price they are offered. All the positive reviews are accurate. This headset is one of the best electronics values on Amazon.
title: Must have for Xbox One families!

author: JeffdaRev
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: Note: I upgraded my rating not due to the product but for their customer service. They supplied me with a free item from their store since the headphones didn’t meet my expectations. A+ for customer service!Product feels solid and well made. Came with extra wire in case you needed for your set up. Along with my manual I was given a (random) bonus for a free item for simply giving them a review. This would be awesome for playing a campaign mode or computer work.The negatives:It’s not a talk-back mode where you hear yourself when you talk.You don’t flip up the mic to turn it off. It’s on the cord...not a biggie but a pain to fumble with.The worse thing has nothing to do with the vendor. Whenever I play online with my friends I have to have the volume up load to hear (people running and sneaking up on you.) Unfortunately this causes an echo with all my gaming buddies on the other end like my old corded headset did.I’m going to have to return these and spend the extra money for wireless headphones I guess. I do not know why the Xbox allows plugged headphones to be used without causing echoes for everyone?
title: Great solid product but best for campaign modes

author: Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
review_content: I use flight and racing sims along with Voice Attack, the voice recognition game control software. I play mostly using VR but there are two sims that are not VR compatible and I wanted a decent headset with a good microphone for those two games. The RUNMUS Gaming Headset filled the bill for me at a very affordable price. The audio and microphone quality are very good and the headset has a solid, quality feel to it.  Personally I would have liked a lighter weight connection cable and volume/mic control unit but they are workable. The ear cups are larger than I like but are certainly comfortable. My only negative issue was the "fit" of the headset itself. I have a smaller, narrower head and the lack of adjustability of the earcups presented a challenge. It was not a problem to get the earcups centered over my ears, what I had difficulty with was "sealing" the bottom of the earcups because of the simple design. I worked out a way to get them to fit better using about 1/2" of cushioned foam to have the headset sit higher on my head and get the angle of the earcups on the side of my head aligned better.  Now that I worked that out I am enjoying using this nice quality headset.  The mic enables me to use Voice Attack with these two non-VR sims.
title: Great value, adjustability for secure fit could be better!

author: Danbo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: Upgraded from a cheaper, over-ear Logitech that hurt my ears after an hour or so of gaming. These (my first true gaming headset) do well to sit OVER the ears to relieve pressure. They do trap heat so you need to open them up from time to time and let your ears breath some. The mic seems pretty good as my colleagues had no issue hearing me. They're not true noise-canceling (to me) and it's a bit weird right now hearing my voice inside my head when I talk (it's the effect you get when you have water in your ears) but I think time will make this a moot point.The lighting feature is completely optional (USB), I don't need it so I don't plug that part of the cord in. Cord length is good for a gaming tower sitting on the ground next to the desk. It's also made of the heavy duty braided stuff.I was surprised at the weight of the product as it sits comfortably enough over the head and doesn't feel heavy despite its size. Lots of plastic in the construction helps with this. They are, however, a bit cumbersome because all of the added flair on the sides and top band but overall, not too bad.All in all, a good starter, in-budget gaming headset for me. Quality seems good for now but longevity is to be determined. Right now I use it for No Man's Sky, DCS World (with TrackIR, so I wear the baseball cap with this headset over the cap without issue), American Truck Simulator, and Green Hell and it does the job well - certainly placing you at the center of the action.
title: Does What it Says. Good for the Price Point.

author: S. Xiong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
review_content: I thought I would order a different headset for my son. I ordered this one after looking at the reviews and ratings.  The day it arrived it was already in trouble.  Almost all of my amazon shipments come in a box.  This one came in those grey bags.  Once I opened the gray bag, the box was broken and opened (I ordered it in new condition).  I plugged it in my computer, played about 30 minutes of game, and the sound quality was good. I tried the microphone on the game to talk to my son, and the microphone was not working. My son could not hear me in game. I swapped back in my old headset just to make sure it wasn't my computer, and my OLD headset was working. I re-plugged in THIS headset, and the microphone was NOT working.  Oh well, sending this one back in for a refund and ordering my old headset for my son.
title: Microphone was not working

author: Gramma B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: My husband has very limited hearing and cannot hear the audio on most videos unless the volume is turned to a level that is dangerous to the rest of the household.  Having headphones is the only viable solution for everyone, but his previous sets kept breaking because the head strap wasn't sturdy enough for heavy daily use.  We decided to try the gamers set because they are designed for heavy daily use.  He loves the fit of the RumMus set, very comfortable with a well padded, adjustable head band and the ear pieces are large enough to fit completely around his ears, plus well padded.  This headset totally cancels outside noise, I now have to tap his shoulder to get his attention, no more shouting for the other side of the room.  The microphone and lights are not something he will use, so we can't review that part.  The length of the cord is perfect for him to watch video on his tablet while in his recliner, short enough not to tangle him up. We have only had these two days and will update the review when he has used them longer.  For now he really likes them and the set is meeting all his needs.
title: Excellant for a senior with hearing loss

author: Hotpockitrockit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2019
review_content: I purchased this headset because of the high number of reviews.The headset looks very nice,  has good construction and fits nicely over my ears.When I used the headphones, the first thing I noticed was the sound was not very balanced.  There is a lot of low mid and bass, and is not balanced out by the high mids and highs. I compared these back and forth to several other headphones I own and the others seem to be a lot more balanced, although some lacking in the bass response .Overall these are good for the price, just keep in mind that you may have to EQ them if possible
title: Good overall. Lots of mid/bass, not very balanced

author: Tomas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
review_content: I bought this headset as a birthday gift for my younger brother who's a heavy gamer.  After a few days, he's expressed excitement over the difference it's had in his performances and immersion.His first experience was playing Red Dead Redemption 2, in which he felt pulled into the atmosphere of the game.  Hoofbeats, rain, thunder, commotion, railroads, and gunfire provided a level of depth that he hadn't experienced before.  The presence of bass is fairly impressive with these ambiences.He then told me that wearing the headphones while playing competitive multiplayer games like Titanfall or Apex have allowed him to better anticipate from where nearby enemies approach thanks to the surround sound.The padding on the ears and band is almost excessive but perhaps that's just an attempt to ensure you feel more comfortable during longer listening sessions.  My brother, having an average sized head, says he doesn't feel any discomfort though.For a pair of $40 headphones which can be used with nearly any electronic device, the audio quality is better than anticipated.  As for the build quality and durability, I can't say much.  The majority of it is plastic and it feels and sounds like it's delicate, but as my family does with all electronics, treat devices with a lot of care.  Many devices are built with plastic after all.*SPECIAL NOTE:  If you're playing on an Xbox One, you'll need a Microsoft headset adapter into which you'll plug the headphones' auxilliary jack ONLY if you don't have newer model Xbox One controllers.  I could be wrong but the controllers included and sold during the circulation of the original Xbox One have a lone headset port that is exclusively designed for the Microsoft Xbox One headsets and this port isn't compatible with most, if not all, aftermarket headsets including the RUNMUS K2.  My brother does play on an Xbox One X though, and the included controllers are updated with a standard AUX port just to the left of the older headset port.  Don't be too trusting but I speculate that more than likely, retailers selling Xbox One controllers nowadays will have an AUX port and you won't need the Microsoft adapter.  Just be sure to check though.  Better to be safe than sorry.  Sadly if your controller is an older model, you'd be better off buying a newer model of Xbox One controller, because the Microsoft headset adapters I've seen average about $80 alone which is insane for an adapter.  Your standard, uncustomized Xbox One controllers are around $60 MSRP.Overall my brother has been very happy with his gift and is using it daily so far.  If you're looking for surprising performance in a practically universal headset and you're on a budget, I'd recommend giving these a go.  For the price, I'm sure you or to whomever you're gifting will enjoy the experience.Edit for those saying it's really quiet:  I encountered this issue when helping my brother with the testing.  Go into your console settings and adjust your device settings.  When he first plugged them in and they were overly quiet, even when increasing the TV's volume or the volume dial on the headset to maximum, I went to the settings and increased the headset volume from 50% to 100% and that made a big difference.
title: Impressive performance considering the price tag

author: Infren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_content: For my first gaming headset, I'm really impressed! I was originally using my webcam as a mic in addition to my headphones which lacked a mic on the audio cord, but that setup was getting real old real fast. I got this one because the reviews looked pretty good, and because I have a bad history with headphones and earbuds breaking and dying pretty fast.I haven't had these for long, but I'm very impressed so far. The mic picks up my voice pretty well, and I really appreciate the fact that the mic piece can be moved and adjusted, not just up and down but closer and away from your mouth. The sound quality in the headset is really good for the price, although I would say maybe the volume needs a little bit of work. Enough background noise still gets through the headset, but I personally don't mind. I really appreciate the fact that the cord has a button you can press to mute or unmute the mic as well as a volume adjustment wheel so you don't have to change your computer's volume.I will add that the headset needs to be at a certain angle on your head in order for your mic to pick up everything you say clearly if you talk quietly. If you're a loud talker like me, you won't have an issue no matter where the mic is, but sometimes when my family is sleeping, I need to speak softly, so sometimes the mic won't pick up my quieter talking.Overall, I would recommend this to someone for their first headset or if they're buying on a budget.
title: Good budget headset

author: KPacch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: Pros:LightweightExtrasComfortSoundDurabilityCons:Noise CancellationSize  I don't think I would have found a better headset for the price. I needed something to get me through the week after my earbuds got eaten by my pets so I searched for something cheap and got better than what I expected. The headset has quality stereo that I would compare to my friend's $70 HyperX. It most certainly is much lighter and that I appreciate because I can wear it all day without discomfort. Likewise it has padding that swallows your face like a La-Z-Boy which has me hardly noticing it.  The controls are simple and I never had an issue with muting myself or adjusting the volume. The material it is made of seems like thick polymer-like plastic that seems durable enough while maintaining a light weight which I'm not aggressive with my gear so I'm sure it will last me a couple years. However; the sizing is a bit ridiculous in my opinion. You can expand the headset if you've got a larger head and as someone that wears 7 1/4 caps I have an average size for a male but I have it shortened all the way and can not imagine how large of a head someone must have to have it all the way expanded. In other words; if you've got a small head then it may be too large and if you have a large head then this certainly fits. Lastly the headset comes with an AUX or USB plugin in addition to a split AUX jack for sharing the sound which is great because I switch between PC and Playstation. For less than 30 dollars I don't think you're going to get a headset much better than this.
title: The Bang is Worth the Buck

author: Rex W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
review_content: These are hands down the best headsets I have ever owned, and amazingly well priced.They are bulky (but not over-sized), strong, well-built, comfortable ear foam allows for hours of use. Sound quality is amazing.I used these playing Red Dead Redemption 2, and I heard everything as if I was there in real life.... The rain drops sound was phenomenal, the animal sounds seemed lifelike, the horses galloping was terrific, the trains... All in all I heard things from farther away then if I just was using my TV speakers (This could be because of the use of a headset alone - but sound quality is top notch)So you are able to use these on:  * XBox One (Newer Models with the headset jack)  * Playstation 4  * Nintendo Switch  * Windows Based Computers (Desktop and Laptop)  * Macintosh based computers (Desktop and Laptop)  * Tablets  * Most Cell PhonesThey are compatible with everything that has a 3.5 mm audio jack....DISCLAIMER: Inside the box I received, was a chance to receive a bonus gift if you left a review. This review is honest and unbiased, and I will update if anything changes. But for now, I need to run and use these, took too long to review - I need to play some Red Dead Redemption 2.
title: All other reviews are accurate 5 Stars

author: MamaBear
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my son to use with his PS4 because they are advertised as compatible for the PS4. However, this headset has two separate plugs, one for the mic, one for audio and it has a separate usb plug for the lights. The PS4 controller only has one audio import so you can't use the mic and audio at the same time, which is pointless. And in order to use the lights, you would have to be one foot from the PS4 console. Waste of money.
title: Not for PS4

author: Mark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
review_content: I'll be honest - I didn't expect much out of a $30-40 headset.  But I just needed something I could use for zoom calls, so I bought this one, and I have to say I'm pretty impressed.First thing is the size - I have literally never bought a pair of headphones where I didn't have to put the size all the way up to max to accommodate my gigantic head.  But this one - I only have to set it maybe halfway to maximum size.  I am scared though as to what the person would look like who has to max out the size on this.Next, the sound quality is surprisingly good.  Again, I wasn't expecting much, but music and movies sound quite good on this.Plus it comes with all kinds of different connectors - there's a 3.5" mm mic+audio plug, and then an adapter that plugs into that that splits into separate 3.5" audio and 3.5" recording plugs.  Then there's also a USB port to plug into a computer or something that will allow turn on those cool red LEDs.Definitely pleased with this one, but now the question is how long will it last!
title: surprisingly good quality for the price - and it fits my humongous head!

author: Mary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: The piece that plugs into the controller is too close to the USB part of the cord; constantly pulls out (USB is for the lights). You can either have it plugged into the ps4, or the ps4 controller. Because it doesn't reach both.I can still hear my fan blowing in the background pretty well, so the noise cancelation isn't as good as I expected it to be.Sound quality; i have a hard time hearing people talking. It's pretty low quality. (I expected it to be better based on all the reviews)I would not buy this product again. Unless they made a USB longer from the cord that plugs into controller, & the ps4 itself. Also, it would be nice to have the option of it being corded and wireless at the same time.Overall, it's not terrible. It has It's flaws, but it will work for now. It's a good back up.Also, the headset itself is very large, and not super comfortable. My head is big, but it's even a little too big for me and I can't make it any smaller.The lights do light up, they are bright & pretty. But I can't plug it in and light it up because I have to hold it 6 inches away from the PS4 itself.
title: Good but not great

author: Jack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: These headsets are quite large and bulky.  If you have a narrow-ish face, expect them to fit very loosely.  They don't really "hug" my head much at all.  When I tilt my head downward to pick something up off the floor, the headsets slide a bit.  With that being said, the headsets fit my spouse much better.  They are more snug and don't move around so much with simple movements.We like that they came with an optional adapter that splits the single headset jack into two separate jacks for older computers. The ear pads are comfortable enough.  The USB lights seem like a gimmick that we will likely never use.  The sound quality is as we expected for the price (nothing to write home about, but our kids don't care).  They don't feel very durable, but only time will tell.We were looking for a pair of decent headsets for our teens that wouldn't break the bank.  While we'll keep the pair we bought, we will look elsewhere for the two additional sets that we still need.
title: Loose fitting.  Sound quality as expected for price

author: Gfeltifish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_content: UPDATE: I wrote the initial review after only using for a short time. The microphone stopped working after about 7 or 8 uses each for about 1-2 hours at a time. They had sent me another one for free for writing the first review below. I tried that and it died after just 1 use. I wrote them a message and they replaced the first broken one for free. However it worked for 1 use as well and now the microphone is dead again. This is a really crappy product for the microphone to just stop working for no reason. If you just need for audio it seems to work fine which is why it gets 2 stars. But if you need it for a headset, which it what it is advertised for, look elsewhere. I'm told the MSI and Hyper X brands are where I should go. They run about $50.I bought this to use for online PC gaming, specifically for Project Cars 2 and discord chat. It works really well. Came with the adapter to plug into PC (splitter) and did not require any specific set up except to adjust mic volume since my last headset was not very good. It felt a little stiff on my head at first, but I used for over 2 hours right out of the box and it didn't bother me or feel uncomfortable. I also tried it out briefly on my PS4 and it seems to work well for it too.
title: Really crappy product, don't buy.

author: Jason Sipp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I got these so I can game after I put my son done and still crank up the volume. Out of the box I noticed that these are solid. They seem very well built. The sound is crisp and clear. The volume is adjustable and gets plenty loud. The 7.1 surround is great. Hearing the foot steps of your enemy walking around you is really cool. Nice bright LEDs that my son thinks are the best thing in the world.  The mic seems to work just fine. I have had anyone tell me that they can't hear me. And I have been told my voice comes through clear every time. I have not had any issues with audio feedback either. That is a huge plus.  Lastly, the cord and cord connection to the headset are solid and I do not foresee this coming loose like many other headsets. Overall these are everything I wanted when I was looking for a headset. I live by the reviews and these had tons of great reviews.
title: Crisp, clear sound. Comfortable

author: salade122
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: Overall it's a nice headset. The sound quality is good, not too heavy, and are pretty comfortable. I wish the USB port activated the mic and sound on PC. It lights up when the USB is plugged in but the jacks do need to be used for the mic and sound functions to work.UPDATE: The headset works wonderfully on it's own. However, I still wish that the USB port made the microphone and sound work on it's own without having to use the jacks. This is specifically because the USB port on my PC is located in the front panel and the jacks are located in the back. So, using the USB port for the mic and sound function would be much more functional and practical.The update to 5 stars though is for customer service. They really care about their product and want to ensure their customers are thoroughly satisfied with their product. RUNMUS is easy to work with and very responsive. So, if you do have any issues with your product they will do their best to help you out.
title: Good headset

author: Christine Fehr
