date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019
review_content: TL: DRPROS: Crisp Stereo Sound and Good Surround Sound for its price.  Mic has good responsiveness  Comfortable strong design.  Easy to set up Plugin and go  Durable cloth wiring.  Good Noise Canceling and large ear muffs CONS: Heavy  Microphone light is immersion breaking if you're not in the zone.  Noise Canceling is not as great on thinner heads.  Surround Sound could be better.  Right of the bat, the first thing you know about the headphone after unboxing is that these are both heavy and quite large.  Whether it's the massive padding or not insignificant size of the earmuffs these headphones are ready to take on even the largest of ears. Putting them on this fact is also reinforced but while hefty they are rather comfortable, something that I suspect will only increase with time as I break them in.  With them being plug in and go on essentially every platform with a fancy splitter for PC and a proper rope cord incasing the wiring, I'm incredibly impressed with the headset right out of the box. The sound is good right out of the box and gives an excellent stereo performance, and while the surround sound is a bit flat in sound depth your never really going to get 100+ surround sound performance out of 30$ headphones. Truthfully I'm rather impressed that the surround sound is a good as it is because while flat it also sounds good and doesn't lose very much tone quality.  On the gamer side, the one true gripe I have on the headphones other than how heavy they are on your head is that the microphone glows. Always. This wouldn't be so much of an issue if the microphone went down more than about 120 degrees but having the microphone always a beacon in your peripheral vision is a bit immersion breaking at times. Otherwise, the mic is a clear passible microphone that gives a solid performance for its price class.  Overall at 30$ with tax right now this headset is a steal for how durable it seems, paired with how clear the sound is, this headset is worth the buy.
title: A Review of the Red RUNMUS Gaming headset Model: K2

author: Ocean Engineer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: Appear large, but they are actually quite light and comfortable on the head. Actually very comfortable - fit my big head without being tight. Ear pads are cushy and provide enough room between the ear and the speaker as well as covering the ears well.  Audio is very good, but favors the low end.  Came with an adapter to split the jack into audio and mic which I needed.  Cable is long and appears to be quite sturdy as it comes with some sort of braiding around it. Build quality appears very good.The mic noise cancelling on PC tends to distort the audio in so I don 't use it, but it works well without it. To get the LED's to light you need to plug in a second USB cable. It appears its function is only to light the LEDs, so you can leave it unplugged. If you don't have a spare USB port on your PC or laptop, but want to impress people with the glowing LEDs, you can use a USB portable power bank.
title: headset with very good sound and clear mic

author: Caz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: I can most definitely say I have no regret's with my purchase. The sound quality is amazing, it has great noise cancellation, and it is extremely comfortable to wear. Even though the headset is made of plastic, it feels very sturdy, and does not bend easily. The lights on the outside are nice and bright, which is great for an LED fanatic like myself. Do note that they aren't RGB LEDs. This isn't a big bummer for me, but just a good thing to know for others before purchasing. Another great feature is that in the box, along with the headphones and a small instruction manual, there is also an adapter that allows for you to use these headphones on planes (where they require a double audio jack plug). Finally, it also includes a little booklet explaining that if you write a review for these headphones, you get a free item from a small list of items, one of which is another pair of the same headphones. That effectively means that I am paying $15 for these headsets as opposed to $30. Overall, I am completely satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend this to my friends and family
title: THESE HEADPHONES ARE AWESOME!!!

author: khaleel alsaadi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
review_content: First of all, this headset is really impressive for the price. I am getting amazing sound out of it. I noticed two things that I did not like.First, it is not quite glasses friendly. I can't wear my glasses with this headset properly because it is covering my entire ears. In a way, covering my entire ears makes this headset comfortable, but it is also hard to use my glasses. This is not a big issue, I can still use my glasses tilted slightly down.Second, the noise cancellation is good, but not great. I can still here everything around me clearly. I think this is happens because the headset feels slightly loose on the ears for me.My overall impression? this is great for the price. I do not think you can find something with this quality with the same price. If you don't want to spend so much money, buy this one! it wont disappoint you.
title: Really impressive for the price

author: Thöm Frost
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: *Edit 10/21/2019*They sent me a replacement and it works better. Customer service is great, but there is a quality control issue.Gave them an extra star for the customer service.*Original*The mic is hard to adjust to get it to where people can hear you.The sound volume is not that great. I turned everything up to max and its not that loud. Not asking for brake my ear drums loud but it should be louder then what it was. I have a $20 pair of ear buds and tried that to see if there was that much of a difference and i had to turn the sound down to 60%.Not sure if i got a bad pair. I am going to work with these for a few more days and try them out on some other systems to see what happens. Right now i don't think i will be keeping them.There is a volume control on the cord and i have it as far as it will go and still no sound improvement.
title: Don't expect much. For $30 i wasn't expecting blow me away performance. *Edit*

author: maryann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
review_content: Everything it advertised is spot-on.The mobile headphone jack for use with a combined headphone & mic jack was helpful and they even included an extra adapter in case I needed to use it with my pc.Cons:1. The main reason for the 3-stars is the durability factor. It feels like one good drop or wandering pets getting caught in the cord would break it in half.2. Due to the durability, the force required to move the mic could also be a problem. Mine was very tight so I have to hold the mic near the bottom and get a good grip on the earpiece it attached to before moving it.Pros:1. Earpiece is very soft and comfortable for people with sensitive ears.2. Sound quality is very good.3. Gaming sounds were picked up very clearly and I could even hear the game's background noises.4. Noise Cancellation was also very good, even with a nearby room fan running.5. Mic was sensitive enough to pick up my chatting even when I was speaking softly. However, the initial volume level it transmitted at was a little low. I had to go into my sound settings and turn it up a little.6. The cord is cloth covered and very flexible. It will not stay coiled up like those cheaper plastic coated ones can. I have also noticed this tends to help reduce tangling as well.7. The inline switch panel worked reliably for the last week or so that I have been using it. The volume went up or down with the dial and the mic on/off switch was very reliable.
title: Good headset but needs a little work

author: Scott McDowell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: Pros: super comfortable padding, extremely durable and flexible, great noise canceling (my wife was vacuuming while I was playing a game and I could her a slight hum in the background), amazing sound quality with a rich deep bass, love the thick well protected cord and the lights are a nice added aesthetic feature, but not necessarily something one needs while gaming. Lastly, I have a big noggin and this fit great, especially with the adjustments on the side. My friends said the mic sound was nice and clear.Cons: not many and they are minor. After having it on for a while, the padding on the top can cause your hair to look like a case of bed head. Lastly, while the mic and sound quality are amazing, I wish there was a feature to lower the sound of the game while keeping the mic a little higher. Maybe it's something I can adjust on my PS4 in the settings, but I couldn't find it. Basically, while chatting with friends, the game sound can overpower the conversations you have.
title: PS4: Quality sound, mic and comfort

author: TJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
review_content: So let me just say this to begin with, I was looking for a USB headset to use for work. I knew it was a gamble since it came with multiple inputs, with that being said it did not work for my purpose. Now the real review: My daughter is a gamer and when I showed her the headset her eyes lit up like Christmas.  I told her that the headset would not work for me, but she could test it out..big mistake on my end. She is in love, she loves the size and style. The headset is perfect in weight and feel for her, the cushion head set, big ear cuff, the noise canceling, and big bonus it has a controllable mic including volume control. The usb really acts to light up the headset as fair as I could tell and the headset came with for adaptor for the plug-in for pc/laptop and game controller. With that being said, this will not be returned at all because it has been confiscated. :)
title: My kid loves it!!!

author: anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: I cover a lot of specifics in the review, especially in the cons at the end. I use this for pc.Bottom line... If you want a good gaming headset, buy this. I am picky, cynical and am not impressed easily.PROS:I don't know how they can sell such a great product for as cheap as they do and still turn a profit. I was immediately taken back by how Big these are. Wow. They completely cover my ears easily. The foam makes for a comfy fit. The first night they actually started to give me a slight headache feeling because they were nice and tight which is what I wanted.. My last set would slip if I looked down. I have purposefully over extended them to "stretch" them out and these still stay right in place even if I shake my head. The sound quality is really good, definitely exceeded my expectations. They don't have noise canceling properties, but the fit of the thick foam pads around the ears do muffle a lot of any background noise. I have to remove them to hear my girlfriend talk to me, even if I'm not listening to anything, other headsets I've been able to leave on no problem.They are super comfortable and extremely well built. They are big as I said, but it's not all cheap light weight plastic. They are high quality and feel solid, but not too heavy. The fact they light up is irrelevant to me but still cool I guess..People say they hear me perfectly, rarely do they hear background noise like they did before. If they do, it has to be pretty loud and pretty close.. For example, people might hear my girlfriend standing a foot away from my computer desk and purposefully raising her voice. If she talks in normal inside voice the mic doesn't pick it up. Nobody has complained about breathing noises, they can't hear me when I adjust my mic, if my cat bumps my headset, if I take a drink or bite of something....CONS:I guess I'd consider this more of a neutral list instead of cons... But anyway... The headset plugs in the back of the pc with USB and two audio plugs, a green and red/pink. My last two headsets with mics only ever used a USB. Not a real issue though I guess. It would take up your speaker plug in if you had speakers you'd have to unplug them for this headset in order to use it. The volume/mute control box hangs a bit low and has no clip like my last headsets, the clip was nice to clip it on your shirt so it's easier and closer to grab. This box hangs level to the bottom of my chair when wearing the headphones. It can be annoying to keep moving that little box or having to reach for it because it keeps slipping off of my lap. I am 5' 8" in a office style chair.The chord is short relative to other headsets I've had. It's long enough to reach to the back of my pc and leave some slack, but not much slack. I can't lean over to throw something away in a trash can a few ft away. Luckily my pc sits on my desk, if it was on the floor ( I know a lot of people who do this) it definitely would not reach because it requires you to plug in audio plugs which are generally in the back of the pc.
title: Amazing deal. High quality.

author: Folly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2019
review_content: Firstly, this headset is amazingly comfortable. Both the ears and the headrest have cushions that are thick, and soft yet also sturdy. I can tell these will endure many years and continue to feel great.As for sound quality, using them on PC, out of the box it's not good at all. Honestly among the worst quality I've heard from both the speakers and the mic.BUT, this is entirely because they ship without any software, so they default to Microsoft's universal sound drivers which are pretty terrible.What I did was download some free software called Equalizer APO, and spent several hours playing with knobs and dials. When I was finished this headset had some of the best sound and mic quality I've ever heard, easily on par with $100+ headsets.If you're willing to put in a little bit of effort, then I absolutely recommend this headset. Amazing deal for the price.
title: Great headphones, with a bit of effort.

author: LinuxHack3r
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: First, let me state that I have never owned a pc gaming headset before. I recently finished building a gaming PC, and as such, decided I needed a microphone and a way to hear others! I looked through the typical big names (Razer, Logitech, etc). I decided I'd try a well received but cheaper product. This is how I found the Runmus that I purchased.Overall, it works great. Are there better headsets out there? Probably. I haven't used any of the more expensive ones, so it is very difficult for me to answer that.However, what this headset accomplishes is being a huge value for the money. I've worn it for hours and it is extremely comfortable. Let me repeat that: It is extremely comfortable even after many hours of wearing. I have another pair of bluetooth (speaker only, no microphone) headphones and they are nowhere near as comfortable. I'm actually amazed at how luxurious this thing feels on my head.Sound. I have mainly been playing Apex Legends with an occasional mix of Skyrim Special Edition. For both of these games, the sound is adequate. I can hear the in game sounds and teammates well enough. Again, perhaps there is better sound out there in better products, but this is totally worth $25.00.My teammates say they can hear me well enough, so I guess the microphone works well too.
title: Completely worth the money ($25 or less)

author: Huskies117
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
review_content: My wife recently got into playing games on the Xbox One. I had a BENGOO G9000 Stereo Headset for myself and was letting her borrow it, but she said it was not a good fit for her. After doing some comparison shopping, I decided this headset was the best balance of quality and affordability, and I have no regrets.The headset is super comfortable. There is no active noise-canceling, but the earpads muffle most surrounding noises (fans, refrigerators, etc.). The microphone control is very smooth, easy to turn off and on, and sounds crystal clear when streaming to Twitch. I find the surround sound is a step above my BENGOO stereo headset.I recommend this headset to anyone who wants a good quality and affordable headset, either for personal use or as a gift. A pro gamer may want something more high-end, but this headset is perfect for anyone not doing competitive gaming.
title: Great Deal for a Great Headset

author: Jacob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: These headphones are not what I was hoping for when I ordered them.The actual audio quality coming from them is decent enough and there comfortable to wear for several hours at a time. This is where the good part of the review ends, though.I have two major issues that severely impact my opinion of this headset. First of all it's the way it hooks up. It's not a simple USB input; it requires being hooked directly into your computer's audio jack. So in order to use the headphones, I have to unhook my very nice BOSE speakers, which are SIGNIFICANTLY better sound quality. In theory, if the cord were separated about 1 foot further up than it is I could have both plugged in, but that's not really an option with the way the cord is laid out and my desk setup.The second, and larger, issues with it I have is the microphone quality. I had to turn up three separate input settings to maximum to get it to register my voice at an audible level, and having it up that high causes background static and feedback when I talk into it sometimes. Sadly, the microphone is mostly why I bought this given the need to speak to play Pathfinder/D&D on a weekly basis, and to chat in calls for whatever other reason. So to say I'm disappointed in the absolute garbage quality of the microphone is an understatement.Find another alternative if you're looking at this for gaming or even general use. This isn't worth it.
title: Got it for the microphone, extremely disappointed

author: M N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2019
review_content: About the seller - shipping was fast, on-time and item as described. Would buy again without hesitation.About the item, Gaming Headset for Xbox One in Red. After using for about a week I can say that overall I am pleased with the purchase considering the price I paid. Some brief Cons and Pros.Cons.1. The headphones seem large but that may just be me. I am used to a set of Bluetooth headphones that do not have a mic and do not completely cover the ears and are about half the size.2.  As other reviews have pointed out, they seem to get a bit warm if worn for hours on end. More so on a warm day. However, maybe that is simply an indication I am playing too long and should take breaks anyway :)3.  The over-the-head section is plastic and has a bit of flex to it. I would prefer to see something more rigid plastic or even a bit of lightweight metal for structural reinforcement.  Not sure about the long-term fit.Pros.1. Starting with the over-the-head section. There is a very thick pad underneath that makes wearing them comfortable. Also, they don't press to firmly on the side of my head which may be the case if the over-the-head part had less flex.2. As I said above, the over-the-ear parts seem a bit warm after hours of use, but they also have thick padding and makes them very comfortable to wear. Additionally they completely cover the ears and so block out room noise so that game play is immersive.3. The mic is a much better quality than expected. I recorded myself a couple of times and was very surprised in the clarity and the lack of background noise produced from the mic. A major plus since I was purchasing these for mic use as I am often told that the mic on my Kinect makes me sound like I am in a tunnel far away.....4. As far as overall sound quality, this is my first experience with a gaming head set. I can say that I am also pleased with the sound quality produced. I have typically played my Xbox with a 7.1 surround stereo system and can say that I am pleased with the sound directional environment produced as well as the lows and highs.In summary I am pleased with my purchase. This is my first gaming head set so should I buy something like this again I might use a little more scrutiny BUT I am willing to bet if I were to go that route I would easily pay 2 or 3 times more than I did. As my first gaming head set I am pleased and can say that if you are on a budget and want to try something with confidence that has a great mic, sounds good, and sells for a great price I would certainly give them a try!
title: Good quality for the price and pleased with purchase.

author: Peter Pranata
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: I ordered this having high expectations since the reviews are so high but it was quick to disappoint. I tried playing games with it for a while and my takeaway is pretty bad:Sound Quality (1/5): I know its cheap but the sound was way worse than my $40 old headset. The treble was pretty bad and clarity was poor. I tried listening to some pop music and it was okay but the sound quality actually kinda bothered me when gaming I switched back to my old headset that's kinda broken...Material (2/5): It's cheaply made and but not too bad. For the price, I could understand but the entire thing seems to be plastic-y if you get what I mean. The earmuffs were not bad, but the cloth felt like it almost comes off once in a while. Not the best for long hours since the headset itself was quite bulky and heavy too.Mic (4/5): This is probably where it shines the most. The mic was definitely good and clear, way beyond my expectation but then, I wish it could go down further since it sort of hang in between my nose and mouse so it was kinda annoying.Overall, I think it would be better to spend a little bit more on a better headset than this one. I get why it has so many reviews now; the company rewards those who submits a review a chance to win some free stuff and gift card so no wonder so many people reviewed it...just like me but well, I don't get why it was all good reviews when the headset is literally clunky.
title: Great mic, very bad build and sound.

author: Carla H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: Bought this for my husband because his wireless one (RIG 800LX) suddenly stopped recognizing the Xbox One after ~1 year and he requested a wired one. This seemed like an good and affordable option based on the previous reviews and it was available for next day delivery. Using the lights isn't really practical since the TV is far away so we can't comment on that aspect and I didn't buy it for that purpose. Overall the headset is a good value but at the time of reviewing this (today is the 21st and purchased on the 18th) it is now $6 cheaper so that kind of sucks. About the product, he says the ear cups are very comfortable, the mic is good and he says it is pretty comparable to the RIG headset, which I think was around $120. So rest assured you'll get your money's worth. I only hope it lasts longer than the RIG did.
title: A very good choice

author: Huckleberry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
review_content: You get what you pay for, right?  Well. not always, but in this case, you get more - much more.  Solid, sturdy, comfortable and fantastic sound both listening and the microphone.  Got it in ONE day.7.1 in games that support it changes everything.  On the EFT kick right now, which doesn't (yet) but if and when it's added, it'll be a yuge advantage to have positional audio vs regular stereo.  They keep out all but emergency sounds of the household, they're well padded and very comfy, even on my block head.Got great Senheisers for music making and listening, but being almost perfectly flat, they leave something to be desired for BOOM and BANG in game.  These fill the need at about a dime on the dollar.  Could not be happier, and I already know one thing my boys will betting for their birthdays,
title: Don't let the price scare you

author: M. C. Nguyen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
review_content: 1. My child just immediately loves the look and feel of this headset.  He looks like a spaceship pilot on a mission in a far away galaxy.2. He said the pads around the ears and the head are really soft.3. The cups of the headset hold his ears so nicely and make him feel comfortable.4. The audio is really nice.  And the mic is clear.5. The cable is rather long and flexible.6. The controls of the audio and mic is right within reach to adjust the audio volume or to turn on/off the microphone.7. The USB plug is for light.  Hence, it is independent from speaker and microphone.8. The mini plug to gain access to audio and voice works for virtually all modern electronic devices.9. Please note that on some of the old Mac Pro laptop models, there is not microphone input support.  This is an issue of your Mac Pro laptop, "not with mic on the headset".  You will probably need the following USB sound adapter to get both speakers and microphone work on your old Mac Pro laptops.  https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IRVQ0F8/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=110. I would recommend this headset since it offers the most values in look, feel, and sound qualities - especially when my child loves it!
title: Excellent Headset with Microphone

author: JKristin87
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: I am seriously amazed at this headset! I am an avid gamer. I have been through every headset imaginable. About a month before Christmas, my old Astro HS stopped working so I bought these as a temporary replacement until Santa Claus could stop by with the HS I wanted for Christmas. Honestly, for $30 I did not expect this headset to be anything but mediocre. I was SO very wrong. Hands down, this is the BEST headset I have ever used. And I have used ALOT of headsets. Noise cancellation is incredible! Durable& bulky but still great to fit dainty female ears like mine. You can also adjust these to fit smaller heads with no problem!The ear cuffs are super soft and comfortable. I am able to wear them for a long period of time without any discomfort. Very breathable material so no sweaty ears! Comfort is at 100%. Sound quality is perfect. You can’t get any better with the sound. You can hear EVERYTHING around you, which direction it’s coming from etc. You feel like you are actually in the game. The mic is perfect. No irritating feedback or echo. Needless to say, after buying this HS, I decided to tell Santa that I did not want the $300 headset that I had asked for previously. This one was WAYYY better and WAYYY more affordable.I commend this company for making an effort to produce a high quality product that everyone can afford!If you are looking for a headset, stop here. Get it! I promise, this will be “the one”.
title: Surpasses the expensive headsets!

author: Jackson Longan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020
review_content: I purchased this headset for use on an XBox One. As you can see in the photo, I have a newer generation controller that has a built-in audio port. Older versions of this controller will need an adapter to use this headset. Overall, I am pleased with this product. I don't write many reviews on Amazon, but felt I needed to give an honest review so others can make informed purchases. I always like the straight forward pros vs cons reviews so I will be using that method.PROS:• SOUND: The sound quality is very good. They sound just as good as my previous headset that cost $100• NOISE CANCELLATION: I was impressed with the over-the-ear hug that greatly reduced outside sounds.• COMFORT: I have not experienced any head or ear "aches" from wearing them for more than 1 hour.• EASE OF USE: No charging. No firmware updates. Plug and play. Simple.CONS:• WEIGHT: This headset is heavy and very bulky. It may not be the best option for youth.• CORD: The cord is long. Very long. It is also very thick, which may be durable, but is hard to deal with at times.• USB: The LED lights ONLY work if the USB is plugged in. For me the extra dongle just gets in the way.• MIC: The mic arm is semi-rigid. Very limited on shaping it.Overall, this headset works well and does what I need it to do. For the price, I couldn't ask for much more. It would be nice if they made a version specifically for connecting to controllers without the extra long cord and without the USB dongle.
title: Almost Perfect Budget Gaming Headset

author: Candy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2018
review_content: I just recieve my son new gaming headphones that he will get on Christmas day these was a steal with the price. The quality looks good and I hope everything else is on point as well. Will be updating in December thanks again....Follow up okay he opened it for Christmas the cord is long which is good for someone who often moves when playing the pieces that was attach neither one of them came off which makes no sense who wants to play with all these attachments hanging all in the way Annette you really can't enjoy gaming.
title: The quality and price

author: Vimal Girish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
review_content: The headsets sound great!!! They sound very clear and crisp and it has very immersive sound. I could really hear the 7.1 Dolby surround sound speakers around my ears. I put it to the test with a Dolby surround sound video and I could tell they were some good headphones. The one thing I didn't realize was they are over ear headphones. They were also bigger than expected, so be aware of that if you have a small head. The cushion is very soft around your ear and it doesn't hurt even if you have glasses on. It comes with a mic and headphone dongle as well. And finally, to put it to the real test, because they are gaming headphones, play some games. I could hear people  all around me in fps games such as Overwatch and COD because of, like I said, of the Dolby surround sound system. The mic also sounds great for just voice chatting with friends  and even a few conference calls. I would completely recommend it for the price👍👍👌.
title: Awesome headsets for FPS games!!!!!

author: Marc P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: I primarily use these for PC. I accidently broke my Astros so I needed a new headset in a pinch. These had high reviews,surprisingly, and I never heard of the brand. I just assumed it was a cheap chinese headset that lit up and would die after a couple months of using it. Which was fine I didn't plan on using these long term, and figured these would be good backups just incase I run into this issue again. Well they didn't which was great. I was overall pretty happy with these, but as I expected there were things that did come up that are typical of these kinds of headsets. Ill explain.ProsFits nicelyComfortableI personally am a fan of bass so these actually provide a good amount of itCool designCan game for a decent amount of time with these before you start getting hot and have to take them off.Headphones block out excess noise pretty well while youre gamingCons- Price...even though 30-40 bucks generally isn't really expensive for a headset...the overall quality of these really feels like a under 30 dollar headset. Im not really quite sure what you're paying for. Yes they claim it has noise cancelling, 7.1 surround, lights up, etc etc. However the build and performance of these in my opinion doesn't justify the price tag. I feel like theres better headsets out there in this price range that give you better quality overall.-Cheap plastic feel-My ears get hot during long gaming sessions wished they would have allowed more airflow to keep your ears cooler-Music is not as crisp as it could be even though it has a nice amount of bass its a budget headset so I don't expect quality but still something to note.-The wiring is very dodgy it has a braided cable which is nice but for whatever reason when I plug these into my PC no matter which connection I plug it into if its not a certain way you get buzzing and awkward feedback-The mic sucks, when im playing FPS games I leave my Mic open and not push to talk. It picks up outside noise but it doesnt....and what I mean by that is other people im playing with will see my name pop up and tell me they cant hear me but im not saying anything its very strange. You have to have the mic pretty close to your mouth in order for it to pick up your voice properly ive been told at times I sound very low and my volume is fairly high. I tried recording audio with it for a review i was doing and it came out with a faint buzzing sound with a little bit of low volume even through I adjusted it, it didnt help.Final thoughtsOverall its a good budget headset It gets the job done. Does it deserve its 5 start rating? No. I wasn't surprised with some of the things I expected to happen. You're not gonna get great quality with headsets like these. Theres gonna be pros and cons like I stated above. Again I was surprised at the quality of music when played through them love the bass, had... not great sound quality, but decent. I was expecting terrible base and sound.  Like the design its pretty cool and different from your typical Turtle Beach or whatever brand you find at a best buy or electronic store. Even though I said the Mic was kinda meh it still didnt sound awful and I still could get the Mic to work properly with some adjustments. So if you need something cheap that looks cool and works ok... look no more! If you think this is gonna be equivalent to a Logitech, Kingston, Steele Series etc...don't be fooled.  You get what you pay for GENERALLY with gaming gear.  Just save your money if you want a quality headset.
title: Not bad for a budget headset

author: New Mom 2009
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: The head set is very comfortable. The mute mike button is in the power cord, which is took a little getting use to as our last headset muted when the mike was in the up position. I like the mute in the power cord better, less wear and tear on the mike. The LED lights look great, but only work when the USB cord is plugged into a power source - not a show stopper as the lights are not required to use the headset.Pros: comfortable, mute and volume in the power cord, long power cord, works with switch, PS4, and cell phone.Cons: USB cord for LED lights branches off the power cord to the game controller about 12 inches below the gaming controller connection and is very short (maybe 12 inches). If player has headset plugged into PS4 controller, USB cord for LEDs will not reach power source to light up.
title: Comfortable, easy to use

author: Author Braxton Cosby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: I purchased this product not knowing much about the company, but I was hopeful since it was sold through Amazon. And boy and I glad I took the chance. The surround sound is the most impressive aspect of the headset. I use the headset with my Oculus Quest it truly provides immersive surround sound. It can get pretty loud, easily outperforming the built in speakers of the Quest and it helps to add to bring me into the games with positional sound that is unexpected and surprisingly good. The fit is wonderful, fully covering my ears while remaining comfortable. And the communication online could not be more clear. If you are looking for the next headset that provides comfort, sleek design, and out-performs most headsets, while still being easy on the pockets, give this one a shot.
title: Really Amazing

author: King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: Bought these for my son for his first "gaming headset" and he was so disappointed. .Sound quality isn't that bad but the mic DID NOT WORK with his Xbox One S controller (with built in 3.5mm connection). Also the USB dongle setup is horribly designed. You will either need a portable battery to plug it into or not have the headset lights on. And even if it's plugged into a portable battery, the USB cord is EXTREMELY short so the battery pack will be in the way of the controller while you're playing. We tried everything to get the mic to work but to no avail. Going to contact seller to return..
title: Disappointed

author: SouthernMT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
review_content: Bought this headset to plug into our TV to watch quietly while my husband sleeps. (He works odd hours). Separately bought a 10 ft extension cable and there’s no loss in sound quality. Doesn’t eliminate all outside noises but cancels most. I kind of prefer it that way in case my phone rings. I also tried this headset gaming. I don’t play as much as my husband so I couldn’t justify spending a lot like he did for his Bluetooth headset. For gaming I like that this headset is light weight. I wear glasses and this headset doesn’t compress too much so it remains comfortable after long wear. The sound quality is great, I can hear finer background sounds that I never noticed over the tv. During chat there’s no issues hearing other players and they can hear me clearly. Love the wrapped cords. My only somewhat negative things: I wish there was a separate volume control for player voices and in game sounds and a detachable mic. Those are 2 things my husband’s pricey headset has that this one doesn’t. For the price, you really can’t beat this headset.
title: Great for TV listening and gaming

author: Bryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: headphones arrived in their original box with a label slapped on the side.They were packed in a bubblewrap pocket. The wire is hardwired into the left side.  The microphone is on the left side.There is also a volume wheel and mic mute button inline with the cable.The cable is probably about 6'.  It's pretty long, maybe a little too long, but not a big deal.The end of the cable has a 1/8" plug and usb. I believe the USB is just to power the LED lights and not something I would ever use.  There is also a splitter  adapter included, but i didn't need it.I plugged directly into an xbox one x controller with just the 1/8" plug and everything worked as expected.After  an hour of gameplay, my ears were pretty warm, but that seems normal for over the ear headphones like this.  (My Turtle Beach ones did the exact same thing.)The only "problem" i have with them so far is that the microphone boom arm that is attached to the left ear side is very hard to move.  You can't move it with one hand as it will take the whole headphone with you.  If I want to move the mic into/out of place easily I have to take both hands (1 to hold headphones and 1 to move boom).It's possible it will loosen up with time.  I don't see anyway to adjust it.I'm also not a huge fan of the design. It seems overly "robotic" with lots of extra plastic pieces making the headset appear to be very large.  This is no way affects my rating as I did see what they looked like when I bought them.But some people care for the aesthetics, so I wanted to mention.Overall sound quality is very good.  Mic quality is also very good.There is no active noise canceling  and even though these are over the ear, i was still able to hear things going on around my home.I'm happy with the purchase so far.
title: good headphones for a good price

author: Daniel C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
review_content: I have tried many headsets over my gaming lifetime and many of them have great features but usually a fatally weak physical spot (usually where the headset adjusts in height). This pair have great sound, don't break the bank, and have a nice thick attachment that doesn't threaten to break if you set it down anyway but super gently.I am not an audiophile so can't really comment on the sound other than definitely giving the surround feeling so you don't get snuck up on in games where it matters.The only bit of criticism I can think of is that if you are going to put LEDs in a headset spend the extra buck to make them RGB and not just red. Even if you just have a single button on the headset itself to control the LEDs. So like off, the solid colors, and rainbow effect that all change with the push of the same button.
title: Excellent gaming headset and not whimpy

author: No_treason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
review_content: So this headset was pretty nice once received. However, I went to plug it in with the usb and it doesn’t work. I tried updating drivers, changing settings. Nothing worked. So cool the headset lights up, but can’t be used as a usb headset. And then everything I try to play I’m extremely quiet on. I can be talking very loudly in actuality, but my team mates can barely hear me. This isn’t a good headset and I am not seeing how anyone is having luck with it. I got another one as a gift for my PS4 and it arrived damaged and the replacement you can only hear out of one side of it. I think these are just extremely poorly made. Comparing to a Logitech g230 (old headset that I got for $30 on sale) these are worse than cheap material.At the very least. It works until you can get something new, if you don’t care about being heard or having random issues.
title: Want a good headset? Move along.

author: Damon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
review_content: This one is a good headset but it died less than 3 months after I got it. I can get it to light up but I get no sound or mic. Seems like this is a common theme with these headsets.I spent a little more on another brand and it's been going strong. My family uses a lot of headsets and we take care of them. I got two of these, and they're both dead in just a few months.I usually don't give one star reviews, but based solely on build quality, I can't recommend these at all.
title: Bought two, both died in less than four months

author: Jonathan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: Ok, right off the rip out of the box, only one ear worked in the controller input for ps4. the noise cancelling was nice and it was loud- in the one ear. but i returned them . these things are so cheap and crap plastic. they look like TWO CUPS or bowls on your ears. and the plug in for the lights is an inch long....A INCH!!! dont even think you are getting some play from your girl for lighting up the room with some ambient lighting- not happening. just like both ears working...
title: TRASH TRASH Terrrash

author: Edvin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
review_content: One week of usage review.They fit great over the ears especially if your ears are on the bigger side. The sound quality is very good, no complaints at all so far. Tried it out on PC gaming, Youtube, Netflix and passed it with flying colors. Thee headsets are very flexible and bendable unlike most higher end brands. The earmuffs are attached on much better than my much more expensive headphones which broke.So all in all great product for the money.
title: Overall great headset

author: Nick G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
review_content: The RUNMUS Gaming Headset is very good for the price. My immediate impression was that they felt a little cheap due to the plastic encasing, but after using them for a while I was very impressed by there durability, comfort, and sound quality.Pros- Durable- 7.1 audio works great (if you pay for the Dolby or DTS service on Xbox). Otherwise, the stereo audio is fine.- Very comfortable, was able to play nonstop for 3 hours without them bugging me.- Works with PS4, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac, and anything with a 3.5mm headphone jack.- Adjustable for different size heads.- Necessary mute switch and volume control built into the cable.- All the cables you need including a microphone and audio input adapter for PC. (Unless you have an older Xbox one controller that doesn't have the 3.5mm input)- Good noise canceling on the microphone (was able to eat chips without the microphone picking me up)Cons- Plastic cheap feeling- The noise-canceling microphone is not perfect. It picked up my air conditioner running in the background (25 feet away).- The microphone jack sometimes produces a little static if moved around in the controller.- The microphone angle needs to be able to go down further because it stays in my eyesight and is slightly distracting.- The cable is nice, but it's a little long for consoles.- The microphone adjustment controls can be a little awkward to find while you're watching the screen. I'm used to them being right on my controller for Xbox. I wish the controls were on the headset itself.- The lights work when plugged in via the USB port, and they're very dim. Almost a useless feature.Overall what you're getting for the price is a 7.1 surround sound adjustable headset with the necessary cables that work straight out of the box. Not a bad deal.
title: Affordable Gaming Headphones

author: Stephen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
review_content: I had been using a pair of Turtle Beach headphones on my gamin computer for quite a few years (>5 years), and it was starting to fall apart at the noise cancelling foam part.  I figured it was time to get a new headset and it was perfect timing for Black Friday / Cyber Monday.  I picked this pair of RUNMUS over another cheaper set of stereo headphones because of the reviews and the 7.1 surround sound capabilities.Now that I have the sound fixed, I feel that this headset is pretty good for the price.When I first tried the headphones, I was quite disappointed.  The sound was very muffled and everything was drowed out by the bass.  It was almost as if someone turned the treble to zero and the bass to 100%.  I swapped the headset back to my old ones and confirmed that it wasn't my computer that was having issues.  Same ports plugged in gave completely different sound qualities between the two headsets.  I searched online for a solution and found one of 2 possible problems.  1) Your headset could be defective or 2) Your audio drivers are not properly installed.  I thought it would not be possible that my drivers were not properly installed if my old headset was working great, but I went ahead and checked anyways.  Lo and Behold, it turned out my audio drivers were actually not installed properly and windows was just using the generic windows audio drivers.  I searched for my motherboard's audio drivers, installed them, and afterwards I was able to play with the 3D equalizer.  After playing around with the equalizer, I was able to make the headphones sound MUCH MUCH better.  I am now puzzled why the Turtle Beach headset never needed a proper audio driver... maybe because it was stereo and not 7.1 surround?So far, I haven't noticed the advantage of having a 7.1.  Maybe there is some setting I still need to turn on and play around with?
title: Cheap headphones for gaming but works

author: Rin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
review_content: I got this headset for my sister as a birthday gift because have a job now and needed to prove to my parents that I love her. She is one of those gaming nerds that uses my consoles to kick the butts of other players. Or so she tells me. She also tells me that playing the Untitled Goose Game for hours on end doesn’t qualify me as a gamer. Granted, I’m not very good at it. I’m also not good at gift giving but I knew she needed a new headset and preferably one with a mic. After seeing the sheer amount of positive reviews that this product got, I decided to purchase it. It came the day after I ordered them and as I took them out of the box, all I could think of was how these were defiantly not my style. They are large and come with a thousand different types of cables that I can’t identify. I put them on and plugged them into my computer and watched cartoons for a good while, impressed with the sound quality, before remembering that I had to wrap them for my younger goob of a sister. As I was about to take them off, I caught a glimpse of my reflection in the TV and by gosh itself did I look like I could be a professional e-sports player!! I marveled at the way the mic curved around to pick up my soon-to-be fire insults. I could see myself expertly using reflexes honed by years of training as I beat the crap out of other players. I could imagine children logging onto their games and freezing in fear as my notorious gamer tag appeared on their screen! If I wanted to pursue this life, I knew what I had to do. That day, I told my parents that I would be moving into the basement and dropping out of my summer English class. They cried. I nailed the windows shut, bought a microwave, and a pallet of pizza rolls. I sat down in my gamer chair and put on the RUNMUS Gaming headset. This is my ninth day of becoming a gamer and I write this while I wait for Call of Duty to download. I know I can’t live like this for much longer. I haven’t had any human contact in so long and I’m starting to forget what other food tastes like. My pale complexion longs for the myth they call sunlight. I’m starting to wonder if there is more to life than gaming. I need to give these to my sister. Yes, I have to go back to the life I once had. Is it even possible? I have to believe it is. I’ll devise a plan, yes! I’ll give this headset to my sister and watch as she takes this spiral into being a video game master. From there, I shall mend ties with my parents and inherit her college money. I’ll get my master’s degree in psychology and help other kids who have taken the path I know I must leave. Buy these at your own risk. I don’t know if it’s magic or just the immaculate sound quality, but there is something about this headset that is dangerous. Farewell gaming community. To those who still choose to play, may your buttons never stick, and may your internet always be fast and know that with these headphones, you will always hear your success and your words will always ring in your enemies’ ears. I must go, do not worry for me any longer for I have found the wrapping paper and know what I must do.
title: These Are A Game-Changer

author: J. Miranda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: Even after reading the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to move forward with the purchase because of the price.  I'm not a hardcore gamer, but I'm also not a very casual one so I wanted a headset that delivered in performance and quality but now blow my budget since there are other things I wanted to pick up for my PC gaming experience.This is a great product.  Performance is up there with decent noise cancelling but overall sound quality is awesome.  I had the master volume turned up to 50% and it sounded like it was at a 100% compared to my old pair.  The only downside to this product is, it is a bit bulky but that's only because of the headphone speakers, and I wish there was a way to turn off the LED lights without needing to completely disconnect the USB cable.
title: Great quality gaming headset for the price!

author: Q
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
review_content: I would consider this a pretty good gaming headset for the price. The sound is great. At first I thought the mic was not working but you just need to go into your audio setting on your PC to turn up the volume, it works fine now.**Update after 1.5 months of use:After using this headset to game for about one and half months, I have decided to upgrade to a better headset. I would still recommend this headset for the price if you are a casual gamer or on a tight budget, but I have realized that the sound is muffled compared to higher-tier headsets. Everyone's experience and preference differs, but to me that makes a huge difference in my game play such as for pubg. With this headset it's kinda difficult to tell where the gunshot or footstep is coming from which is very important in my game. This is why I decided to invest in a more expensive headset.
title: Great product for the price

author: Joe W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
review_content: Let me start off by admitting I don't have much gaming headset experience to compare these to. However, I'm an avid user of both consumer-grade and professional-grade electronics, and as an audio/video professional I work with high-end headphones on a daily basis—including those from Bose and other top name-brands. These far-less-expensive headphones sound excellent when compared to their costly counterparts. The design/build quality is also quite impressive. I was very pleasantly surprised at the size and heft of the product. It is well-made and has ample padding on the upper band as well as around the over-ear cups. The cable and connections are equally well-made, and the removable adapter is a nice touch; since I don't need it, I was glad to get it out of the way. I was also very pleased with the built-in volume control dial and physical microphone mute switch, which are features I was unaware of when I made my purchase. As far as the microphone goes, that is much more difficult to test without being on the "receiving end" of the conversation, but when asking others how I sound they've unanimously confirmed the quality is fantastic. That's more than enough evidence for me that these are a keeper and a great value. And that is still true despite the fact that I purchased these at the current high point of the product's CamelCamelCamel price history.
title: Fantastic value, truly impressed; would recommend and buy again!

author: Jeff & Beth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: I did not expect to have a great sound quality from this headset. I needed a second headset for a gaming laptop to use voice chat.The cushions are comfortable and really prevent a lot of external sound from leaking in. These are not noise canceling headphones, but they still work great. The speakers have much more mid and mid-low end response then I was expecting. The deepest bass still gets muddied and quiet, but to be expected from such a small speaker set without additional processing. The microphone is also clear and works perfectly for discord, teams, or any other voice chat application out there.Another nice feature is the braided cord and included headset to separate mic and speaker adapter. I am very happy with this purchase.
title: Wow what a great deal

author: ShaunoftheDead
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: The Runmus K2 headset has excellent sound quality, a wide soundstage, a comfortable build, and the versatility to work on every major gaming platform.Tested on Xbox One with Dolby Atmos, the headset accurately and clearly provided excellent surround sound. Videos of tropic rainforests felt immersive and full of life. Chirps, rustling leaves, and deep thunder surrounded me, and I felt transported into the environment.While playing Modern Warfare multiplayer, I was able to run-and-gun while hearing enemies from all directions. Small sounds like personal UAV's whirred accurately above the battlefield, and were much easier to shoot down due to this headset's accurate and precise surround sound. If you're looking for a headset to up your game, this definitely could be a good fit for you!The build quality is good on this headset, but the headband doesn't feel incredibly durable. The braided cable is fairly long and feels tough. It has a USB attached for powering the LED lights. There is a 3.5mm audio and mic splitter for PC.The headset is comfortable, and does not squeeze my head. I wear glasses, and while it isn't glasses-friendly per-sé, I did not notice any added discomfort from wearing my glasses with the headset. The band is adjustable enough to fit on myself and my kids - both of which we're thrilled by the surround sound and clarity of the audio.Overall, the Runmus K2 is quite possibly the best value in gaming headsets, and stands tall as one of the best headsets that I have tried under $60. If you're looking for a new gaming headset, definitely try out these out. They're unbeatable for the price, and provide accurate, detailed, and rich audio to help you dominate the competition!
title: Excellent, Immersive Sound for Any Platform!

author: K. McNamara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019
review_content: So I bought this product assuming it'd be around the quality of a $20ish product, but boy was I wrong. When I received this product in the mail, I was surprised with how amazing this thing truly is. I can say without a doubt that this one replaces the $156 headphones I had before this one, it's just so much better in every way. I'll go through the pros and cons really quickly so you can go on ahead and put this in your cart, because believe me you'll want to.Pros-1. The ear pieces are extremely soft2. The sound quality is golden, solid 10/103. After testing it with some friends in a call, my friends all agree that the sound quality is way better than my previous headset (which was $156 if you read above)4. It just generally looks cool, like when my room lights are shut off, it's cool to see my monitor, computer and headphones lit up.Cons-1. None that I am aware of at this point in timeThanks for reading this review, I hope you found it helpful!
title: This is the Best One Yet!

author: HotIce4Real
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
review_content: I’ve been searching for a loud wired headset. This is the loudest I’ve found. Friends say in chat I sound good. Cord is a tad long but not a major con just wrap and tie. They are bulky but lightweight. Comfortable but a little warm. They are worth it so far. It’d be cool if they came up with a way to use the led other than the usb plug. I’m playing on a PS4 and it’s across the room plus I can’t plug into controller and usb even if I was sitting close. I count on reviews when I buy so this is keeper so far. That says a lot because I’ve sent several headsets back just wasn’t loud enough. I’m gonna eventually have to do wireless just hate having to charge them because I game for hours at a time. Sometimes all day. Also it doesn’t cancel out all outside noise. That could be a con even though they are louder than most. Hopefully I helped someone. So I’ve got to know the earphones a little better. I have normal size ears and the hole just isn’t big so my ears are getting smushed it’s a tad painful when you game for hours.
title: So far so good!!! Update

author: D. Pace
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: These are great. They were replacing my old Razer HP-1 Barracuda and soundcard setup. These really sound great I am able to hear people from a ways away with the clear foot step sounds, and you are not overpowered with the bass so you can still hear what is going on around you even with explosions going offThe mic is excellent. When compared with my Razer Seiren X it is right on par, maybe a little deeper but that is the noise canceling that works GREAT. So if you are looking to communicate with people and let them know who is SUS in among us with crystal clear infliction then this is it.Over all these are built ok, I would like them a bit tighter but that is me. . But for the money, they work and the mic is excellent.
title: Not bad at all

author: britt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
review_content: 2 problems:1- I plug it into Xbox controller and when I move it around the cords make a noise that enter the headset that friends in a party chat can hear. Annoying.2- two separate cords 1- for controller/game audio, and the second you have to plug into some wall adaptor. The lights and audio require two separate plugs which sucks because I want the headset to light up but I don’t want to have to sit next to a outlet and have one wire going to and outlet and another going to my controller and being super tangled up. Plus the cords are hard to even have both plugged in because they are closely attached to each other and requires extension cord.It’s be nice if everything worked off one cable.Other than that- noise cancellation is prestige! Can’t hear my mother yelp about something 😂🙈. Sound volume can go very low to very high!Looks cool and extremely confortable!
title: 2 issues but good buy

author: zach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
review_content: Okay anyone who has had the headsets with the 3.5 mm jack inputs knows sometimes the jack can cause problems with hearing only from one earphone.For the most part this headset is great but I think in general the material they used (the metal coating) over the jack needs to be changed because if i move my control it makes muffling sounds or one earphone loses audio.I will say though the sound when its working is great, noise cancellation is great, i havent tried chat yet but assuming itd be good.My only complaint is the audio messing up, however after working as an electronics tech for over 6 years now and wiring electronics its normal for these types of inputs, sometimes its the metal sometimes its the controllers metal conductor inside. Thats why i gave it 4 stars anyways, because I’m not going to disassemble and try to troubleshoot it.Copper and gold coatings are the best for jack outputs, but it also depends on what metal the Xbox uses for their input.
title: Mostly great

author: Mountain Jam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
review_content: One of the things I found was the sound is actually pretty good. You get a good feel for the music you play. Please don't compare this with Sennheiser or some other, you are not paying that much either here!The comfort level is good, I worked with this over my head for 3 hours without a break, and at the end of 3 hours I felt my ears could take a break from the cushions with them pressing down upon your ears. But not a big complaint.Microphone though is a downer, others couldn't actually hear me correctly. Not sure if it is the headset I got or if it is like this, because I saw other reviews where people said microphone was great, no problems. Unfortunately not for me. I'm going to try this for a few more days to see if things change with how I work (too many tabs / apps running on my PC).
title: K2 Pro is good, not too great not too shabby. Good for the price

author: DENNIS J PARSHALL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
review_content: Look I’m not going to lie, I’m skeptical about a mic with 8k reviews. There’s gotta be a catch, right? But I said screw it I’ll buy it anyways everyone seems to like it and I need a quick fix on a temporary issue. Well I got the headphones and I think I know why there are so many reviews, you get a free item (even a second pair of these headphones) so long as you make a review. I’d be lying if I said one of the reasons I was writing a review wasn’t because of that free stuff. But listen, honestly, these are incredibly good headphones for their price. Actually it makes no sense how good they are for the price I paid. get them. And if you’re like me, someone who games on both console and PC get one, leave a review, get another pair. Why? Cause why the hell not?
title: Worth it

author: ZFive
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_content: Amazing quality headphones!We purchased these headphones for our sons birthday. He uses them for PC gaming and listening to audio on iPad.They came packaged nicely. Included in the box is an instruction booklet, however not really needed as they are plug and go. The headphones use a standard jack on the iPad. They provide the adapter to use on a PC that splits audio and microphone. The led lights use another usb plug which works great on laptop and PC.They are super comfortable for all head sizes as well. Padding is on point. Our 5 year old can wear them along with adults.As for the actually quality of the audio coming out and the microphone they are fairly good. No complaints so far. Depending on the volume they do cancel out noise. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a headphones for everyday average use.
title: Great quality headset!

author: Jasmin Rae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: I was really hesitant to purchase this because I've only ever tried expensive gaming headsets. I'm more of an earbuds user anyway, but I figured for the money, I wouldn't be hurting too much if it turned out to be bad.Wow though! This headset is nuts for the price. The noise cancelation could be a little but better, but I don't really need that feature very much. The headphones are very sturdy and are comfortable to wear. I've used them all day today and my ears don't hurt or anything. The suction ear cups are also very comfortable and sizeable and don't move even though I have small ears. The volume is loud if you want it to be, and the killswitch/volume rocker for the mic is also good quality and feels sturdy. They look a little "extra" but I kind of like that they're so big. I loved these so much that I bought another pair for my wife and another pair for a friend of mine. Works perfectly on ps4. I'll update in a few months! Couldn't be happier honestly.
title: Wayyyy Better Than Expected

author: Jacob Dantzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: I used this headset to play warzone.I could hear everyone well, we had 4 guys in the game. I could not hear my friend sitting next to me when she talked (this is good)Although I have no experience with other headsets I dont have anything to compare these to, but I had a good experience with them.My only complaint is that for them to light up, you have to plug them in to a USB port. They have two cords coming off after the valume toggle and they are both rather short. Luckily I rigged up an extension cord to my center counsel on my couch for chargers! Lights dont effgameplay though, they work fine without them being lit up and its not like you can see them while their on your head anyways.I strongly recommend these, great bang for your buck and I got mine in two days!
title: Worth it!

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: Sooooo I’m a little disappointed I may have not read it right or anything but I did read you can use it with the Xbox one though, you need an adapter to be able to use them with the Xbox one and well my kids were disappointed because they aren’t able to use them they loved that they light up and everything but they hate that they can’t use them to play video games it’s an okay headset for the price but the fact that I need to buy and expensive adapter just for them to use them for gaming is what threw me off about the headset buy them if you would like but if you have the Xbox one and not the new Xbox make sure you have the adapter or the money to get one to be able to use it if you don’t don’t get this product
title: A little disappointed

author: Nightglow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_content: Great gaming headset for a great price! The sound quality is very clear for playing music, watching movies and playing games. I have used this headset with xbox, playstation, and switch and it all works great! I cant really say it has true noise cancellation but the design does a fairly good job of sealing out surrounding noises. Its nice that the a volume control and mic on/off are built into the cord to easily make adjustments without having to quit to a menu. I also find the headset quite comfortable, i have warn it for about 3-5hrs straight and had no fatigue, its quite durable and well made. The lighting effects are nice but i dont really use it and i have been told if i have the lights on (being that its a separate usb plug for lights) that people on the other end hear a slight buzzing interference. Other than that, this headset is great. Its loud enough, comfortable and the mic is clear on the other end, i dont need anything else.
title: Comfortable and clear!

author: RichWithMemes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019
review_content: According to just about every review on here, it’s a headset that will compete with just about the $100 headsets. Let me tell you, that’s a flat out lie. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for. The audio quality is not so great, even at max volume I could just barely make out enemy footsteps. As far as the mic goes, teammates have said I sound a lot clearer than my Turtle Beaches Stealth 700’s. It feels like a well built headset, far better than the lightweight flimsy 700’s, but the audio quality just doesn’t cut it. The only reason why there’s thousands of five star reviews is due to the company offering free stuff in return of leaving them a five star review. So the reviews are not genuine, people just want the free stuff. They offer the same headset, a gaming mouse, a small Bluetooth speaker, a gaming mouse pad, a Bluetooth headset, or a headset stand in exchange of a five star review. They send you a small letter saying you are one of the few that receive this offer, flat out lie in my opinion. I’d say this headset for the price is worthy of a 2 star at most. It’s comfortable, looks and feels nice, and apparently the mic quality is good. Other than that, it’s a no from me.
title: Don’t fall for the 5 star reviews!

author: Rene Misaka
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: UPDATE 12/26/2020:Customer service reached out to me after seeing my review and they were really apologetic about the problems I had with the headset. They passed it onto their quality control department to get it taken care of. They also gave me the option of either receiving a refund or a replacement with a newer model. I chose the replacement and they sent it out the same day. I was really happy with how they dealt with the situation and what they do to make their customers happy so I am updating my review with 5 stars.You don’t get a long of companies that do this sort of thing so I was happy that they reached out to me to fix it. :)————————————————————(Please note that I used these headphones strictly for my Xbox One console. I didn’t use it for any other consoles or PC. So my review it based solely on how I experienced it with my Xbox.)When I first bought this, it worked great, no real problems.Then after maybe a few months, the mute/unmute switch would mute sometimes, other times it wouldn’t mute at all. Wasn’t a huge deal but still annoying.Not too long after having that problem, I would plug in the headphones and it would pick and choose when to work. I would usually have to turn off/on the controller again or would have to go into headset settings on Xbox and switch on/off the headphones in order for it to work.THEN, the headset microphone went completely out. I could hear through the headphones, the microphone just wouldn’t work no matter what I tried to do. Tried troubleshooting everything , even tried plugging it into a different controller-nothing.So I owned these for less than a year before it went out. Maybe 8 or 9 months? So I guess with this you get what you pay for- it wasn’t too expensive for these headphones but still inconvenient cuz I gotta buy a new pair now :(.
title: Customer Service was amazing!

author: SN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
review_content: The headphone quality is very good and the separate 3.5mm jacks for audio and microphone was something I've been looking for. As with the separate jacks, I can plug the microphone jack into my computer and the audio jack into my audio splitter to listen to the game I am playing. Of course, you can remove the adapter leaving the one audio and microphone cable left together. Just note that the USB plug-in is for the added color only on the headset as noted in the description. The stereo functionality is great for hearing games and works extremely well.  The microphone quality is also very good cancelling background noise decently well. The headset has good cushioning and fits nicely on top ones head.
title: Quality Headset -- Good Audio, Microphone, and Fit

author: Jill C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my new ps4 pro.  They were on black friday special with a coupon for a discounted price of 21 bucks..  I figured they were inexpensive enough to try out.  I recieved them and instantly noticed the comfort of them compared to my turtle beach.  These were much more comfy over the head than my turtle beach.  Although, my turtle beach are wireless, these are wired to the controller.  Not to fuss, but they are corded. They also don't light up as in the pics unless they are plugged into a USB type device.  I did not plug them into the ps4, I did however, plug them into a battery pack that I had to light them up while playing.The sound quality is clear and crisp.  The bass isn't too heavy as some other brands can be a bit too much on the bass.  The wired headset does have a volume control and is useful when playing if the sound effects are too much for you.Overall, if you don't mind the short wire plugged into the controller, it's a steal at this price point...I highly recommend this set.
title: Great for gaming!

author: Jen Mac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
review_content: My old headset was cutting out on me and I had been digging through reviews trying to find a nice surround sound headset for gaming.  I was reluctant to spend over $100 on a headset and risk it being uncomfortable so picked this thing up since it wasn't expensive and had good ratings.  Super surprised at the sound quality and comfort.  Friends say I come through a lot more clearly on discord.  I was worried that the cuffs on the ears would press on my glasses uncomfortably but they're super soft as is the cushion in the headband.  If you don't want the lights on you can unplug the usb.  I was unable to get the surround sound to work unfortunately, but I think that's an issue with my sound card and not the headset itself.Only con is the sound quality is a little lower than my old headset, but this one was half the price so not complaining too much.Overall I'd definitely recommend it.
title: Surprisingly comfortable (even with glasses)

author: Elena W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: Update - After trying to use these for a month we have had to buy him a better set with actual noise cancelling.  These don't block out any noise unless you are playing music.  He is doing online classes and these just aren't good for that.I bought this headset for my husband and he is somewhat happy with them.  The sound quality is very good but the noise cancelling could be better.  Our other noise cancelling headphones were much better on that front.  If you have the sound turned down, there is virtually no noise cancelling, but at a normal - high volume, the noise cancelling is ok.  The light on the microphone can be a bit distracting but that is easily solved by just not plugging in the USB. They are also a bit bulky but that is not a bit deal either.  Overall they are very good for the price.
title: Terrible Noise Cancelling

author: Becca Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Mic and audio quality for communication devices while gaming have never sounded better than what this headset produces!  Very high quality microphone, really good audio in the ears (almost better than my 5.1 surround setup.... scary).  Only hickup was the setup process.  I was anticipating a USB or alternatively 3.5mm jack, either or option.  Instead, the USB only powers the red led lighting, the 3.5mm jack is required for audio.  The second part of this hickup is the rear panel audio is used for my 5.1 surround setup with a spare line-in jack and mic jack.  However this device wants dedicated ports instead of smart splitting the rear panel options to power the headset.  So I'm forced to use front panel, which is fine, but I like hidden wires.  Great product overall, just wish the USB was an option for the audio but I suppose that is why the quality is so far superior from the USB headsets I've previously used, dedicated 3.5mm jack for sound.
title: delicious quality

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: This headset is trash... From day one it crackled and disconnected off and on, even when used with a brand new controller. The company tries to bribe you with free items if you leave a positive review... That's why I assume there are so many misleading reviews. Save yourself time, money, and frustration- and avoid this headset.
title: DO NOT BUY!!

author: Kevin Read
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2019
review_content: Pros:, Sound quality is above average, I would not suggest using it if you are into audio, but for gaming it works fine.  There is no static and the clearity is fairly good.  Base level is average for this size headset.  The microphone pics up your voice well even when speaking quietly. The oversized ear pads help keep external noise low.  The design is nice looking. For the price I would buy it again.Cons:  I would rate the noise canceling feature as below average.  It really only blocks out very low frequency noise.  I have two sets of noise canceling headphones for travel and both are far better in that department.  The ability to rotate the microphone down is limited.  I personally want it near my chin or lower but it won't go that far. I don't like it high enough that it's clearly visible.  I want it fairly low and that is impossible with these headphone.
title: Big and Heavy but overall not a bad headset.

author: Parker Call
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: TLDR: Buy these headphones.These are my first set of gaming headphones. I have been using these for six months now and couldn't be happier that I didn't go with the $100 + options. The headphone is much more comfortable than I was anticipating, and can easily be worn for extended gameplay. The pads are very soft and cup your ears without any uncomfortable pressure. The sound quality is good, could have a little better noise cancellation, but where it really shines is creating an immersive surround sound experience. The mic is crystal clear and after checking with friends in the chat there is no ambient noise that comes through. The cable is a good length and feels sturdy and comes with convenient volume/mic controls.
