It did take me a couple of minutes of fiddling with them the first time, but I also had to play with settings, so it could have just been user error. Again I have been very pleased with these headphones and would highly recommend you give them a try before you spend $70 more than you need to.
title: Excellent Choice for the Price

author: Ricardo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019
review_content: After the plug for my previous, major-label headphones broke off in my laptop, I found myself needing a new headset quickly. I purchased this product based on other reviews, but I was skeptical. I wasn't familiar with the brand, so the purchase was completely on faith. I have been so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the physical product, as well as the overall sound quality. My friends could immediately tell that something changed in my setup because, according to more than one person, the sound they hear is clearer and louder than before. That speaks to the mic quality. The headphones fit me perfectly, block out sound, and, in my ears, deliver an awesome gaming and music experience. I couldn't be happier with these headphones!
title: When one door breaks, a much better one opens!

author: Andrea E Brown-Westfahl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I don't like leaving bad reviews but this one has to be left. First thing is that it didn't even light up when we plugged it into our controller. It only did that when we plugged into  a computer. Not sure if that's what it suppose to go into for. And slowly the sound started to fade out to a point where we just didn't hear anything, even when we had the sound all the way up, we barely hear anything. I would give it a 5 stars for comfort, but very cheaply made for the sound. I would not recommend this, unless your just trying to find something cheap. But basically, we just ended up boxing it up and forgetting about it and buying some new headphones from the actual PlayStation company.
title: Sound faded out in like 5 month

author: Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
review_content: My first thought opening the package was, "Wow, this is big." Thankfully it is not very heavy and the padding is soft, so when worn for a long gaming session my neck does not ache and my ears do not hurt even while wearing glasses. The sound quality is good. There is noise cancellation from all the padding around the ear, but this headset does not sit flat on my ears. This results in a small gap near the bottom of my ear. I do not mind this at all; it doesn't affect comfort and there is enough noise cancellation. I talked with a friend online and after asking if he heard me, his first comment was, "Wow, you're very clear."One thing I did not expect was the available connections. Maybe I just misread the description, but I thought it was a single plug for mic+headset, and a usb plug. While this is true of the headset, it came included with an adapter for the single plug to split into a green headset plug and a red microphone plug. This is what I am used to for my PC, and it worked perfectly.
title: Good quality, love the connections.

author: AMZ doesn't like any of my name choices
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
review_content: These were fine for the price as far as function when they worked, but I received TWO UNITS back to back where the mic AND headphones cut out so badly they were unusable! Like after the first hour or two! Also I had bad popping in the headset. I am really careful with my headsets, and I have four other models of inexpensive Runmus headsets that have been great workhorses for a ton of gaming over the last two years, and I have bought them for friends, but as the price has gone up, quality control seems to have gone down. These were comfortable too in spite of their bulk, so it's a shame they are so poorly wired, because it appears like it's a matter of cheap and broken wiring.
title: Bummer!

author: Jesse Stevens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: Original Review:I have a 13 year old son who isn't as kind to his gaming equipment as I am. In the last couple of years some of the lighter built headsets have not been able to hang with him. This set is thicker and feels sturdier. Sound quality is on par with a 40 to 60 dollar Turtle Beach headset, but with a thicker insulated wire. The mic is non-detachable. He has had other headsets where the mic could be removed, but that generally led to lost or broken mics. So far for the cost this headset looks like it will hold up and provide the same for less. I will give further feedback after he has had more play time with it.Edited:I am back with a 4 month update on this headset. They were a Christmas gift to my son. I left my original review on Dec. 26, 2019. I have updated the title and to reflect a more appreciative tone that the previous review.The headset has so far paid itself off. My son has spent much of his free time playing games. He plays Xbox and has friends he chats with from the moment he turns it on to the moment he turns it off.He gets lost in the sound of his headset and uses them as a tool in games that have high quality sound audio that can affect gameplay. He has never complained of headaches or ear pain while wearing them.He plays games with his uncles and myself often. He is clear on the microphone and no one has issues with his sound coming through. He does sit under a fan and that can, depending on the speed setting of the fan, override the noise cancellation in the mic. Setting adjustments for mic sensitivity can accommodate for this issue on most games.Four months later and his headset is still in great condition. He has dropped it on two occasions that I know of and the headset is functioning well and I can't tell what is normal surface scratching compared to a mark possibly left from the drops.To date these are his favorite headset (he has owned 3 turtle beach headsets that ranged from 40 to 60 dollars a piece.). He likes the feel, doesn't feel like if he jumps up excited they will fly off. He has no complaints about sound quality and on the occasions I have put them on they sounded perfectly acceptable. Nothing I wasn't used to, but not quite the highest surround sound quality that I get from my own high end headset.I do have a big gripe with the light up LED option. It is an USB cable that plugs in near the 3.5 mm plug off the same primary line. What this means if you are buying for the light up feature for someone who plays on a console and not a PC then you will be disappointed. Using the PC adapter from 3.5mm to mic and audio splitter 3.5mm plugs you can light this headset up using the USB plugin. This is not an option when plugging into a controller without making something make shift to supply voltage over USB. Consider the LED more of a bonus feature than a buying point.TL:DR - This headset hits all the marks necessary to make this a worth while investment with low buy in and a surprising quality that was not expected. Physically feels solid, maybe a little too heavy. Has held up to the terrors of a teenage boy without missing a beat for 4 months. Features like noise cancellation and surround sound work as advertised. LED light up feature should be considered novelty and a bonus if you happen to plug into a PC where there is a USB plug available.
title: A surprising and unexpected quality for the cost

author: Sheri Crowley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
review_content: This particualra headset works great to enhance the immersion into the game now i know i said one flaw but my next staement is just basically accepted at this point. STILL NO COMFORT FOR PEOPLE WITH GLASSES! but lets just admit we put up with the headache for the games. The one proble with the headset is that it has a straight jack intsteak of an L-jack. The straight jack is extremely susceptible to cord damage causing sound distortion or no sound at all.  the L-jack just allows more flexibility while giving more support. I mean what a few extra dollars for a different jack compared to losing business because the product stops working?! EVEN TURTLE BEACH SWITCHED TO THE L-JACK. this a a great product it just need minor improvements. like maybe throw a volume booster in there or something i don't care i still like them still I'd say 8.5/10
title: Fantastic but Only one(ish) problem!

author: Matthew R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
review_content: My son is rough on headphones and seems to go through a set every 9 months or so.  His expensive headphones recently developed a short that was not in the cable.  We looked for a replacement and decided to look for a less expensive set.  These fit the bill.  The reviews were overwhelmingly positive and we decided to give them a try.  They are comfortable and they sound pretty good.  The microphone is clear and the sound quality meets my son's expectations.  The red lights look pretty good.  Now to find out if they hold up to abuse.  We decided to use zip ties to keep much of the cable coiled up.  (he tends to roll over the cable with his office chair)  Maybe this will help.
title: Inexpensive, comfortable and decent quality sound.  Great value.

author: Barbara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019
review_content: I bought one blue one of these and one red one. This headset is cheaper than most. It is very comfortable. The lights on it are pretty cool. It has one cord that plugs into the wireless controller and one cord that plugs into the xbox. You can use it just the way it comes to hear the audio in a game, but you do need an adapter for an xbox if you want to talk to anyone. The cords are irritating sometimes, but you know its not wireless when buying it so it's not surprising. While wearing the headset if I sat perfectly still I could hear perfectly. When I moved around while wearing the headset it had a bit of static. All in all it was a good purchase. My kids enjoy using it.
title: Looks nice, works good

author: Ryan E Maliksi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: I got the pair of headphones and it checks all of my criteria for1.Wearability and comfort (though it is quite bulky compared to other brands I've worn, it is still very snug and comfortable),2.excellent noise cancellation! if you wanted to spend $100-200 for some noise cancellation earphones (which I've had) and continue to use those earphones, this is a great set for a fraction of that.3. Functionality, it is great has a dual set of a headphone jack as well as a USB which creates the lighting effect on the headphones, has a great sturdy braided cord, and the audio and mic have worked perfectly for me4. Aesthetically, it is a beautiful headset, I love the lights (i wish they turned on without the USB though)5. Cross checked on my platforms of gaming which include: MacBook, PC, PS4, and Nintendo Switch.
title: Great quality gaming headset !

author: Matt and Suzy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2020
review_content: So I got this based off a lot of reviews here and figured this wired headset must be the best bang for the buck. I Just got these today and tried them out tonight for about 2 hours and all I can say is that Im going to return them. The mic is clear and the headset is comfy but what is a deal breaker is the sound quality. It sounds muffled. Ive seen reviews on here talking about how great the sound quality is and well they may have never heard anything better. Dont get me wrong but that sound is good but not great. It sounds muffled. Compared to other gaming headsets ive had in the past and most recently the Sony PS4 gold set, this headset sounds unclear. Explosions are not clear, voice dialog sounds muffled... Ive messed with the settings in warzone and my PS4 and just cant find that clarity. I plus my old wireless set back in and its clear as day. SO just beware, everything does work great. DOnt buy this for the lights though as the USB cord is short and you would need a extension to even plug it in to light up. The lights are really a gimmick but for me sound quality is the issue. I would think a plugin type headset would sound better than this did.
title: Very comfy but sound quality is lacking. Not very clear

author: Jennifer Jung
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: My review is based on having used this for the past 3 months. I was looking up reviews on youtube for a good headset and most of them were super expensive. Then when I browsed through Amazon I saw this one, which had pretty decent reviews. I'm not a hardcore gamer, but I enjoy playing games like Phasmophobia, Among Us, and RPGmaker games and whenever I stream on Twitch I have had no issues whatsoever with the sound quality. When playing with friends they hear me clearly. This is my first gaming headset so I can't compare, but as a beginner I am very satisfied with my first headset. I even use this for work calls when I am working from home! It is also super comfortable and I would have this on for hours without any sort of discomfort. Highly recommend for such a great value!
title: Nice product and very comfortable

author: Nate St.Clair
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
review_content: I've had the same turtle beach headset for over a decade, I figured it was finally time to replace it. I got suckered into a sale on this pair and they're just not good. The sound quality is horrific, sounds like everything is under water.  I assumed the USB meant the headphones were amplified or had power to them, but that's on me for assuming. The USB does nothing but power the "Interesting Looking" LEDs. They also advertise that the ear pads are breathable, and they are absolutely not. After 10 minutes my ears were sweating.So if you don't care about sound quality and just want a headset with LEDs that make it "Look like cooler" then by all means knock yourself out.1/10 would not recommend.
title: Not what I was looking for at all

author: kevin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: First thing is the heft of the product. These are very sturdy. In the past some headsets I have had just felt cheap. Not these. They are extremely well built. I don't worry about breaking them at all. Next is sound quality which is incredible. The ear pads are soft and wont hurt your ear. I have pretty big ears and they just barely cover them but I don't get part of my ears pinched like some other headsets do. They are slightly heavier than some other ones I have used but not so much as it is an issue. The only minor drawback I have is they do grasp pretty tightly to the sides of your head even when adjusting them, so after really long periods of use may you may need to take them off for a minute to relieve the pressure. This is not a major issue though as I would rather have them tight as opposed to slipping or falling off as I move around. Definitely recommend these 5/5 stars especially when comparing the price to other headsets of equal quality.
title: Extremely high quality for the price

author: Lou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: The Runmus K2 Pro Gaming Headset is a Gaming Headset which competes with other similarly priced headset at its price.This headset provides decent sound quality, better than my old headset, the BENGOO / Kotion Each G9000's which sell at a very similar price to these ones.The mic quality is very good, it's not the best quality, but this microphone blows my previous headset away which is the G9000. Although I couldn't see the noise cancelling being put in place, still a pretty good microphone and competes with other headsets in the 20$-50$ price range. You'll be able to talk to friends on discord or teammates in competitive-type games. The mic is also adjustable which is a plus.The fit is amazing, tons of padding on the ears which make it suitable for wearing glasses or for general use. The headset is very bulky, and is made mostly out of plastic. It's looks very big on your ears and suitable for gaming or office use.The headset has two connections attached to it, one is a 3.5 audio jack, and a USB port. The audio cable is for the audio and microphone, the USB is for the lights (no audio) for a console just plug in the audio jack into a console controller, however since there isn't a USB connection on most console controllers, the USB just dangles, which can be a bit annoying.The seller also honored their one-year warranty, when the headset audio suddenly wasn't working, the seller contacted me less than 24 hours and gave me a free replacement which has been working perfectly since then.In conclusion, I'd say go for it, they are honestly better than the BENGOO G9000's or any other headset in this price range, you can find this headset for the same price yet they are far more superior and futureproof.NOTE: YOU HAVE TO UNPLUG THE SPLUTTER ATTACHED TO THE HEADSET IF YOU ARE USING A CONSOLE OR PC with a 7.1 audio jack, this is mainly for PC's with separate microphone and headphone jacks.
title: Runmus K2 Pro Gaming Headset - Decent Headset at a Great Price

author: M. Nelson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: My son goes through headsets left and right with his PS4. He has had these for a while and they are holding up better than headsets that cost twice as much. He also uses this on his Xbox One with no problem. I have been impressed with the cable, normally he breaks headsets through the cable. It keeps getting twisted and eventually frays and no longer works. This one has lasted all this time and no signs of damage. I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a wired headset for your console.I can't speak for the nose cancelling but I always have to yell for him several times to get his attention. Not sure if that's due to the noise cancelling or him just being a teenager.
title: Great headset for the price!!

author: Hanna Duong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: I bought this headset for my boyfriend to use with his PS4. After playing with it for a while, we can confidently say that this headset is perfect for gaming! The sound quality is superb, the noise cancellation feature works great, and the cushions are extremely comfortable. His gaming experience is enhanced! For the price, it’s definitely worth it. It looks really sleek and cool as well.The only downside is that the USB cord is soooo short, only about 4 inches long, and if you’re using the headphone jack then you can’t plug it in the USB port, which means no LED light. It’s kind of disappointing because I chose this one because of the LED lights.However, my boyfriend loves this headset so much that we are gonna keep it anyway. The sound quality is off the charts! I tried listening to it and you can literally hear every drop of water in the game. Amazing!
title: Amazing quality!

author: The Little Generals' Mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
review_content: I bought these headphones for my son who loves playing video games, but is very rough on his headphones.  These are nicely made, good quality construction & much nicer than I expected them to be.  Are they the best headphones for gaming?  I’m sure someone who plays video games constantly could tell you they need to be better, but my son, who is 13, has had no issues with them.  He says they do a good job while playing games.  He certainly can never hear me when he’s wearing them & I need him to do something, but that may be that he is 13.  Overall, I would definitely recommend these to anyone who wants a good product & who does not want to break the bank.
title: Good Gaming Headphones for a Teenager

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I am not a "gamer" and did not buy this for an Xbox or PlayStation - I bought these for working at home. Starting off with the only con I've noticed in the few days I've used them: they are heavy due to the built-in lights. And, as far as the lights go, you can choose if you want them on or off. There is one "power cord' which seems to be a standard 3.5mm plug in. Split off a few inches from the end is another cord (USB) for the lights. I plugged them in, and they do look cool. However, I don't have them on most of the time.Now for the Pros: they are glasses friendly, able to flex a great deal, and have great noise quality. I wear glasses. On-the-ear headphones are very uncomfortable for me. These are over-the-ear and are VERY comfortable, even with the weight. The padding on the top and around the ears is very nice as well. This headset will not break from slightly twisting it; there is a ton of built-in give and take when it comes to these! Plus, the design looks cool. Finally, these are not noise cancelling headphones, but they do have great sound quality. I can hear things around me while I wear them, but I would say these are noise isolating. Full disclosure, while I have used these during Zoom meetings I have only barely used the mic. So far, so good. Worth the price!
title: Worth the price!

author: Andre Arnold
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: These headphones replaced a previous version that I really liked but finally the cord broke. Since I buy 97% of my stuff from Amazon and probably 99% of my electronics, I went back to Amazon with the plan to repurchase the same headset. I found them, the price was good, they had worked well for a long time, but then I saw your headset and read the reviews and they were slightly better than for my previous headset. The price between the two was pretty close…I think I purchased the Runmus pair because they looked better and the marketing was better. I am glad I did. The sound is much better, both the bass and the treble. They look great and feel sturdy. I like the volume control better also. So currently, I am very happy and would recommend to others…as long as they don’t fall apart!
title: Surprisingly Good - Great Value for Price

author: Alyssa D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_content: My step son wanted a new set of head phones for the holidays. I went all over Amazon to find something that looked decent and had some good positive reviews that would not break the bank.Enter these headphones - I had him open them today on Christmas eve since that is how we roll in this family. He has said they are great at noise cancellation for the most part.  They dynamic range is good on music and on gaming and are also comfortable. He was happy the mic didnt pick up background noise like his last ones did.Over all hes happy which makes me happy so I hope these hold up for the long haul. Will post a followup in 6 months.
title: Christmas for my step son

author: Austin C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
review_content: I really just got this headset to compare it to my Hyper X plug-in headset. I wanted to see the difference between a $70 and $20 headset. I will say that the sound quality on this headset was great! I was overly impressed. I might even like the sound better than my HyperX. It seemed to have a bit more leveled out sound. I don’t play online so I’m not sure about microphone quality. The headset is a little on the heavy side, but very comfortable. The pressure on the head is very light. The major con was just how hard it drained my controller battery. It’s like night and day compared to my HyperX. I had a fully charged battery pack that would normally last 20 gaming hours without a headset. My HyperX reduces the battery life to 10 hours. This headset took a half charged battery to zero in around 60 minutes. The other bummer is that this headset’s cable is very long. I’ll keep it for the $20 to give to a younger kid or maybe use it on my PC so I can keep it plugged in with the USB adapter.
title: Great Sound, Crazy Battery Drain

author: ieclbc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I'm reviewing this product as part of a promotion.Nevertheless! Product is amazing. After some time trying to figure out why the mic wasn't connecting - just had my own technical struggles to deal with - I managed to make it work and the sound quality is impressive. Very clear and crisp. I've used it for voice conferences as well and I have to say I'm impressed. Working from home sometimes gives you the inevitable and embarrassing background noise or people talking to you but this headset seems to be shutting all that background noise out for the other person on the call. Really great, I'm super happy about that. All in all would certainly recommend! Bit of a con side I guess is - as with gaming headsets - this one also look a bit bulky but it doesn't feel bulky at all when you put it on, so fear not!
title: Great headset for gaming, voice conferences

author: Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2019
review_content: My husband had asked for a gaming headset and was eyeing another brand, but after visiting the reviews for that headset, I was not convinced. Amazon pointed me toward Run Mus, who has much higher reviews and thousands more accounts of happy customers. So I decided to go with these instead.I could tell my husband was skeptical at first, but that lasted all of 10 minutes. He plugged them in to our PS4 controller, figured out the mic and volume control with ease, and launched Rise of the Tomb Raider. Big smile!I tried them out myself playing Death Stranding, and was pretty wowed by the quality. The headset sits comfortably for both of us (and my husband's head is kind of big, haha.) The cushion against your ear is great and definitely benefits the noise cancellation. I will say this isn't 100% noise-canceling, but it does the job as well as a pair of Bose noise-canceling headphones I use for work, and those cost $400. So, you're getting fantastic quality at a fantastic price.The material is sturdy without compromising flexibility. I feel as though you'd have to put good effort into it for it to break or snap anywhere. The cord for the jack and USB plug is covered sort of like a shoelace, and it's got a good amount of length (which I imagine is geared more toward PC gaming.) Because it is so long, it also comes with a velcro wrap to keep it tidy for when it is plugged into the controller.This is our first time buying anything from Run Mus, and needless to say we are looking into what else the brand has to offer. Pretty sweet deal!
title: Birthday gift for my husband

author: Wpjg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: I give these four stars for a few reasons. I’ll start with the negatives. First of all, they are enormous. I’ve never seen such a giant headset in my life! Not sleek at all. Secondly, the don’t fit very well on my head. They are adjustable in length so that’s fine, but the bottoms of the actual ear covers come out slightly near the bottom of my ear which causes it to not fully cover my ear. It puts a little pressure above my ear due to this and I cannot get the full audio experience unless I hold them down to my ears which obviously isn’t possible while gaming. Thirdly, they are made out of some cheap plastic and do not feel high quality at all. For these reasons, I almost returned them.That’s when I figured I would test them out before I send them back. And here’s where the positives come into play. These headphones sound incredible for the price. They must have just skimped completely on the actual material design of these just so they could put high quality tech inside the set. I immediately went to YouTube and searched for a 100D surround sound song to test and it realy surprised me how great they sounded. The surround sound is absolutely amazing and very clear. Sounds like you’re actually in the room with the artist. I recommend listening to Bohemian Rhapsody in 100D on YT. After a few more tests I decided to keep them. Even though they aren’t as comfortable or visually appealing as I had hoped they are worth the price and at the least a great backup set until you can afford to get something a little more high end.On a side note, as a bonus in the box is a free gift voucher in which you can receive another of the same headset for free or you can choose another one of their free items which includes a gaming mouse, headset stand, mini Bluetooth speaker, or a regular degular Bluetooth headset (not for gaming I believe). If you don’t want any of that stuff you can just choose to have them send you a $15 amazon gift card. Pretty cool. All you have to do is write a review and send them screenshots. That is another reason why I am choosing to keep this headset.
title: Too long, but do read

author: Elijah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           I got the K2 Pro High-Performance Professional Gaming Headset yesterday.  Overall, it's very comfortable and when plugged up to the Gaming Systems the surround sound is nice.  The noise cancelling microphone doesn't really live up to the feature. However, I like the fact that it is versatile in what platform it can connect to and it was almost plug and play.  I was even able to do my Spanish lessons on it flawlessly.  Note it has a usb connector but it is not for the mic/speaker.  USB seems to only be to provide power to the LED's on the headset.  I will give it 4 out of 5 stars on amazon because of the comfort, versatility, and the price.  I can't go higher because the description and box say noise cancelling but they really are not.  Even if it didn't say that the look and feel alone, I would spend 25 bucks for this and give 5 stars. Only thing left to test is the longevity of the headset.
title: Very comfortable and great prices.  Noise Cancellation is not there.

author: Joel S. Peters
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019
review_content: I got this headset as a Christmas gift for my son since he was in need of a new one. He says the sound quality is really great, the cushion padding is nice and soft, and he loves the red LED lighting, since it matches his keyboard. The headset is adjustable, so it should fit just about anyone’s head. Be advised that in order to turn on the LED lighting, you have to plug in a separate USB cord. The headset itself connects via a standard audio jack. The headset comes with an adapter so it can be used across multiple platforms.Considering the price I paid and the quality of the headset, this was a great Christmas gift and I highly recommend it.
title: Great product at a reasonable price. An excellent value!

author: theparentlife
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: Bought these after my turtle beach headphones died. Use the exclusively on XBox One. They were exactly what I wanted and needed.I'm not sure you can find a better wired headset for under $30. They are comfortable, feel quality made, have good enough sound quality and other people have told me the microphone is very clear. Also, the mic doesnt seem to pick up background noise almost at all.Not totally noise cancelling, but more than enough if you aren't a hardcore gamer. I still want to be able to hear a little bit outside my headphones in case someone needs me for something.The LEDs are nice, but I don't use them to avoid having another cord running to my xbox.Highly recommended if you want a wired headset at a great price point.
title: Great headset, amazing price for the item.

author: Tom Crocker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: First I love how soft and comfortable the ear cushions are. I love the sound quality for my music and videos. I am hard of hearing and the sound quality both for music and spoken words are very good and clear. I do not play games so cant comment on that aspect. They are made of plastic but i feel are very light and a very strong plastic indeed. The cord is heavy duty and covered with non-fray fabric. The switch for mic is heavy duty and works very well. The red lighting aspect is really cool. I have tried to use the mic for dictation but does not work very well for dictation. However that may not be the mic it maybe my Maine Accent. Over all a very good product and I highly recommend. They are equal to many headphones of much higher price.
title: WONDERFULL SOUND QUILITY AND SOFT EAR CUSHIONS

author: Ray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: 5 stars. I wanted to review it based on the first impressions that I had with it. I have tested it on both Xbox (using controller port) and PC (using regular on-board plugins).Xbox: Great sound, worked well out of the box and had no issues whatsoever. Mic quality was good as well, but may vary depending on your internet connection (had some feedback and echoing because of lag spikes during gameplay).PC: Great sound and mic quality, although both sound and mic did not work well out of the box, but after Windows updated it's generic drivers, it became quite good.Comfort wise, it is good for people with average to bigger heads (mine is big, wife's is average) and it worked well on both of our sizes.It does trap heat though which is normal, but can be annoying for some people. The velour pads are comfortable enough to wear for prolonged hours.Overall, I would definitely buy this product again for my friends who are into gaming. Thank you for reading my review.
title: Great quality at a very affordable price.

author: Mom2Superheroes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
review_content: Likes----Audio is incredibly clear! I could hear everything going on around me very well. I could hear gamers approaching me  before I could see them. It was a very different experience playing with these headphones.--Noise cancellation is awesome! When I'm wearing my headphones, I can't hear my annoying brother!--Mic sound is very clear. When talking to friends on the headset, my friends reported they could hear me very well and  there was a significant improvement from my old headset.--Looks really cool!Dislikes----The LED cord is VERY short! When I choose to activate the lights, I have to be extremely close to the console, which means I am very close to the TV.**UPDATE--Turns out this issue is only because I don't have the right attachment on my XBOX one controller. The LED lights require a normal size USB slot, and my controller only has a smaller one. If I had the adapter this would work just fine. Luckily that attachment is only to turn on the LED lights. Without that plugged in, the headset still works perfectly!--If I bump the cord that's attached to the controller, the audio does get slightly scratchy. Luckily this has been rare so far.
title: Extremely nice product!

author: Dave Iadeluca
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020
review_content: I love these headsets.  I have 2 pairs b/c my son has a pair.  They work fine for the price.  Do not expect them to sound like a $400 pair but for the money they are surprisingly good.  The base and mid ranges sounds are excellent with the bass sounding nice and not boomy.  The very high end range is not as high as a very expensive set of audiophile headphones, but if these are worn for long periods and you or your kids turn them up high ...then this could actually be e benefit.After being tossed down on the ground abused and used for a year my son never broke his pair.  His brothers and sisters used them and they did not die.  The cords are that new heavier cord that lasts longer.  They kept working after being beaten...That is why I purchased this second pair.Summary:  Excellent for the price, Mic works well...but please do not expect a $400 sound out of these headphones.
title: They work great.  Sound is basic but good for the price

author: La-loyd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: Got these for my 9 year old son. The headset is very comfortable, fits adult and children. The sound quality is crisp and clear, other players cannot hear family in background, so this is a nice feature. The sound wheel and noise cancellation are  easy to use once known how to. The cable is very durable and strong. He has been taking this everywhere, to the gym, on the road, to family members homes, braided cable is very nice. Headphones look very nice, not cheap. The mouthpiece is good quality as well. Our big problem is that when using with the Nintendo Switch, an adapter plug is needed due to the headphone jack's large size. We picked up an adapter at a local store for a few dollars extra and works great.
title: Nintendo Switch Compatibility

author: ThatGuyAgain665
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020
review_content: For gaming, this headset is great. it even has built in lights that light up when you plug in the USB, though it is not practical if you are planning to use it for everything, including making calls. Also, the mic isn't that good and has a constant "humming sound" that you hear with cheap microphones.The noise cancellation is rather decent, though not perfect and better than high end headsets, but it's good for the price.The sound quality is actually pretty good, and not what you would expect from some $30 headphones. the bass is also better than some of the other Onikuma headsets (Onikuma is the brand that also made these Runmus headphones)the overall quality of these headphones are good and I used them, but these are just the good qualities.Negative qualities include:Although the wire is long and braided, it still gets worn out over time and the wire at the end of the Aux cord is thinner than the wire that contains the volume control.The headset is a bit on the heavy side, so I just thought I would let you know. they definitely don't feel cheap, but aren't light, if you are looking for that quality in headphones.Finally, the mic quality is just bad. that's all I can say... It's just bad. so these headphones are pretty good at everything else other than the mic quality.
title: An honest review from someone that notices the little things.

author: Hannah Koch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: I was really pleased with this purchase. I have tried to purchase a few from other companies through walmart.com and they have not arrived and I am still fighting them over the delays and missing packages. Your product was delivered in perfect condition in 1 day. I have been using it for a few hours and it fits wonderfully, sounds amazing and the mic is clear. I am really pleased with this product and will recommend it to my other gamers. I am saddened I did not buy this first. Please keep up the great work and wonderful products for the gaming community. I am shocked at the quality for the price. People should stop paying four times as much for products that aren't even as good as this. Love, love, love!
title: Great Value for the price. Would buy again!

author: Tom S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
review_content: I bought the headset for use on the PC. The headphones are easy to plug in, but since it does not have its own driver, you have to use Realtek audio driver. It probably is easy to set up, but since I never  had to use Realtek before, it was a bit of a learning process. At first the headset would occasionally cut out or make static noises when ever I am using discord or starting a game. But I did find out that the old headset was still somewhat interfering and after disabling it, I have not had that problem since.The reason why I gave it 4 stars is that when I am using discord, when ever I put the mic on mute, the speaker audio loops into the mic and what ever I am listening to in the speakers, everyone else can listen too in discord. Its a small thing, but still a little bit of an annoyance.
title: Good Headphones, But Set Up is a Little Complicated

author: Luis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: I purchased two (Red/Blue) of these headsets for my kids. I researched buying something with good sound quality at a low price, and after opening the box, I was impressed by the quality.The headset's lights are bright and look appealing, as well as rugged and durable. The sound is better than average, or I felt good bass with clarity on games, movies, and Zoom.You get more than what you are paying buying the headset. I look forward to purchasing more products soon.Pros: High-grade sound (not to compare with Skullcandy crushers or higher-end headsets), good bass, has lights for those who seek a gaming setup, the cable is rugged and durable. Looks and feels good while providing quality and strong materials.Cons: They are big for little kids, heavy for some, 3.5mm cable may be considered too long, requires unplugging the cord to turn off lights.
title: High quality at a low cost

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_content: One of the best head phones I've had in a while. Audio and everything super clear. However if you have an older laptop it will drain more power and cut performance in different areas. My current laptop is a windows 10 Lenovo that I got back in 2017. So the laptop is more of the reason when there is tech issues, lowering graphics help with the problem, and honestly the audio and mike is super crisp. One thing you have to keep another eye out for is more for shipping. My first set I ordered did get lost in the mail (Amazon notified me and refunded me no problem) So I was leery of ordering it again but due to price and so many positive reviews I gave it a second shot couldn't complain.
title: Great product

author: ingrid towns
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
review_content: Purchased for my Grandson the price was great and the reviews were outstanding I felt confident in purchasing and most importantly my grandson was super satisfied seeing that I have purchased more expensive headsets in the past..I would say confidently give these a try I’m sure you will be satisfied just like I am and my gaming grandson..don’t hesitate purchase them..it’s well worth it...FYI : And they light up beautifully just make sure to buy a longer USB Cable extender cable to attach to headset to light it up the cord that comes with it is about 8 inches..the USB extension cables are very inexpensive around $9.00 for a two pack..ENJOY
title: Very Satisfied customer for the price!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
review_content: It’s a pretty inexpensive headset so I’m not sure why I expected better overall quality of this product. The LEDs only light up if the usb is also plugged in so if you want to game comfortably on your couch with the headset connected to your controller expect the LEDs will do nothing for you or work like you may expect. Noise cancellation is mediocre at best. The biggest frustration for me is the sound quality, not only does the volume seem excessively low even on max output, the sound comes out as though your in a long tunnel. If your looking for a good quality headset for gaming this is definitely not it.
title: Avoid this headset

author: Jeanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
review_content: This is a great product for the price. I am an online student, tutor, and gamer in my free time. This headset fits the bill on all counts for me. It is comfortable and not as heavy on my head as I thought it would be. The sound quality is great for what I need and the mic works well.I felt the need to take off one star due to my boyfriends assessment when I let him borrow the headset. He wasn't impressed with the sound quality, but he is much more of an audiophile than I am. Also, after just 10 minutes of use, he said that it made him too warm and was uncomfortable and sweaty around his ears. That isn't a problem I've had, but something you might run into if you run a little warm.
title: Pretty good

author: Tyrone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: Out the box very easy to setup and use. I'm using them for my ps4. Sound is fantastic including the microphone. It comes with adapters but sid not need them.Update 21 dec...I live the sound the headsets give off. I am trying to figure out how you plug the USB in while playing on the ps4. I have not seen one video yet where they have the headsets lit at the same time as playing. In the pic I show how close the usb is to the other Jack. Also, after you review the headset and send proof to the company THEY SAY they will send you a free gift. One of the free gifts was a k11 headset which I wanted. They told me they were out of stock. I asked when they would be back in stock. That was on 16 Dec and they have not replied back yet.
title: Great headphones for the price

author: Rebecca
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my son for Christmas so we have not tried them out yet but they look really nice. I will update later with quality but they look promising.Update: My son loves his new headset! We had to buy the adapter for our wireless headset, for whatever reason it did not work on our aftermarket plug-in headsets. But once we bought the adapter it's working perfectly. They are very solid and look really nice. One thing for the lights is it must be plugged into a power source via USB and the plug is short so you have to be close for that to work. Overall happy with our purchase and the company even offers a free gift.
title: looks nice

author: forsaken
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: I ordered this so I can play my PS4 at night when I get home from work.  My wife and I constantly argued over the volume of me playing my games.  She would snore so loud it sounded like a chainsaw with no muffler attached, so I would turn up my volume to hear, and then it would wake her up and I'd get yelled at to turn it down.  I was an endless cycle.  I tried other headsets but I just couldn't drown out her snoring.Then I got the RUNMUS Gaming Headset and it did something I thought was impossible.  I can play my PS4 and hear my game and I don't even hear my wife's snoring anymore.  The sound is clear, and its all a hear.  The ear pieces also very comfortable they don't make my ears hurt after wearing them for long periods of time.The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is that the LED lights only work when hooked up to a USB,
title: I don't have to hear my wife snore

author: Bad Chile
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: I have a wall of headphones behind me for work, all at least ten times the cost of these.  Yet for my kids I decided to pick up this headphone in case they break it given that they have a tendency to leave things on the floor.  With this headphone they can game while I work from home without me having to tell them to turn down the sound when I get a call or listen to whatever game they're playing.  These headphones are comfortable, appear well-built, the sound quality is better than expected, the microphone works well for gaming, and the lights are really cool. I would buy again if I needed another pair or this one gets misplaced.
title: Great headphone for gaming

author: Rook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: I spent over 100 hours in this headset in the past month, and really gave them a hard test. For this pricepoint, I genuinely think you won't find better. They do leave just a little bit of room on top, but the ears grip snugly and comfortably so they still won't budge; even after 6 straight hours, I barely notice that I have them on. I have a skinnier head shape, but they still conform to me (plenty of extra bend so I suspect they'll fit most anyone). The padding on top is hugely comfortable, soft to touch but firm enough that you won't feel plastic on your scalp. No bad molding seams to catch your hair on. If I'm running laundry - I can't hear it through these. The audio is impeccable. You shouldn't expect richness in low bass tones, but it handles audio crisply and without any speaker noise, higher quality than my Vizio audio. When nothing is happening, there's no white noise or static. Voice chat comes through with the clarity of VoIP. Voicechat partners have reviewed my sound, and tell me that the mic picks me up perfect - no complaints. Interestingly, they seem to hear less of my background noise than on other headsets, which is a huge plus for this mic setup. The mic itself is rigid once you've bent it into place, so you won't face the issue of mic droop every time you move your head. It's long enough to accommodate wherever you'd like to place it. I have had no issues with the 3.5 mm jack - no twists or pulls causing static or loss of connection (how annoying is that when it happens...). The volume dial is sturdy, and the fob with the volume and mute buttons are placed perfectly on the cable - not high enough to get in the way, nor low enough to be annoying. The mute button also has a nice, soft click into place, so you'll always know you've gotten it switched even in the dark. I've used this primarily through an Xbox controller, though I have loaned it to my wife for PC games. Connections work well for both. The cables are nicely wrapped, and I've noticed no indication of fray yet. They feel extremely sturdy. I've had other budget headsets from brands like Kotion Each (long-lasting choice, btw), and these are definitely made with a higher quality plastic. It feels thick in the hand, rather than flimsy. Absolutely no warping or bending yet. Lightweight as well, so you'll feel plenty free. They look exactly like the photos in person, so what you see will be exactly what you get, and they are handsome. So to sum up, if you're on a budget and trying to figure out if these are for you, they are. I expect them to last me a long time. Big ups.
title: More than you expect! (Thorough review)

author: Don H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: Just got these 3 days ago, but have used them for several hours each day since they arrived. The are very comfortable and have great sound. Much better sound than the set I had previously. I was amazed at all the additional sounds that I was able to hear in the game and the sounds come across as much more directional so it easy to tell if the sound is coming from behind your character or to the side (I am playing DDO).The headphones seem to be very well constructed and a good solid feel to them. I would definitely suggest them to others.Edit: Okay we are now 2 weeks into using these headphones every day. I am even more happy I purchased them now. They are very comfortable even after wearing them for hours. The sound quality is great and the mic is very clear. I use them in both discord and in game voice chat and no one has ever complained about the quality. The pick up my voice even while talking in a normal or quieter volume.On a lighter note the LEDs are quite festive and I turn them on when I turn on the Christmas lights every evening :)I would be even more likely to recommend them than when I first got them
title: Great quality headphones

author: Ben Balor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my PS4. And I have to say they have great sound quality! I have tried so many different headsets. My PS4 gold headset started having issues. But these are a great replacement. Sounds just as good and very affordable. They are very comfortable and cool on the ears. Destiny 2 sounds excellent! Very durable, the flexibility of these headphones is so nice. They wont break easy and with the metal support in the ears just adds to the strength of them. Mic quality is great, everyone says is super clear! They said its easier to hear me on these the my other mics. And they do not have much weight to them so you can game comfortably. I highly recommend these to anyone who is looking for a gaming headset on a budget. Though your getting a cheaper headset your still getting the sound quality of a expensive headset. You cant go wrong! 5 out of 5!
title: Run Mus Headphones is a must!

author: G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
review_content: I just started gaming and so I spent a pretty penny on my PC. I didn’t want to spend too much on peripherals at first and I came across this headset. The price was perfect and the reviews were amazing so I decided why not?Best decision ever. So soft and cushion-y! No more ear ache or head pain. I feel like the headset provides the perfect amount of pressure to feel secure without causing discomfort. The sound is great! Can definitely tell where people are coming in games. I haven’t had the headset for long so I’ll be updating the review if need be.Potential critique: the laptop I have one has two USB ports so the USB connector is a tad bit annoying, but still wouldn’t sway me from using/ buying this headset.
title: BEST HEADSET EVER

author: Dave W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
review_content: Saw the great reviews and even better price so I thought I’d get them a chance. Well the first pair I received sound/mic continuously cut in and out. I couldn’t figure out if it was a bad wire or connection or even my controller.So I sent it back and exchanged it for another pair. Sadly, it was no different..So that pretty much kills the review for me since I constantly hear my sound and mic cut out. The ear padding is rather comfortable but the top padding hurts my head after about 15 minutes no matter how many times I adjust it.I do like how far the mic is from your mouth and still picks up your voice rather well.The LEDs are cool but only if you use them with a pc or laptop.Cord is long with is kinda pointless in my opinion.Sound is mediocre but solid for the price.Would have like to give these a better review sadly just wasn’t possible.***Update 11/17/2020***Sound quality is mediocre and now my friends say they can barely hear me when I speak..Ehh...🤷🏽‍♂️You get what you pay for.
title: Gave these a chance twice..

author: Ferris10k
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: Just wow is all I can say. I’ve bought expensive headphones before and these are better then any I’ve had. The quality is absolutely amazing. I was shocked when took them out and saw how great the materials were. Very extremely high quality.The headphones are high quality, and I also want to point out the wires are as well. These headphones really shocked me in how great they ended up being.Sound wise it is spectacular. I play a lot of Call of Duty. I can now hear from the right, left or behind. The sound is amazing!  Furthermore my friends noted they can hear me through the chat better then any of my prior headset. The mic picks up great with zero feedback and it doesn’t pickup background noise versus some of my other more expensive headsets.I beyond recommend this. I’d put the sound quality on par with Bose. I’m not at all exaggerating. If your seeking a new gaming headset look no further. Take my word for it!  The price is excellent and quality will shock you!
title: Price and quality. In this case the quality far exceeded my expectations.

author: G. Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: So many reviews have been written already about how good these are.  I'm just going to tell you that with proper tweaking these are just as good as beats for bass and music.  This is a quality headphone no matter what you're using it for, yes they look dorky, but they're good and well built with a great microphone I don't see what more you could need.  A huge bonus is that they are very loud through my Android phone.  The volume wheel works really well with an even response across all volume levels.If you can get one for a reasonable price, go for it but I don't think you'll be disappointed at a $25 price range.
title: Shockingly good.

author: martoon96
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
review_content: Update: I wound up returning this headset. Overall the headset is pretty bulky and comfort level for extended gaming sessions just isn’t there. This headset has such high rating because the company selling it offers a free gift and amazon gift cards for high reviews. If you’re looking for a good bargain headset there are better choices.A good headset for the price.Sound quality is really good on this headsetand mic and chat sounded good too. The build quality feels solid and the braided cable seems good and strong.The comfort level is good but the ear pads don’t conform around the ear like some higher end headset, leaving some gaps that allow outside noise.My biggest disappointment with the headset is that the LEDs don’t work with consoles. I wish a way could be found to power the lights via the controller.Overall a good bargain headset with decent sound quality and chat capabilities.
title: A good headset for the price, not really.

author: Patrick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: Waste of my time and money. Hardly lasted a month before it quit working entirely.Pros:- decent sound quality, Fortnite/Warzone direction- noise cancellation is pretty good (doesn’t actively cancel, just muffles it alright)Cons- heavy- bulky- uses controller batteries, chews through batteries every 2-3 days.- poor fit, gaps under and behind the ears- mic won’t work if you plug headset in after the game loads (or after your controller batteries die).- definitely doesn’t light up- even the cord is heavy20/20: I’d pay $20 for this cheap headset before it barely lasted me a month. Now, I wouldn’t even waste my batteries on another one of these. Completely dissatisfied.
title: Straight trash

author: C's Mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: A bit on the bulky side and not as comfortable as I imagined them to be when viewing the product before I purchased them.  I've had the headset for about a week now and they are comfortable enough.  Sound quality is very good and mic works great.  I would say if Runmus could make the cushioning a little bit more plush then I would give these a 5Star rating.I do want to point out that I receive this product from Amazon in the manufacturing box.  It did not come in an additional Amazon box.  This was rather upsetting.  The box was DAMAGED and OPENED.  In todays COVID-19 environment, who wants to receive a package that is damaged on the exterior and opened. You have no idea who may have touched it.  Fortunately the headset were still inside its packaging on the inside of the box.  You would expect the manufacturer + Amazon to take all precautions to deliver merchandise safely and securely.
title: PS4

author: yoogyung yang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: I just picked these up yesterday and tested for its sound/mic quality. Overall, I can recommend this headset to many people who are on a budget. But with some more design/engineering improvement, this headset could be even much better.Fit/comfortThis headset feels comfortable with decent materials. It doesn't hurt to put on for a couple of hours. Note that this headset is pretty big though. It could feel pretty bulky for some people with a smaller head. The weight of the headset is fairly light, so the weight isn't heavy. It's just somewhat bigger than expected. Because it's kind of bulky, I do have a bit of room left right below my ears. So, depending on your head shape/size, it may not provide the perfect noise cancellation you are looking for.Material:Overall, it's made of light plastic with leather around the area where you skin contacts. These are decent material for a budget, but I think the manufacturer can use some improvement to use a better type of plastic or more wiremesh to give a bit more expensive feel. The leather cushion feels nice and comfortable, but the headset pieces may feel too light for some people.Sound/mic quality:I'm an audiophile with a lot more expensive headphones. Based on my personal experience, this sounds better than the $26 headset, but also do not expect the headset to have a $100+ headset. If you were to put a price tag on it, I can say it sounds like a $50 + headset. I personally will adjust eq on my headset so that I can adjust the sound quality\. On the other hand, the mic quality is clear and crisp.I would recommend this headset for people who are low on budget.**Suggestions to the manufacturer:1. Consider adding a 180-degree rotation axle so that the earpieces can rotate. This rotation in the phones will allow a perfect fit around the ears and the head, which will then allow every kind of head shape/size will enjoy the perfect noise cancellation.  This should help address the gap that I have underneath my ears.2. Consider using different types of material to provide a different feel to the material. Leather/cushion is fine, but the actual plastic pieces can be improved.3. Sound Quality: not bad for the $26 headset, but some more engineering could make it even better.
title: Good Gaming Headphones for the price

author: SW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
review_content: I purchased 2 of the red headsets, one for my PC and one for the Xbox One.The items were shipped and arrived in a timely manner.The packaging is VERY professional, vibrant and clean in appearance while also sturdy to protect the headset in shipping.  The headset was neatly wrapped in bubble wrap inside the box, cords neatly wrapped and assembled, easy to remove for use, and with instruction manual.Verified works for Xbox One (newer controller that doesn’t need adapter) and PC.I have used them during gaming, while watching videos and listening to music.  The sound quality is excellent and I'm very happy with not only the great sound but also the surround sound and gaming experience!Very comfortable to wear and fits well on my head and they seem very durable!The actual wire/cables are super solid and protected by an outer sleeve layer of “threaded” type cord. Not the plastic stuff. They have a great length to them and seem durable. Super extra bonus...you not only get the headset jack that goes into any headphone jack or newer Xbox controller, but it also has the mic/headphone splitter for your pc. I had to purchase a separate splitter cord for my previous headset. It all has a usb plug to illuminate the mic and headset with the color I purchased, which is red.There are a couple of downsides.  One, the mic out of the box is very low when connecting to pc but with some settings adjustments it worked out fine. The other downside is there is a slight crackle/static sound when plugged into the Xbox One controller if you move the plug at all.  Doesn't make the sound unless you bump the jack near the controller itself.Overall I am happy with my purchase and would recommend this for average gamers for the super great price!
title: I can’t hear you for the great sound in my headset!

author: StillSearching
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019
review_content: I liked this headset; first time trying a RUNMUS product.  Sound quality is excellent, and price was very good.  I let a friend try them on, and he said, "Wow, this is like movie surround sound quality."  Purchasing this kind of headset, I worried that the ear pieces and crown would be stiff and cause ear/headache over time, but there was none of that- the flexibility of the crown and padding on both the ear pieces and crown make it very comfortable to wear.  Only thing that might have edged it to 5 stars for me was that I'm in an area with a lot of ambient noise and the microphone arm had just a single pivot point (at the ear), and I would have liked the boom microphone piece to be able to be closer to my mouth to reduce that.
title: Great Headset, great value

author: airwalk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: The headphone seem bulky, and in comparison to other headphones they are, but not in a bad or intrusive way. They're lighter than the look and the bulkiness makes it feel sturdy so they don't feel like a cheapo set.The padding is nice, you can game for hours comfortably, and the noise cancellation is nice. The audio quality from the speakers is good, no distortion at a high volume, and it's a clean sound from high to low frequencies.The mic seems solid, I haven't had any complaints from other players about too much background noise, and everyone has said they can hear me just fine.The leds are cool and have a nice glow without looking frosted or dim. Just a nice glow effect like they should be. Overall, these headsets are worth the price and over deliver in expectations. I would definitely recommend and will most likely grab another pair for the boys.
title: Budget friendly beast that won't disappoint.

author: BT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
review_content: **Update 3/27/20**  Reached out to the seller a few days ago and asked them about their headset. Expressed I was disappointed in the quality. I was promptly given a replacement. And this morning I got an email from “Tara” following up and asking how the new headset was working out.I’m still disappointed that the first one had an issue. But their customer service has been top notch. Bumping stars from 2 to 4 to reflect customer service and replacement of headset (it was outside of their 30 day guarantee).  As long as the headset works it really is a solid headset. 5 star worthy. I’m just holding one star back because of the hassle.**Original**Sounded fine. Mic worked well. Headset dropped about 2.5 feet from desk to carpet and stopped working. Worthless. Couldn’t withstand a small drop on carpet?  Been used less than 3 months. Very disappointing.
title: Awesome Customer Service - Short drop - stopped working

author: Carlos A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my older son.  He uses it to play Fortnite, and he loves it. He says that he hears where people are, and who is coming at him from every direction.  He used to use the apple earbuds, and they do not even begin to compare to the sound of these.If you are a gamer, this is a great product for a fair price.UPDATE:  I bought asecond pair for my other son.  Now they both paly fortnight with their headsets.  They love them.  I used it myself on the game and the sound is crisp.My sons dont necessarily take the best care for their headphones, and thse have held up without any problems.  IF you have kids that are into gaming, I highly recommend these headsets.
title: Clear Sound and great gaming headset

author: SaxSun .com
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019
review_content: At work I provide Brand domains in stock and Digital affiliate software at discounted prices. This headset is the Business headset I am going to use as my new idea is that they have been modified and specialized and are solid with comfort and features so how much better they can be for just business conversations with noise cancellation and better microphone than business headsets . author: Teresa Robinson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Speaking from an Xbox owner’s point of view, these headphones are great.  Their build quality is solid and it’s nice that the microphone locks in different positions to prevent inadvertent movement.  The sound quality from the microphone is pretty clear as well.  No extra  cables are needed for the Xbox, and a USB-A connector is attached to the headphones as well for PC users.  I’m able to use these headphones for hours at a time without any discomfort.  It’s also nice that there is a volume dial in the middle of the cable in order to get the audio level precisely the way you’d like it.  For the features and quality available, these headphones are very good value.
title: Great for Xbox

author: bartierbreezy69
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
review_content: The headset has great noise cancellation capabilities and fantastic sound quality, however the chord that connects the headset to an xbox one controller is a bit...I'm not sure how to put this, but loose. It moves around a bit which then gives off a terrible feedback sound that is heard through the controllers. Also, the other people that are in the voice chat party with you will hear if you are moving around (or breathing) because the chord's feedback will give it away. Overall great product but the chord/aux adaptors need to be improved.OH WAIT, ALSO, not sure why they made the LED factor ONLY operational when plugged into a USB port.. With the chord being so short, I can't connect it to anything. Not sure why they didn't either make that chord longer or make that LED factor a chargeable thing.overall though, the headset FEELS great, DOES have great sound (when I'm not getting feedback) and I also may have a feeling that this may be an isolated issue with this headset? I am going to order another to find out.UPDATE: played again on a different AL day and I didn’t hear any feedback or interference. VERY HAPPY aside from the LED feature
title: Headset is great overall.

author: Maximo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: Haven’t really tried a lot of headsets but as far as this one goes and for the price I think it’s great..it’s a little bulky,they do slip kinda easy if you make fast movements so I always wear them over my hat ..overall feel nice..only downside in order for the lights to work on this you have to have them plugged to USB port so if you play far from tv like me then it might be a problem..I did try using the portable cell phone chargers and it does work but that’s just another thang hanging from the cord ..headset is so big figured they would fit two AA batteries in them but 🤷🏽‍♂️ Hope this helps somebody ..
title: Awesome for price..

author: Cody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_content: 5 for the noise cancellation i use these for gaming and among other things let me tell you that you will not hear your wife cheating on you in the next room while you game with this bad boys.-Pros-cancellation of noise awesome close to my tritons,feels durablecool red glow!cable to headset is thick and long (thats what she said) enough to hang your self with. and keeps the cable from kinking-Cons-microphone is lacking, i turned this thing up on the controller that it comes with and turned it up all the way in the audio settings for the microphone and it sounds like im still whispering. Unless you stick the mic so close to your mouth that it feels like your about to tease the tip but not finish it off. so thats why i gave it a 3 starbecause i bought it for gaming but now just use it when playing music or on the plane. Or when i dont want to listen to my wife anymore since her nagging is making my ears bleed.so yeah that my review. thank and merry Christmas, also happy birthday hope this helps you in more ways then 1.
title: sound quality 5 but the microphone is very lacking

author: Cameron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
review_content: I gave it 2 stars as opposed to 1 because I understand not ever model will be complete junk oit of the box. But mine was.Straight out of the box, the model I received had poor connections made in the mic. Lots of crackling and nobody could hear anything I was saying. In order to keep the price point low, corners have to be cut anf poor manufacturing & assembly are some of those corners.As far as I could tell, the audio quality was as good as the $85 turtle beach model I had prior. Clear, except when anything loud came through there was a bit of crackling and distortion.Comfort was average.Using this with a console is less than ideal especially because the cord has a usb & 3.5 jack which makes it cluttery and a bit of a hassle to deal with.I get it, it's cheap...but no way this thing lives up to the review rating average it has. C'mon guys, let's be a little more conservative with those 5 star ratings.
title: IT'S UNDER $30 FOR A REASON...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
review_content: Bought two of these (one red, one blue) so my wife would have a headset for her Nintendo Switch and I could have a new headset for my Xbox One. The sound is great, but the headset is rather large. The mic boom seems to stick pretty far out there and cant be bent to adjust. Just up and down.  But I havent had any trouble with friends being unable to hear me at all.It's unfortunate that the lights are really only usable by a PC player. Not using the lights, the added USB attachment and cord is a bit cumbersome. I use a rubber band to keep it at a minimum. Unfortunately a week or so in, I have some piece rattling around inside the left ear piece. I'm thinking maybe some part of the lighting, because the sound is still fine. Haven't checked the lighting though. Wasnt a big enough concern for me to return, so I don't have any feedback on the customer service at all.The cords are nice and long. For me, that means it all sits in my lap, rubber banded to the length I need. But if you've ever played a switch, you know that the headset plug is on the screen unit itself. My wife likes to play with the switch in the dock on the TV, so the long cord helps her sit back in a chair and be able to play.Overall, for the price, it is a pretty darn good headset. Both of us enjoy it, and we can play together now and both chat with old friends while we do.
title: Good for the price!

author: Travis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: Just got my headset delivered. All in all looks great and fits my head well without hurting my ears. I have a big head and my ears are odd shaped so they get in the way for some headsets.Pros:they fit comfortably and adjust well to what you need.Mic doesnt seem to be cheaply made and pics up my voice really well, that being said it picks up noise REALLY easily. Not a problem though.Easy controls and I enjoy the mute mic slide on the adjust volume port.Cons:Immediately out of the box it has connection port issues into the xbox controller by the 3.5mm Jack. If I even slightly move my controller in any direction other than forward it has some of the worst connection static that can completely cut my voice out when talking.The cable may be a little too long for some who don't directly connect it to a computer for gaming. Not a problem to me because I just tuck in on my side and it's fine.Not exactly sure about the 7.1 as I have a sades gaming headset from 5 years ago that has clearer crisper sound with zero issues to this day. (I'm very very careful of how I treat my microphones) they have never even seen a 1 inch drop onto the couch.So to chalk it up, the headset is good for a beginner headset just getting into gaming. For professional players it does not have the sound you need for real dedicated directional information relay. Also it is slightly muffled? Could just be my headset and not everyone else's? It sounds as though the headset has a thicker foam pad over the speakers themselves giving it a less crisp and clear acoustic sound.I take gaming seriously as it is a career for me so for others I am giving as positive a review as I hear and see.5.0 for comfort4.5 for adjustments - could squeeze less5.0 for microphone crisp clear voice chat5.0 for a long cable3.0 for static cable connection through xbox 3.5mm port4.0 sound is a bit muffled like there is a pillow case between the speaker and your earsOtherwise great headset at a very good price. Honestly can't beat it. If you give then a 5 star review they send you free stuff.For professional gaming I'm still in search of a better headset than the Sades I am currently running from 5 years ago.
title: Great for price, but not for professional gaming.

author: Will
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
review_content: I bought these to replace a very old pair of Logitech headphones I had.Bass and sound quality is lacking. Had to fiddle with my equalizer to get the sound quality decent. However, in voice calls I am able to hear my friends better than before.The mic had some issues at first: I thought it wasn't working at all at first but it turns out the output of the mic was just super quiet and I had to crank it up to be able to be heard. After that, no problems. My friends can hear me well enough. Not as good as my previous ones, likely because of noise cancellation, but that might actually work out in my favor considering how over-sensitive my old ones were. (Update: no, still garbage.)The headphones themselves are very comfortable, and I really like that they glow. I was surprised to learn that I needed an audio jack, mic jack, and a usb port to plug these in, but that wasn't really an issue for me. All parts are included and I have the ports readily available. I like the versatility between platforms.EDIT: After owning these headphones for a bit, I'm deciding to change my rating to two stars. The microphone is garbage and so is the sound quality. They're comfortable and they glow, but that's about the only thing good about these. The company did send me a secondary pair of these headphones for free which was cool, and they're very polite, but I don't think that's enough to give them 5 stars anymore.
title: They're Pretty to Look at but that's it

author: Blaine Thomas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: These are my first surround sound headset so I don't have much to compare them to, but overall I've been pretty satisfied with them. I have a surround sound and I love playing on that but when I want to play with my friends I have to have the audio turned down so low to be able to hear them with my one ear headset. This puts me at a disadvantage when I can't hear or tell where footsteps are coming from on games like call of duty. The sound quality is better then I anticipated for an inexpensive pair of headphones, I can generally tell which direction someone's coming from and the audio is clear and mostly crisp. A couple reasons why they didn't get a 5 star: The 3.5mm jack that plugs into the controller is some what finicky, if I bump it at all when I'm playing it will make a scratchy sound and occasionally I have to spin the cord as one ear will cut in and out. I usually don't bump it so it's not something that happens often.
