The other issue is that some of my friends headsets have two separate volume controls for voices and game audio which would be really convenient. Sometimes on games like call of duty when someone calls in a helicopter or an air strike, the audio is so loud that it drowns out my friends voices. When someone has a helicopter in the sky for 30 seconds it makes it extremely hard to communicate with them during this time
title: Solid overall headset with a few minor flaws

author: derek vickrey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2019
review_content: First off lets talk quality:-Sound: Clean crisp sound with decent bass and great noise cancelling due to over the ear cushion and tight fit.-Mic: Picks up sound easily and comes through clearly.-Structure: As expected for the price, cheap plastic components make up most of the sections (speaker housing and adjustable headband) with the only metal being a thin sheet on the adjustable headband into the speaker housing.Pros:-Great price-Great sound-Cord length is a little over 6ft which is very convenient.-Works with my PS4 and PC with easy plug and play connectivity.Cons:-Upon arrival it was VERY tight on my head almost instantly giving me a headache. As for size comparison, I let my 9 year old daughter try it on and she had the same effect. However, after some use it loosened up a bit and is no longer a pain to wear.-The mic is also very tight and hard to adjust on the 90° pivot. Also, only straight mic with no adjustments to get it closer to your mouth if needed.-The sound and mic is ONLY from the standard stereo 3.5mm plug and NOT the USB. The USB is only for the lights in the headset.Overall would recommend purchasing these if you are looking for an affordable headset that's versatile enough to connect to the main devices we use daily.
title: Great sound, great price; very bulky.

author: Larry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: I’ve now played 3 days with this headset and I’m very pleased. I’m using these on a PS4 and the sound is incredible compared to my PlayStation Gold headset. They’re also much more comfortable. My PS Gold headset pushes on my right ear causing it to get sore. This headset has plenty of room inside. There are pros and cons when going with this style of headset but for the price they can’t be beat in my opinion.Pros:Sound greatDon’t need to be chargedVery comfortable, don’t bother earsPlenty of volume adjustmentCons:Must be plugged in to controllerVolume control is only a master volume. It increases game volume and chat volume at the same time. Would be great to be able to control them independently but I don’t think any wired headset can.LED light cord is only slightly longer than audio cord. It would be nice to have the audio cord shorter and the LED cord to reach a power source.
title: Extremely Comfortable and Excellent Sound!

author: Rachael Edwards
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: I've been gaming with Apple AirPods while searching for good headphones and the difference is night and day.The sound is crystal clear.People can hear me when I speak.There are no problems connecting to my computer.It feels sturdy and I don't fear that it will fall apart.The lights are cool, AND you can unplug the USB-A cable to turn them off.The ONLY thing that I wish I learned earlier is that it includes a Y adapter for setups (like mine) which require separate audio in/out lines. Good thing for me that I didn't open the Y adapter I purchased with this so I can return it!So the lessons I learned were: purchase these headphones immediately, don't purchase an audio Y adapter, and NEVER game on Apple AirPods.
title: Great headphones at a good price.

author: Lilith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
review_content: Please keep in mind I'm new to the gaming world when I say these things.I thought these would sound really bad but they don't, I can hear everyone perfectly at max volume (it's a bit loud a max) and everyone can hear me perfectly. I must add that the head phone jack on my controller wasn't working so I had to use an adapter to use the headphones. I saw the amount of bad reviews on this headset which made it feel really risky buying them, since I'm on a tight budget. To my surprise they are awesome!My only issue with this headset is that the cable tangles a bit easily, not enough for it to be a serious issue though. Other than that I think they're great.
title: Surprised Me!

author: CryptoZeus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: I had to get a pair of headsets for my Xbox one because my PS4 headsets didn’t for it. After browsing for a while a ran into these and let me tell you.I had these headsets for a few days now and let me tell you these headsets are absolutely fantastic for the price. Sounds quality is very good. I can hear foot steps very well. I can also hear everything else that’s going on in game with no interruption at all. And when I’m playing with my friends they sound clear as day and they can also hear me perfectly fine. They haven’t complained to me about any mic problems.Another thing is design, these aren’t bad for the price considering they are a little bulky but that doesn’t bother me at all since I only use them to game and nobody else can see me use them.  And light up works fine for me. But one thing that surprises me Is how sturdy they are for the price. You don’t have to worry about easily breaking the headsets. One thing I just wish I can modify is the length of cord it has.Last thing is comfort. Considering they are bulky these headsets fit very comfortably and I get no pain around the ear and they are light.Overall, very happy with these headsets.
title: Overall great

author: The Sane One
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: I bought the K2 red headphones under the guise they were a gift for my 10-year-old son's birthday, but they were actually a present for me. Every day, I was being audibly waterboarded; high-pitch voices of prepubescent gamers flooded my auditory perception via the exploited-volume of our telephone's speaker. Months of unrelentless torture had taken its toll and murderous, deliberately camouflaged as accidental, plots against our once-adored gaming systems consumed my thoughts until now. These headphones are my proverbial knight in shining armor!My son and 13-year-old daughter don't know how they ever lived without such a luxury. I was initially looking for bluetooth headphones, but when I saw these connected via the game controller I figured it wouldn't be too cumbersome and I could save $20.00 in the process. My kids said the sound is amazing. The noise-canceling feature must be effective since I have to shout in order for them to hear me. Our virgin ears are impressed!
title: 10 & 13 year old Love Them!

author: Ken Diggy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: I've bought a whole bunch of these inexpensive types of headsets over the years, and have gotten pretty lucky wihb these ones again. They sound pretty good for the price, no ice cancelation seems to work well, and people can hear me well while in chat. I've only used them for my Xbox one so far, but I'm happy with the purchase. Just know that through the Xbox headphone jack you don't get the LEDs, but that was unimportant to me.They're a little big, but not overly heavy, so they don't get uncomfortable for the couple hours I've worn them at a time. Good all around budget headset that I would buy again!
title: Great Budget Headset

author: Gary D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
review_content: My son LOVES his K2 headset!He wears it for gaming with his friends but also just for watching his regular shows in TV.At first I thought they weren’t working, it took me a while to configure the headset/Xbox sound settings, the instructions are a little tricky to follow for a Non-Gamer-Dad, but we got there in the end.The noise canceling works great and the sound is impressive for a headset that’s on the cheaper side of the market.The build quality is pretty good, it seems solid enough for a Rookie-Gamer, and so far my 7yr old hasn’t caused any damage to it.The only down side is that the red lights don’t work if just plugged into the wireless controller (only work if directly connected to the console), which is no problem really as you’re too busy gaming to care about the lights.Overall a good starter headset, I’m happy if my son is happy.
title: Good Starter Headset for the money

author: Pamela Castillo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: Dec. 17th, 2020All that I can say is search no further...  you have found the headset that you need right here. Absolutely beautiful sound, clean and crisp, great bass is not muddy, mid and hi's.  Kitaro never sounded better except in a live concert. Now I am looking for a longer audio cable so I won't have to just stay at my desk to listen to my music. I want an extra pair for myself, for my husband, and my step-son.The mic is clean and clear. I have bought at least 15 headsets and none can compare to the quality of these.I will update this review if anything changes.
title: OMG Stunning sound

author: Michelle Holt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
review_content: I’ve been using these for 5 days. I live in FL, our youngest lives in MI. His band of Merry Men wanted me to join them so I did. I’ve had a blast using this headset. 6ft cord. Great length. Great sound outgoing as well as incoming! I love that it lights up. Makes me feel like a real gammer. All the guys said the sound clarity was excellent. They all were loud and very clear. I’ll tell you these are comfortable like I’m not wearing them. After hours of playing each day I truly thought they would bug me wearing them that long but they are so comfortable. Arrived well packaged. Good price.
title: Comfortable even after wearing for hours. Clarity is outstanding outgoing, and incoming.

author: Andrew W. Howat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
review_content: I bought this to replace my PS4 wireless gaming headset, which was falling apart. I was a bit hesitant about them at first because it seemed a little too good to be true - very low price point, but loads and loads of 5-star reviews?After a week or so using it for gaming, I can report that it's as good as people say, with only two minor reservations.So, the good first:- surprisingly solidly-built- large ear cups make it pretty comfy, even for those of us with big heads- cable feels like is pretty sturdy and will easily withstand regular use- unusually good surround effects compared to my Sony wireless headphonesThe bad, or rather the 'meh;:- they feel a tiny bit TOO big, as in, they are a little heavy to wear (not a problem for me, but maybe for small people),- the frequency response profile of these phones is a little odd, something that's only really obvious when you're playing a game featuring music.I'm not an audio expert, so I'm not sure how to describe this second issue accurately. Suffice to say, it sometimes feels like certain frequencies are getting a bit squashed (perhaps in the mid range?). This can make music sound a little peculiar at times. As if you're not getting not as full a sound as you might get from fancier headphones. But to be clear, I'm used to playing music through my beloved Bose Quietcomforts, which are expensive and awesome. In addition, I don't care about this. All it means is you shouldn't buy these if you wanted them primarily to listen to music, which I doubt anyone does. As gaming headphones, thus far, they are excellent and I am completely satisfied with them.Full disclosure - I was offered a free gift for writing a review. This makes me like the company, but not enough to lie about their product, hence my writing a balanced review.
title: Surprisingly excellent for the price

author: Paige
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019
review_content: When I first got these gaming headphones they were unbelievably comfy, great sound quality, and a lot more. However, the noise cancellation wasn’t working. Maybe it’s me, but I could still hear all the background noises I originally heard before I got these headphones. However, that was a small con, but the biggest issue about these headphones that after a few months (maybe 1-2) the headphones randomly only work in one ear. I easily fixed this by unplugging and replugging the main headphone wires back in. This was very annoying but even worse, after a few more months, (maybe 3-4) they ONLY would work in one ear no matter how hard I tried to fix it. So, to sum this it up, it is great for gaming, sound quality, etc, but if you don’t want to spend $40 on something that will only last 3-4 months, then scroll by these headphones and research another.
title: Good gaming headphones when it lasted.

author: Michael De Maria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: I've had the Xbox One since it came out (the old one) and have only used the standard headset. I've had to replace that headset 3 times already...So recently, I had to replace it for the 4th time. I figured this time I'd splurge for a high quality game headset that should promise to last a little longer, and I stumbled across this beauty.  When you open the box, it feels like you're lifting tech from the gods (or it did for me since I was using pretty basic stuff until now. I plugged it in and put it on and haven't stopped smiling. The sound quality is great, the noise cancelling is fantastic and the cable connecting the headset to the controller is beyond strong, so I have high hopes this headset will last a fairly long time.One other feature I really love is the sound control that's on the cable. I like to be able to hear what's going on in my house in case someone needs me or if I'm home alone. The sound control is a simple, but sturdy feeling rotating know that lets me turn down the volume to hear the outside world while still being able to focus on the gaming world. And if I need to listen for footsteps or something in the game, it's easy to grab it and turn up without sacrificing a lot of time. Really great feature.For those looking to buy, you need to make sure you know what connection you controller needs. If you're using original Xbox one controllers, you will need to buy an adapter. However, if you are using new Xbox One, PS4, computer, etc. the cable comes with a USB and audio jack already integrated, with an audio jack splitter that allows for two connections.Last thing: The headset is slightly bulky so you may want to invest in a headset stand if you can afford the space it takes up. The headset's brand, Runmus, has a good stand or you can look for other options on here.
title: Really solid headset

author: David Reich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: I have a few feels about this product.  First off this is a really neat headset for my kids.  The only thing I wish is that you can have the headset lit while you are using it.  But since the LED lights only come on when the USB is plugged in and the cord is extremely short this is not possible.  HOWEVER!!  other then that they work wonderfully.  They are rugged enough for my 9 year old son to use them almost all day bouncing around while playing fortnite!  We just moved half way across the country and so the headset allows him to talk to his friends/cousins over the PS4 while playing and gives him that opportunity to stay connected to them while playing games together.  I KNOW that the noise canceling is AMAZING as I and his mother have yelled at him MANY times and he seems like he cant hear us in any way....Im sure its the noise canceling....right?!?!  Seriously though...When he finally realizes we are talking to him he removes the headphones and says ...WHAT?!?!  Finally, the cushioning is very thick yet soft on the ears and top of head.  My kids would leave it on all day if I let them!  All around amazing pair of headsets that are at an excellent price point!
title: Great headset that keeps my kids connected to friends!!

author: bbm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
review_content: I bought this at the request of my 13 year-old, who loves his gaming.As soon as it arrived, he had it glued to his head.He loves the sound, says the noise cancellation is light years ahead of his old ones; I guess that must be right; he never seems to hear me when I call to him.The sound quality is very good. He says  it, also, is way better than his last  headset.Overall, is has been a great purchase. I have only had it for a couple weeks, so I cannot comment on longevity.I would recommend it. The price was good, the sound is good, the comfort is good.
title: My gaming addicted son loves it

author: Edward S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: I'm not a serious gamer because I didn't have a headset. But after playing online and thinking of great comebacks or commentary for mouthy 9 year olds, I thought it was time to get a set and enter the realm. I wasn't looking for anything serious. Also, with a new baby I needed to be able to not wake her up using the surround sound while exterminating hordes of savage zombies. I was happy with the reviews of these. Although the light feature is nice, it's a pain with PS4 but the headset works fine without it. This is more of an issue using a console than the headset. Just know. Pretty good sound quality but ventilation isn't very solid. Do you want ventilation or noise canceling? I'm not sure you can have it both ways at this price point. Value is the name of the game here and if you are 30-something wanting to pwn 9 year old kids with "yo mamma" jokes, these are for you. Also, I'm officially a serious gamer now. Find me on the leaderboards, n00bz.Update: still going strong! Got a free headset for review. For this great value, I got two for the price of one! Can't beat the deal. 5/5.
title: Value is the name of the game, n00bz.

author: Carolina Lopez Ruvalcaba
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: the light doesn’t turn on unless you plug it into a usb so if you’re like me and you’re playing on a console you won’t be able to use these to their full capacity. nonetheless, these were only okay for the 3 days they lasted me. they were comfortable but not for long hours. I’m hard of hearing and I put these at the highest volume and I could barely hear. eventually, they gave out fully and I couldn’t hear at all. I thought it was just me but I made my mom try them on and she couldn’t hear either. unfortunately, I didn’t get to test out the microphone. I recommend to take advantage of the Black Friday sales on the various gaming headsets available right now and buy yourself one of those for $10 more. if you’re reading this in the future they’re simply not worth any money
title: this is the worst headset I have ever used

author: Ryan5147
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: I needed a new set of headset for my PC, but I didn't want to spend too much money. After reading the reviews of this headset I decided to give it a try.The first thing I noticed was the way it sat on my head felt funny. The cushions on the speakers felt bigger than my head. After playing around with it a bit, I was able to make it fit a bit more comfortably. Even with it feeling too big for my head the noise cancellation worked wonderfully as I couldn't hear my wife walk up behind me and start talking, but she did scare me when she touched me.The sound quality is better than most of the more expensive headsets I own. Having the controls for the volume and a mute for the microphone is really nice since I don't have to leave my game to do that anymore.The microphone seems to work with out any problems. Being able to move it up to the side of the headset is an added bonus.I don't really use the LED lights since they stay on when my PC is off. I had them on briefly and they make it look cool but it's not a feature I really need.I recommend this headset. It is priced low but the quality is high.
title: Great Quality for a Low Price!

author: H20skimum
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: I was really excited to get these because of how many reviews they have and how high of reviews.Pulled them out of the box put them on and hated them within 5 minutes.I played with them for a couple hours to give it a chance and then boxed it back up and sent it back. They aren’t the worst things ever, but even at a low price of $40 there are much much better options. Even the $20 turtle beaches were superior all around. IMO not worth the money. Go on YouTube and look up some better options under $50. There’s a dude named the techne on YouTube that does in depth reviews at all price ranges.In particular, I found them heavy and really bulky, not very comfortable, they were way too loose, and the sound quality was very meh. Again even the $20 turtle beaches beat these in comfort, sound quality, build, and overall quality. Also idk if it was just the cheap build or maybe I got a defective one, but when I plugged it into my Xbox controller it made a lot of scratching and static sound whenever I’d move around and shatter the eardrums of everyone in my party including myself. Even if that didn’t happen, they still weren’t very good quality.
title: There are much better options at under $50

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2019
review_content: When I first received this set of headphones, I was very surprised at how good the sound quality was. The surround sound works very well. I can hear sounds that "happen" all around me.The overall construction of the headset is very sturdy. The mic boom is made of a flexible metal that feels quality. The mic can be moved to any position that you would like it to be, and the sound quality is very good.The head strap has also a flexible metal strip running from ear piece to ear piece. There is a memory foam insert at the top of the head strap to help cushion it.The sound damping capabilities are alright. It works well enough, but a lot of noise gets through.Overall, I really like this headset, and would recommend it to anyone.
title: Great headset for the price

author: William Harkcom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_content: Great headset for the cost. The audio quality is fine for music and gaming. The headset blocks ambient noise better than my previous Logitech one as well. The mic audio quality is good as well.A few things to be aware of, though. First, the cable length is a bit short. 7' seems like plenty, but if you are using this with a PC and route the cable with other wires, you can quickly find it isn't quite long enough. This is probably only a problem for someone using a desktop, though. Otherwise, the shorter length is probably a benefit. Second, the earmuffs don't articulate. They still fit great on my head, but if you've had problems with fitting headsets in the past, it could cause problems for you. Finally, the LED lights. They look cool, but you don't always want extra light in a room (sleeping, movies, etc). You can unplug the USB to turn them off, but that's pretty inconvenient for me. It would be nice if there were a switch to control the lights along with the volume/mute switches on the cord. Instead, I just leave them off permanently. A bit of a waste.
title: Great headset for the cost.

author: B. Bandak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: It didn't take me long to decide on this headset based on its solid reviews and descriptive product page on Amazon. The shipping was fast and arrived in great shape. Installation is simple as it's only a plug and play via USB, although it comes with other plug types that makes this lovely little headset compatible with PC, XBox, PS4 among other platforms - one of my favorite qualities about his product. The sound quality is great, as is it's build quality. It's bassy enough for action/FPS games and listening to music or movies. Customer service appears to be good and detail oriented. I have no hesitation in recommending this product, as it's been a delight to use so far.
title: Great headset and great price

author: Michelle Kubiak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: I only tried them for gaming, but they really nail the surround sound aspect of the games. I have not listened to music, other than game music, so I am not sure about that aspect, but I really got them for gaming. Also, they are very comfortable. I tried a more expensive Logitech set purchased at a local store, but they were uncomfortable. The pressure they put on my head would start to dig into my temple area. These seem to have less pressure and seem lighter. Also, they come with a splitter to attach and use for PC gaming (mic and headphone), but work with the three-ring mic-headphone plug on phones and PS4 controller/etc... Also, they have a USB connection to power the lights. I haven't tried that.
title: Great sounding headphones - very comfortable

author: Jon123456789
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
review_content: I bought these for the express use in PC gaming so my review will reflect that experience and I cannot comment on any limitations they bring to console gaming.I have had the headset for a couple of days now and have streamed with it twice now.  My initial impressions are that they are pretty decent gaming headset for the money.  The red USB powered lighting is nice, but I haven't found a way to turn if off without having to unplug the USB.  The ear cuffs are pretty huge and will definitely cover your ears fully.  I haven't noticed any issues with the wait or feel while using, but the longest I have worn them for is only for 1 hour straight, so can't comment on how they will feel wearing them continuously for several hours.  I can pick up the surround sounds with these and they are much better that the 2 computer speakers I was using before.  I had to turn the gain way up on the mic with the recording software I use, so I am not sure if that is due to the mic or the software.PROs:- Good gaming sound- Braided cord- USB powered LED lighting- Price- Comfort (so far)- easy connect for PCCONs:- no way to turn off LED without unplugging USB cable- terrible for music listening- a bit bulky- ear cushions aren't very softIn conclusion for the money these are what I expected them to be.  They are a good starter gaming set or would be a good set for kids since they are inexpensive and you would worry less about them breaking them.  I would most likely buy these again as my first streaming headset and upgrade down the line.
title: Quality inexpensive beginner PC gaming headset.

author: Karla Clark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_content: Do they cancel noise?  Yes, but not totally.  Perhaps if you are playing a pretty loud game, but if you are playing a game like Hunter, where sound is very subtle and matters... A LOT... you can still hear the kids.  A bit.  Do they sound great.  Yes.  But, I still needed to download the DTS app on my XBOX to get the full sound quality, but sound actually is the reason my review is mid-range.  I think these are great headphones for the money.  They are not outrageous, and they sound great.  BUT.... the cord and the sound box is very heavy, and constantly dangling to your consul remote.  This puts weight on the plug jack.... and even after about 2 weeks of heavy gaming.... I can hear the jack pop every time I don't hole the remote carefully.  Perhaps a modification to keep weight off the jack.3 STAR but 4 STAR for the price.
title: Great for the price

author: R.P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: If you change the headset volume settings on your console, you will notice a major difference in the volume. For Xbox One you connect the headset to the 3.5 jack in the controller, hit the home button and go to settings. On the bottom left corner you will see a volume icon. Click it and that will take you to headset volume settings. You can increase the volume on the console there. I turned mine all the way up and it was too loud so I turned it back down. This should solve everyone's volume issues, and I am sure this will work for other consoles other that Xbox One as well.
title: For those that think the volume is too low.

author: Barbara Erickson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: I waited some time before submitting a review to ensure I got the most out of the headset to provide a proper review. The headset is well worth it, and can compare fairly well with much more expensive headsets. The volume control on headset works very effectively, and it is very useful having a mute switch. The noise cancellation is great to drown out smaller background noises, and the sound quality on the headset itself is great! Both the speakers and microphone work great. I wore the headset for long gaming sessions, and it remained comfortable, even with glasses on underneath the foam ear pieces. Highly recommend this product!
title: Well worth the value

author: Cameron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: I've had these headphones for a week now and I mainly use them to play Apex Legends. They do a great job of picking up the ambient sounds, footsteps and directional gunfire noises in-game. The ear cups are very large and should cover your entire ear and won't add too much strain to your temple and jaw area. The mic seems to be good from the feedback I received from my team/random players in Apex. They always told me that my voice was clear and there wasn't much background noise, so I will have to take their words for it.The cord is very long, I think it's about 6ft which for me is too much because I plug it directly into the controller. So i just keep the excess tied up with the little velcro strap it comes with. These are good headphones for the price if you are looking for a gaming setup for casual use. The more expensive sets will have softer ear cups and a lower profile, but if you need something to keep your gaming experience quite while the kids sleep than you can't beat this deal.
title: Very good for the price

author: Nedayaj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Got this a few months back. They work nice and feel good but the mic is too quiet. Everyone constantly tells me they can barely hear me and I tested the decibels on my pc. Turns out I'm louder and more clear on both my Laptop's built in mic and my wireless airpods. No idea how that's possible since those 2 things are much further from my mouth than this one's mic.The solution is to turn up your mic level on pc but if you use this for phone or anything else, be prepared to not be heard... unless you want to cover the mic around your mouth and look like a beat boxer.
title: Mic is lower than my laptop and wireless airpod mic

author: Brandon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
review_content: Bought these based on the thousands of overwhelming reviews for PC gaming. My Logitech G930's gave out after nearly 8 years of faithful service.Build wise, they aren't horrible, but could be better. Feels sturdy, but also cheap at the same time.Ear cushions do not form a good seal around the bottom of my ears and the mic sits out pretty far from my face.I did a quick recording test with the mic, the sound quality coming form the mic was surprisingly excellent.However, when it came time to put it to the test in gaming, it let me down. Sound quality sounded "distant" and not true compared to my old headset. Maybe I was spoiled all these years, but these headphones just did not do it for me.For an entry level headset, you can find better, well known brands for roughly the same price point. I will be returning these to go into the 100-200 headset range from a bigger brand.If you are just looking for an entry level headset for your child on Xbox or PS4, I suppose it would work, but if you are any level of serious or even dedicated casual, I would look elsewhere.
title: Would look elsewhere for the pricepoint.

author: Matthew J. Conrad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my son for his 13th birthday after a recommendation from a friend - I couldn't be happier!  He loves the headset and uses it for both the PS4 and the computer.  It's incredibly affordable for what your receive.  Maybe they work a little too good - sometimes he doesn't hear us when we call him from the kitchen - he's too engrossed with his game.  I really appreciate the microphone, it allows him to talk with his friends while they game.  They fit well and he games for long periods of time, they are really comfortable.
title: Great, affordable headset!

author: FirstClassClip
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: OMG these headphones absolutely destroy any previous ones I've owned. The sound is so amazing that in comparison to my HyperX Series, with bigger speakers, and until now my current favorite the HyperX sound low and dull. I invited my daughter to a Xbox chat and she said the sound of my voice was realistic as compared to the other sets I've owned.If you are looking at a new headset look no further. You will not be let down by the deepest bass and high clarity and these things can go loud without distortion, I am just blown away at the price for what you get from my Run Mus K2 Pros.
title: OMG these headphones absolutely destroy any previous ones I've owned.

author: Joseph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: I gave this as a gift for fathers day for my husband and I'm happy I purchased this gift. He absolutely loved the headphones and enjoys using it every day for his game set. It goes extremely well and complete with his remote and ps4. He loved the colors it came with, he chosed the red color and he loves the bright red lights on it and the bass of the sound he can hear everything so clearly and perfectly. He feels like hes right in the game with these headphones it makes his games more of a reality with the sound and affects on it. Any one who gets these headphones are extremely lucky because the quality of the product is amazing and theres no issues whatsoever. These are way better then the original old ps4 headphones he had before because they didnt last him at all, so we replaced them with these new headphones and it was the best choice. The shipping was so fast we got it quickly without having to wait. It brought a big smile on our face to see it arrived in such perfect condition. We made a perfect choice, cant go wrong with this product and the pricing is affordable and extraordinary as well. A perfect gift for anyone.
title: Was a perfect fathers day gift for anyone

author: Vernon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: I purchased this headset for my son who uses it to play games on console and PC.  Being the gamer that I am, I tested them out first.  The 7.1 surround is clean and clear enough to tell what direction shots were coming from in first person shooters.  I could tell if another player was behind me, or even above/below me.  The noise canceling works well enough that I can no longer tell if my kids are ignoring me, or just can't hear me.  The microphone works as expected and pics up voice without yelling.  It's also not sensitive enough to pick up all background noise annoying your party members.  I have worn these for 3-4 hours with minimal fatigue.  Very comfortable.  The only thing I would change is being allowed to separate the USB from the headphone jack more than about 10 inches.  When using these headphones with an XBOX wireless controller, I can't use the accent lights due to this.  No problems on PC though.  Lastly, check your Xbox controller for headphone jack, otherwise you will need the adapter for the bottom of the controller.
title: Now I can't tell if my kids are ignoring me!!!

author: W. Sager
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: Just recently bout these headphones for my 14-year-old son to replace the Astro Gaming A10 headphones which broke 2 days after he purchased them.  That was the 3rd set of A10's that broke in less than 6 months.So far, my son likes the headphones. The only negatives being that they feel heavier and less comfortable than the A10's, and he said they feel like cheap plastic.But these headphones are more versatile than his previous headphones, and the sound quality is quite good.  Now just hoping they last more than a few days before losing sound or breaking the connecting pin.
title: Decent headphone for price.

author: Reeve Euwer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
review_content: For the price paid here, this headset is a very good value.  Sound quality is excellent.  Though I haven't noticed the noise cancellation as actively as another headset I have, when playing a game I'm not noticing any external distracting noise, either.  The surround is excellent, and makes a difference when playing immersive games.  Have not used the microphone yet, but seems straightforward and passes mic tests very well.Note that when using only the RCA jack the LEDs won't light up - those are powered via the USB.  It's slightly clunky having both attachments hanging off of the cord, but it's also convenient to have both options and the headset works very well with a PS4 controller.  It's also worth not having to deal with batteries or charging.It's a bit heavy, but not uncomfortably so and given the features not a major drawback.Features and functionality compared to price point, it's a bargain.
title: Very good value

author: Amazon Customer in Louisiana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: I was so excited to see this box come in the mail!! Then when I opened the box, I was delighted with the quality of the product, the way it looks, the way it feels and the way it sounds!! It is fantastic!! It is comfortable and the sound quality is amazing!! It works very nicely with my xbox and the mic picks up just the right amount of noise, without background noise.If I had one issue with the headset, it would be the very short cable to plug the USB end into my XBox so the headset will light up.  Thankfully, I was able to find an adapter, so that solved the problem for me!  And now I am gaming in style!I am very pleased with this product and will definitely be purchasing Run Mus again!!!
title: This product is great!!! Only one minor issue.

author: The Fam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020
review_content: Been using these for a few days and I like them a lot.  My wife and kid however are not as impressed.Since their heads are smaller, the headphones hang off the bottoms of their ears and don’t “seal” in the ear which makes them uncomfortable for them and reduces the audio quality.For my big head they fit rather well, are pretty comfortable for the most part, but do pinch my ears a little over extended usage.Chatting with these can feel a little awkward because you can’t hear yourself when talking. I end up having to take one side slightly off my ear so that I know I’m not either yelling or otherwise talking like a dork.The build quality seems good to me overall but my wife pointed out that the band seems to be only plastic and might break over time.
title: Not suitable for smaller heads..

author: Monica C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
review_content: Pros:- Noise cancellation works very well. If you are not used to noise-cancelling headphones, taking off this headset after a gaming session can be jarring.- Microphone quality is crisp, other players will hear you well with very little environmental pollution.  That said, they will also be able to hear every sip of Mountain Dew and subsequent burp.Cons:- My headset's physical mute button functions are flipped, so moving the switch towards the red "mute" symbol opens your mic.  Minor annoyance during initial troubleshooting, but not enough to drop the overall rating.- Can be a bit large for small heads.
title: Fantastic Headset

author: SpyderGST619
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: This is now the second time that I've purchased a Runmus headset for my boys, not because of any flaw, but because they happened to work so well.  The set I actually bought last year is still functional where I was having to replace the sets from big box stores within a few months of their use.  No matter the brand I'd hear that something broke that would render them useless, and in most cases it was the cord.  On these the braided long length cord keeps the set well protected.  I now have the pleasure of using their old set for casual gaming on Stadia as well as for using it to watch videos on PC.
title: Another Great Set

author: Glenna E
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: At first glance the headset looks a bit bulky in its construction yet is solid in its construct. When in use they fit rather well and don’t feel as if they will fall off when in a ‘jam session’. Ear foam is thick enough to encompass the entire ear without discomfort. When wearing the headset there’s a small pinky gap around neck line that tends to let in outside ambient noise. Enough that I can hear outside conversations if my volume is turned down low enough. However the compression doesn’t give me a headache as others with better formfitting headphones give. After a few hours of wear, they breathe well that I don’t feel myself sweating underneath them. Adjusting the sides seem on the stiff side yet stay when final height is reached. Rotating the mic up and down also feels a bit tough to adjust as if I might break it during adjustments. Found that I could lightly arrange/twist the rubber mic arm farther down as needed. The wire outer jacket is ok and volume adjuster/mute mic is on the larger side of the spectrum. The lights look interesting, a point more for the younger crowd. Overall composition is they feel comfortable and I still hear when being yelled at for supper.
title: Comfortable sound

author: EzyEric
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: I was looking for a pair of gaming headphones that I could use on Stadia. I did a search online and there just is not a lot of data about Stadia and what works with it yet. These headphones were not expensive so I figured I would just give them a try as they say they work with almost all other systems. Well I got these and plugged them into my Stadia controller and was amazed at how well they work. The sound quality is amazing. I haven't had them for very long yet so I can not say anything about durability but these feel like they will last.AGAIN THESE DO WORK GREAT WITH STADIA.
title: Great Headphones for Gaming on Stadia and most other platforms

author: Destiny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: I bought this RUNMUS headset for my brother, and he absolutely loves it. It had a high quality sound, with noise blocking resistance, and an overall amazing look. The protection for the wiring is very strong and has a long cord that connects the headset and remote. Since I was curious, I decided to try them myself and man! It is an amazing headset. I recently had issues with my microphone, and told the representatives-- since I purchased insurance for my headset. They responded quickly and assured me they would send a replacement.Customer service and product is amazing. For the quality and price of the headset, it is an amazing deal. I would say give this product a try if you're looking fo a good quality headset for the price..
title: High Quality Gaming Headset

author: Scott Skurdalsvold
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
review_content: Found this item looking for a less expensive option to some of the more well known brand names.  Considering how many of those units my boys have destroyed, I was willing to take the chance.  My son came down and had to show me all the features, so I asked him how he liked it.  These are his words:It's very strong and well built.  It has great sounds for games.  The lights are awesome, and I can use it for listening to music on my iPhone.My words:  it is very well constructed.  So far they have not been able to cause any damage, and believe me, they are hard on equipment.  It does require an adapter for most xBox controllers, which is a down side due to the cost.  But we did have one controller with a standard headphone/mic jack.
title: Great product for the price!

author: rhymenoceros
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my son, but ultimately returned them because they do not fit tight on your head.  We had the same problem when being worn by an adult or a child.Pros:They actually sound pretty goodThe microphone appeared to work pretty wellI like the flexible fabric feel of the wireInexpensiveCons:They are HUGE.  There's nothing subtle about these when you wear them.Poor fit.  They are tight on the top of the ear, but at the bottom, they stick out about an inch from your head!  Nowhere near snug.I didn't like how there are multiple ends sticking off of the end of the wire.  There's always an unused connection dangling.When moving around, picked up some static on the headphones, as if the cord might be shorting out.
title: Biggest Problem: They don't fit tight on your head.

author: Dan S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: The last time I bought a serious gaming headset was around 2011-2012 and that was the era where gaming headsets were really console oriented. I ended up buying a Razer back then and spent something like $150. This has 99% of the same features and quality as that one at only a fraction of the price.One thing that was not obvious to me was that the headset does NOT work over USB only, that is solely for the LEDs. I was hoping I could do the 3.5mm cables OR the USB, but that was not the case.As a weird aside I have gotten more compliments on the light up LEDs than anything else, although i'm not sure that counts for anything :)
title: Headsets are no longer an Arm and a Leg

author: Gerard A Bouchard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: For the price it is very surprising the QUALITY of this gaming headset and especially the attached "BRAIDED" Cable for Longevity so that it last a lot longer in the life of the headset. The Manual is Excellent with actual photo/pictures of how exactly the different cables and combination of cables connects to each and every gaming system INCLUDING THE NINTENDO SWITCH. We are using it on the Switch, PC Gaming Laptop, both Apple and Samsung Tab 8 Tablets and even works on my Samsung Galaxy S10e phone and my Raspberry Pie 3 and 4. I'm testing it on everything.
title: Excellent Quality and Compatable with Everything

author: Number1SushiBoy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
review_content: In this world of working from home, I wanted a new headset that was a little more comfortable, with noise cancelling, that I could also use for gaming on my personal laptop. The good: very comfortable to wear, at least for short periods (I've not worn it for extended periods yet), good sound quality and volume. I found the set-up simple and fairly intuitive. The bad: the mic only rotates one direction, which means I have to put the side with the cord on my left ear; this is opposite where my computer is on my desk, so the cord crosses my body, which I generally dislike. The ugly: there's no option to switch the lights off, if the headphones are plugged in and have power, the lights are on.
title: Does the job

author: John from Indiana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: Purchased this item (Runmus K2 Pro) for myself and a Runmus K11 headset as a gift for another. We already own an older pair of Turtle Beach PX22's that have been reliable, are still working,  and have had no issues. Headset first appears bulky when unboxing, however they do fit nicely on my head and are comfortable. After plugging in and listening to Music on computer, I was pleasantly surprised. The bass appeared rich and audio experience was much better than my old Turtle Beach headset. So I do feel the audio is high quality. Fit and finish is above average. Materials and overall quality of workmanship appear better on my old Turtle beach headset, howeverthat headset cost more a few years ago than price paid for this item. I prefer the sleeker appearance of the Runmus K11 headset and the aesthetics, but the earcups felt smaller and didn't seem to seal/cover my ears as well as this K2 headset. So keeping this in mind, if the K11's are to small for your head/ears, consider this K2 headset. Initial impressions are it is good at the current pricing range of $20-$27.
title: Appears to be good headset for the price.

author: Brian Duffey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: This headset seems of good quality and the sound is not bad by any means.  I don't know that it really is 7.1 as using test audio clips don't quite surround you as other 7.1 sources do, but the headset is very comfortable and easy to hear.  One negative I found that I wish was a little clearer in the description is that this headset does not work with MacBooks by default.  You have to buy an external audio card to use the microphone at all.  Since I originally got this to better hear/make myself heard on virtual meetings, this was a negative to me.  However, with an external audio card, it seems to work very well, so positive overall.
title: Good quality, but does not work for macs

author: ricanpone529
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: Purchased these for my Teen for his birthday, upon opening then visually they seemed promising, my son plugged the stereo 3.5mm jack into his remote and right away told me their was bad static in the headset.I put the headset on to hear what he was hearing sure enough bad static and crackle.The cable end that plugs into the remote was bad. Since this was a birthday present we are returning them. He doesn’t even want a replacement.Build quality of the headset is cheap feeling with the plastics all around.The cable seemed promising since it is braided but it failed on quality control.The lights looked cool upon plugging in USB cable. Unfortunately these I do not recommend.items are hit and miss on Amazon so choose wisely-Rating are great but actual experience is not.Thanks
title: Good but ended with bad 3.5mm cable

author: T. Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: (PC) These headphones are NOT 7.1. I was Leary when I noticed it didn't say anywhere on the box that they were. Sure enough, they aren't. The USB plug does nothing. Watch out for fake reviews!
title: NOT 7.1 !!

author: Jason Dietrich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
review_content: This is a solid headset. Still breaking it in, so its a bit snug on my head but otherwise it's comfortable. The sound and mic both seem clear and crisp. My preference would be for the mic to sit a bit lower on the earphone, rather than right in the middle. The cord is a practical length, but could be longer. USB cord is just too light up the headset, which was unexpected. I've had no reason to contact customer support, so i can't speak to that in regards to my purchase. Currently my review is 4 stars instead of 5 due to the preferences, not because of an issue with quality. I'm pleased with what i got for what i paid.
title: Good quality headset, would recommend

author: River Moonchild
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: This is a great quality product and the sound is great!  This is my first gaming headset I've owned and I'm happy overall with my purchase because of the quality of sound.  It's a strong product, built for toughness and the wire is very strong and durable.  The only thing I can say as a con is that it's pretty bulky and hard for me to fit my smaller hands around the ear parts to take it on and off.  Also, the short USB cord for the LED lights make it almost impossible to plug it in while playing to turn the LED lights on which was disappointing.  If you're looking for a great, affordable gaming headset and don't care about the lights, this product is for you.
title: Great sound, but disappointed with the LED lights..

author: Philip
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
review_content: The sound and the microphone work pretty well. The only problem I have with them is how it sits on your head. **Maybe this will change as I break them in.** As it currently sits, new from the box, the very bottom of the earpieces are raised away from my head. I would venture to guess that as the foam earpieces start to conform, the headset will close this gap, but currently I find myself trying to press the bottom of the headphones closer to get better sound. This might not be the case for you as everyone's head is a different shape from everyone elses'... to a point.Apart from that, the sound is great, the lights look really cool, and overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
title: Great sound for not a lot of money, but the fit...

author: R King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
review_content: This is a good sounding headset and the mic is clear and crisp.We have owned more then a few really cheap and expensive wired and wireless headsets the last several years.In this case this K2 pro is replacing one of our wired headsets that died to act as a backup to the wireless.  The K2 is much heavier overall from the plastic but it is more comfortable overall, mic is very clear and  the K2 sound  is every bit as good as the much more expensive wireless headsets we have for each PS4.  We could not be happier with this purchase.
title: This is a good sounding headset and the mic is clear and crisp.

author: JSloss
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: I am very disappointed. The 2 major problems with this headset that is making me return the headset is the sound is very low for gaming on ps4 playing loud games like black ops 4 & for music. The sound is so low that cheap bluetooth earphones for $10-15 are a lot louder than these. Another major problem is you can't use the LED lights at all because the LED plug & the plug that goes in to the ps4 controller are connected to each other & the cord length is shorter than my hand so once you plug in the LED light in to the ps4 you won't be able to plug it in to the controller unless your gonna play with your controller right on the ps4. To improve this headset the seller needs to remove the LED lights & put that cost in to improving the sound or make the LED cord a lot longer & out more resources in to improving the sound. Hours later & now my headset sound keeps going in & out back to back while playing black ops 4 so I'm really returning these asap!
title: Sound is low & can't use LED lights & sound goes in & out

author: Jon T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019
review_content: Bought this for my son per his request for a Xmas present.  Says his best friend bought the same one and he had tried it and really liked it.  And since his old headset finally broke he needed a new one.  He loved the feel of the headset, clarity of the audio (I guess the mayhem of sound effects of his online games were "awesome" in his ears), and the stylish looks were what sold him on the headphones.  He gives it 5 stars.  I added a right angle adapter to his gift because the audio cable connects at the base of his controller so it would help prevent wear and tear on the headset cable.  I have to admit the LEDs on the headset look rather cool.  If your kid is into the cool factor these are the ones for you.  For functional gaming needs it meets all my son's criteria.
title: Cool and functional

author: Darrell Gassert II
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: This will work on Xbox but the lights will not. You most plug in a six port and it’s USB port for the lights and head set to work. The cord splits at the end with AUX and USB cord and they are extremely short. If your going to us them for Xbox I do not recommend.
title: Not so great.

author: Shawn T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: Phenomenal headset. I used a HyperX for about two years until my cat chewed through my cord so I had to buy a new one. Boy, am I glad I chose this one. The audio from chat and in game is phenomenal. Good noise canceling, and no echo. I especially love the semi-braided cord (because cats. Also has a plug in to use for a PC, and a USB plug for newer laptops that don't include a microphone jack.My only complaint is that the mute/unmute button is hard to tell whether you're muted or not when you first plug in for a session. I preferred the HyperX's "lift microphone to mute" feature more than the Runmus's switch because I frequently have people coming in and out of my game room and that's much easier to mute with the lifting quickly so whomever I'm playing with doesn't have to hear the conversation. Otherwise, phenomenal. I highly recommend it.
title: Runmus is awesome!

author: DBD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
review_content: I guess I missed the part about the USB being only for lights. I typically like a headset that is plug and play for desktops via USB. That being it said they appear to work just fine for video conferencing. They also are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. Others may disagree but they worked for me. I like the adapters of plugging into the computer. I feel that is a nice touch for a company to actually include everything you need in the box.My main con is the controls. They are kind of counter intuitive as i feel like the wheel (for turning UP volume) should be in the opposite direction. Additionally, I would like to have some kind of indicator on the microphone slider that you can easily glance at and see that your mic is on or off. I would prefer buttons to sliders/wheels to mute/change volume.
title: It works

author: Diana Sanders
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: I bought this product in June. It is now almost October and the headphones are holding up well. My son saved up his allowance and I purchased these for my son so that he could play on his PS4. We had gone through several inexpensive headsets from a variety of stores and they never seemed to last more than a week or so. (I just can't bring myself to buy a $70 headset for an 11 year old boy.) This is why I had waited to write this review: to see if they would indeed hold up. We are very satisfied with our purchase. He takes them everywhere and he uses them with all his devices. Thank you for quality item at a reasonable price. Will recommend purchasing this item to others.P.S. One downside is that the USB wire is not long enough to use with our PS4 in order for the lights to come on while playing. This, however, does not affect game play or listening ability.
title: Surprisingly Satisfied

author: BearEagle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: I was amazed at the sounds this headphone's 50 mm drivers created. The headphone are bigger than other headphones that I am used to, however my ears can easily fit within the cushioned ear cups. I've connected them to both my pc as well as my xbox one without any difficulties. The sound has a true base tone that definitely stands out during explosions. The microphone is clear and audible while I was chatting during game play.  The main purpose of purchasing these headphones were for game console use. I could hear some background noise while wearing them, but I did not purchase them for that feature. The LED features are also nice if you have them hooked up to an USB port. I don't regret this purchase after considering several other competitive brands.
title: Comfortable, lightweight and affordable headphones

author: Juwang Wang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2019
review_content: I got them today and the sound quality was poor. At least on the game DayZ. I dont know of any players heard me cause they always shot me on sight when I said Hello. But they had to have known I was there.  But these headphones are extremely comfortable to wear, the material is durable and the product is great for the price tag. Based on reviews I'd say the problem with my sound was Dayz issue as it's in beta. Great pair to have I even got my brother one.
title: Great for the price

author: Megan S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: Really liked this headset! For the price, you can’t beat it as far as quality. I would’ve given this 5 stars however there was a couple different things I wasn’t too happy with.For one, I bought this specifically to use on an Xbox one. If I had not already of had a Microsoft adapter on hand I would’ve had to buy one which is annoying. If I would’ve gotten these in and then realized after the fact that I needed to order an adapter as well I would’ve been upset but luckily, like I said, I already had one on hand.Secondly, since I ordered these specifically to use on an Xbox controller I don’t plug the actual USB in because there’s no where to plug it in on an Xbox controller. You only use the skinnier little port to plug it in to the controller, not the USB so unfortunately the LED lights on these will never be used because I don’t have a place for  a USB to be plugged in at.So those 2 things were annoying, I was more upset that you can’t actually use the LED lighting on it though.As far as sound quality, noise cancellation and comfort, they get 5 stars.
title: Make sure you have a Microsoft adapter!

author: Allen Knack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: I did not test the mike nor gaming ability. I just received it, plugged it in and fired up a video.The good: LEDs looks good. Came with the converter cable to plug it into separate headphone/microphone jacks on the PC. Good quality cordThe bad: Volume control only worked for 50% volume. More than that the sound went dead. The fit and feel were like the low budget headphones I have. Large enough to fit over my ears but didn't seal enough to reduce outside noise.Bottom line. I returned them and canceled a second pair on order.
title: Cheap and didn't work correctly

author: Josh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: I was looking for a new headset for my son.After checking out the reviews for the K2 Pro, I decided to give this headset a chance.The price had me skeptical on whether or not it would be worth the purchase, but I was surprised with the results.Have been playing Call of Duty games all day to test these out.The sound quality is really good.The microphone quality is really good.And the headset is still comfortable wearing after a long period of time.I love the fact that this headset is also compatible with my PC, and also other consoles.This all makes these a really nice headset for a very nice price.I'm very satisfied with this purchase, and look forward to checking out other products from Run Mus.
title: Great headset for the price

author: Bill R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: UPDATE: headset causes fully charged controllers to disconnect from Xbox. Can play for hours without headset on, plug the headset in and every few minutes the sound gets crackly and I’m told to reconnect my controller. No clue why, don’t care at this point, will be picking up a new one from a different brand. I purchased a new controller thinking it was an issue with my old one, still happens, only constant is this headset.So far so good! I’m completely new to gaming and gaming with headsets, so I went with a moderately priced model with good reviews. Was not disappointed!
title: Causes controller to disconnect.

author: Joz88
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: I bought these to replace my other pair. The sheath around the core on those were breaking at all of the joints and wires were very exposed. The wires on these are covered by a really nice nylon type cord maybe? Either way I can’t picture these cracking like my other ones.They fit really nice around my ears, and I mean COMPLETLY around. A lot of headphones smash my ears so bad that they start to hurt. These are crazy comfortable. The sound is great, they get pretty loud so watch out. The only complaint I would say that I have is that they are huge. I feel like I could fly a plane with these lol they’re pretty bulky around my head. My girlfriend had a good laugh but honestly that’s not enough to keep me from getting another pair if I ever need to.
title: Pleasantly surprised

author: Daniela
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: I purchased these headphones for my son who uses Xbox One for gaming. They were a Christmas present. I made sure that he could use these with his Xbox and we didn't need any additional adapters. He used them on Christmas day and was very impressed with the surround sound.  These headphones are comfortable on his head and ears. His friends have said that they can hear him much better now with these new headphones. He is able to mute the microphone easily using the volume control. The noise cancellation is very effective. LED light is very vibrant, and an amazing feature.
title: Amazing sound

author: Jordan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: I have been using a headset I bought from Walmart (island turtle) for some time and I just didn’t like the volume limit it had. So, I bought this headset on cyber Monday and I was a little skeptical about it to begin with until I opened it up. Firstly, this headset looks like a toy. It looks cheap and I wasn’t even sure the thing was going to work. Secondly, the cord that connects to the controller is, and I’m not joking, the length of my queen size bed. The noise cancellation aspect of it is nonexistent. When I played all I could hear were my thumbsticks moving around. The volume and mic controls are on a big bulky thing that weighs 5 pounds and makes your head tilt to one side. Finally, if you’re not using a computer it has a usb cord that is just there. You can’t do anything about it except let it get in your way. I’ve never been so disappointed in a product from Amazon.
title: Do not buy this thing!!

author: 420 TIM time
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: I really like the colored lights that are built in . the quality is much better than the gaming  brand that starts with R and would recommend to all my gamer friends because the price is right for the quality.  I have gone through 3 pairs of the gaming head phones that start with that r letter. My mom told me that this is the last pair she would buy me because i broke three of the brand headphones that start with the R and have a z in the name. the comfort is much better and the wire in much better and this is what broke on my others in less than a year.
title: great sound good quality for the price

author: bluebear
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: I had actually bought 3 of these.  One of them for some reason just doesn't fit.  It's too big and loose, even though it's at the smallest setting.  The ear portion goes too low past the ear, so it doesn't cover the whole ear.  There is too much space between the head and headband.  I am not sure why this 3rd one has issues.  I noticed that the mic button also didn't work.  There is a button that you can turn our mic on and off, but it seemed to be always on even when I switch it off.  Another one seems to have the mic cut in and out so that you don't really hear what the person is saying.  The 3rd one is mostly ok.  I find they are all kind of heavy and they have a tendency to loosen the headband a bit as you wear it, maybe from its own weight.  The sound is good and you can hear more different sound with it than from just the laptop.  The mic picks up the tiniest sound, so you can hear people clicking their keyboards or whispering in the background.  You need to plug in two different ports on your computer if you want to have it glow.  I wish it used just 1 port because depending on where the ports are on your laptop, it may not reach both ports, or it could end up making you have to plug something in on the right side of your laptop, which may get in the way of your mouse when you're gaming.
title: Good

author: Dylan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019
review_content: I purchased this product on sale for about 15 dollars and if the price is higher at the moment, I would not buy them.I will list below both the positives and negatives of these headphones. Note that some of these will be a little in between.Positives:These headphones are decently functional. The sound quality isn't exactly the best, but it's not the worst.The microphone works well enough, no complaints from the other side but when asked it sounded "a little metallic" though that could have been the platform I was using (discord on a windows 10 computer, probably not the mic's fault but I can't be sure).If you buy these on sale, they are of good price. However, 42 dollars is way too much for these given the quality they are.They are sturdy, big, and admittedly comfortable if worn for a short time.Negatives:They are heavy. You will not want to be wearing these for more than an hour at a time. Your neck will be sore if you go longer than that.They are bulky. You will look a little silly wearing these if your head is on the smaller side.The sound quality isn't the best. It's good enough for what it is, but there are better options.If your ears stick out a little or a lot, they will rub against the inside of the earphone. It's not comfortable, and can leave the ear red and sore if worn long enough.The mic sticks out when not in use (even when placed in the upward position), it cannot be detached but it can be bent to how you prefer.They are not good for public use unless you have a large head. The ears will not be properly covered and noise will be heard by those around you, even at a reduced volume.In short: If you plan on wearing them for a short time (less than an hour at a time, your times may vary) they are a good buy on sale. If you are looking for headphones to jam out to music with, look elsewhere as the sound quality isn't high enough for that. It is decent enough to hear what you need to hear in a video game, but there'd still be better headphones for that as well.EDIT: Mentioned the platform I was experiencing mic issues with to give a more fair review on the product.To follow up on some previous things:The company followed up on the review making sure to touch up on the issues I mentioned here, seeing if they could fix anything. The review will stand at 3 stars as it's a review of the product itself, however I would highly recommend the company themselves after the feedback I got.The product I purchased is now collecting dust and will probably only be used as a backup, but I am still happy with my purchase due to the follow up from the company themselves.
title: Okay if you're on a budget.

author: Neverawin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
review_content: I had been looking for a headset to play with for a long time and decided to take a risk on the RUMNUS gaming headset. The sound is clear and the headset itself is comfortable to wear for long periods at a time. I wore it for 6 hours straight and I never once felt uncomfortable with it on. The only complaints I have are that the lights do not activate unless the USB is plugged in (I play on xbox), and that when at full volume that is a static sound (easily fixed it brought below full volume). Overall I enjoy the headphones and am glad of my purchase.
title: Comfortable and amazing sound quality.

author: H. Lam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
review_content: Stumbled upon this headset with 7.1 and noise cancelling for $30.  I figured "why not?" and ordered them.  Took them out of the box, felt the build quality and instantly said my first "nope".  The plastic was flimsy and looked unfinished in certain spots with bits of untrimmed flash here and there.  I plugged them in to hear the sound quality and my second "nope" was uttered.  Tinny, distant sound with no bass.  I knew it was going to be a longshot, I guess I was hoping to be pleasantly surprised.  Return requested within 15 minutes of opening the box.
title: Price is cheap, just like the build quality and sound

author: Mumsiest
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: This headset is great. As others have said, the only real problem is the cord length—please shorten the cord by AT LEAST a foot or two. It’s just too long.Be prepared for a chunky headset. It’s nice, but it is big and the mic sticks out and is less mobile than I’d like; but it IS unidirectional which is a personal preference. I think it’s a marvelous deal for $40 including insurance. I would recommend it to anyone.Don’t miss the add-ons that come with it! It has a headphone jack, with an attachment that separates into TWO headphone jacks, and it also has a USB connector. The cord is like a nylon rope, which feels sturdy, and it has volume control and mute capability.
title: Chunky, cord is too long, but otherwise fantastic.

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
review_content: These are perfect gaming headphones for the price. My husband said the sound quality is phenomenal “you can hear the footsteps of others and multidimensional sounds in the game”. They are well padded for comfort. The last thing I laughed at was when I was trying to ask my husband about the noise canceling quality and he promptly yelled back at me (since he can’t tell how loud he’s talking back at me while playing) “I can’t hear a word you are trying to say to me right now!”  The only negative is no pretty Red lights due to needing to plug those into a USB port to power them & my husband is gaming on his i-pad. So all in all this is the best $24 pair of headphones for my husband’s gaming.
title: Great buy

author: Kelli J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019
review_content: We had to return these.  Never could get the mic to work with brand new xbox one despite multiple calls for help with xbox and Microsoft.  It was finally suggested that we purchase an adapter that cost more than the headphones.  We did that, and we still could not get the mic to work.  Not sure if I got a defective one or what happened there.  (And yes, mic works using other headsets so the problem was not a setting on Xbox).  Finally gave up and returned this headset, returned adapter and purchased an xbox brand headset for less money.
title: Did not work for us

author: Jamilah Hassan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
review_content: I was looking for a good gaming headset for my PS4. I tested it out as soon as I got it and it works great. Sound is very clear. I also tested to make sure that the sound coming from the headphones cannot be heard outside of the headphones (so you can wear them and not bother others around you with the sound). I recently also bought a keyboard that connects to the ps4 controller. This headset connects well through the keyboard. Overall I like this gaming headset so far and have not experienced any issues as of yet (although I just recently got them).
title: Great gaming headset for PS4

author: Amanda Carriere
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: Bought this headset as a backup to my sons wireless Xbox one that was substantially more money and this one quickly became the go to. He loves the quality of the sound and of course that he can’t hear mom in the background when it’s his game time.Would definitely purchase again. He’s been using them for just over two months now consistently and no issues whatsoever.UPDATE: After using about 2x a week for a few hours each of those times, the wire has shorted (that connects to the headphones) and he can't hear with them anymore.
title: Better than competitors!!

author: H. Sullivan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019
review_content: I have never used a gaming headset. I bought this because my wife hates me playing games, this gives me the option to play when she goes to bed.First impression. Why have I never owned a gaming headset....Second impression.  Why have I never owned a gaming headset... Love this thing. I can hear all the intricacies of the game's. For your money you can not beat this headset. The noise cancelling mic works perfectly, had a conversation for over an hour with someone while music was playing and they heard nothing!!!
title: Great headset!!!!

author: Jessica F Guaman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: I bought this headset some days ago and this is what I think:Pros:- PriceIn case you haven’t seen, the price for this headphones are great! And as you will see later, for this price of this headphones you will be left satisfied.- Soft Padding on the ear and head side.While there are many other headphones with great padding than this one I can confidently I can say that this padding will be good for your ears. Your ears won’t be crying in pain! And as for a bonus it makes the headphones feel much more lighter than they appear to be.-Noise cancellingGoing along with the price the noise canceling of this headphones is great, too great in reality. For the price of the headphones you can’t ask for more. I chose this brand mostly for the mic quality (it has a great one) and bonus the sound quality while gaming.Cons:- PaddingThe padding does carry its benefits but it does carry its disadvantages too. One that I noticed is that with prolonged used and competitive gaming the heat side will be left with seat.
