If you are a competitive gamer or do things that make you sweat while using them I would recommend just for that. However if all you do is be in zoom meetings or online conferences then you have nothing to worry about.First Look:Out of the box it’s simple you have your headphones with the adapter included and a manual. The adapter came in handy when I needed to use it with my gaming laptop. One thing that you might notice is that there is static noise whenever you are not using the mic, noticing this is not hard but when you talk it goes away. This is one of the big cons of this headset but other than that, for the price, I would recommend it for anyone.
title: Huge ROI

author: J. Salgado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
review_content: Wow. Where do I start? Honestly, for the price, I was not expecting much. I lost my $120 headset during a recent move, and wanted something to get me by for call of duty...I was blown away at what I experienced the first time.The simple fact that this headset doesn’t need anything external to work is amazing. Plugs into my Xbox controller and boom. The only down side is that you need to plug in the USB for the lights to come on..:but I don’t really care about that.I highly recommended this headse!!
title: Unexpected!!

author: Kimberly Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
review_content: The sound in the headphones is really nice, probably my favorite part of it. The mic doesn't seem too good at noise cancellation, it seems to be very sensitive. Like I can hear myself breath super quietly, but maybe I just don't know how noise cancellation is supposed to work. However, I used it in a stream with some friends the other night and they said I sounded much clearer than I did when I was using something else before so it's definitely an upgrade! I'd say it's worth the amount I paid for, also the red glow looks pretty cool, not gonna lie.
title: A nice headset!

author: Dawn Rosenlund
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
review_content: Sound quality is pretty good. I've obviously heard better sound, but out of much more expensive headphones, ballpark of $200ish. So for $25 it performs pretty well.Clamping pressure is awkward, tighter up top and loose on the bottom. Fitment is also a tad uncomfortable if you wear glasses like me, but I think that's due to not being broken in yet. The more I wear them the more comfortable it becomes.Volume is only controlled overall, no voice and game volume controls separate. You turn the volume up, game and party gets louder.All in all, pretty good choice for $25. Good budget set of headphones that should hold you over until you get a more expensive set.
title: Great quality for the money

author: Brent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
review_content: Ok, so this is a fantastic headset, and I actually wish i could make it a 4 1/2 stars.Pros:Great clarity of talking, and a surprisingly good base when listening to music. I love the fact that I can easily turn the volume up or down right on the cord when it is plugged into the controller. Also has a switch to put yourself on mute. The cord splits in two at the bottom to make it being able to plug in ps4 or controller without needing an adapter.Cons: that the mic can not do a 360 degree turn, so the mic has to be on your left side.
title: Great headset

author: S.A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020
review_content: So, i have had this headset about 11 months and it has gone through some heavy gaming and music use. Overall, the sound quality is superb compared to others like MPOW and Sennheiser. There is little to no sound dampening, but because it is over the ear, it does muffle some outside sound, if you have the volume up. PC Games like Assassin's Creed, Motogp, Tera Online, Destiny1/2, Battlefield, and COD sound great. Listening to spotify or just general music on the PC is great as well.The biggest gripe i have is the overall quality of its structure and wires. The wires have never really straightened out after all this time, to a point where it auto tangles due to its own tension. This is a problem because it causes internal wear and tear on the wire and where it connects to at the base of the headset and its volume control. So much so, that after a year, it is having issues with sending and receiving sound. I have to jiggle the wires for both headphone to work. Lighting has never faded, so that is a positive. However, the internal headband is now coming loose and is rickety, but also draws out too easily causing readjustment here and there.Overall, for the $40 price tag, this is a great intro set to gaming headsets if you are strapped for cash, or getting for your kids, and will last for about a year before you have any real issues.  Also, be mindful, this is a generic headset that has many clones that look just like it. I am assuming it is an industry base model that is shared to many companies, so there are others out there that look exactly like this, but a different brand, and cost a butt load more. So, for price, this is the best base/standard headset you can find.
title: Good sounding headset, Other things are a slight quality issue.

author: Michael Reeves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_content: After gaming and Twitch streaming with this headset, I can confidently say that these are great! Crisp sound - I could hear the game AND party chat clearly. Previous gaming headsets made it hard to hear the party/game chat over the game sound. These clearly differentiate the two audio sources.As for noise cancellation, again great. Couldn't even hear myself talking while playing, but everyone could clearly hear me. I also checked the volume on my Twitch stream and that was crystal clear as well.And that's a great segway to reviewing the microphone which is advertised as noise cancelling. It delivers crisp, clear audio to other players and your stream. I even had my TV sound on, but you couldn't hear an echo or distortion in the mic audio.As for the LED lights, I imagine these are best for PC players. This requires a USB port to plug into near the audio port to power, so if you're plugging the headset into a controller (XB1X here), you can't plug in the USB without some kind of extension. Either way, this doesn't bother me much as the lights aren't really there for the player's enjoyment - more of an aesthetics piece.This headset is comfortable and an all-around great value. I highly recommend these to any gamer.
title: Great Gaming Headset

author: dmac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
review_content: The sound quality is good, its very comfortable (although a bit large), and so far it appears to be quite flexible and durable. The headphone jack(s) also seems more durable than most. It is especially convenient that the product comes with the two options for jack (it is a single jack by default but comes with a converter to separate mic and aux for PC). The only problem I could find was that the microphone requires more force than usual to pull down (it feels a bit stuck wherever you put it, but I'm okay with this because it ensures it will stay in place at least). It works great for both PC and Xbox (you will want an adapter to use the lights but it is not necessary) and I would definitely recommend it.
title: Impressive Headset, Especially for the Price.

author: LLKS Inc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
review_content: Absolutely amazing product!  We have purchased several headsets and this by far is the best at noise cancellation and the quality of the sound is that of surround sound!  I absolutely love the adjustable headset so it can be out of the way when not using.  The different ports are an added bonus!!  The cords length is more than long enough, much longer than previous headsets I’ve owned.  I am more than happy with this purchase and will be purchasing an additional headset soon.  Might even purchase as Christmas gifts.  The price is amazing and well worth every penny.  You won’t be disappointed in the least with this gaming headset!!
title: Amazing quality for the price!

author: A cool guy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_content: Note: when I first plugged it in, the sound quality was trash, but I assume this is because I plugged it into my speakers. I then plugged it into my pc directly and the sound quality was fixed. (this is the reason I rated 3 stars sound quality instead of 4)Things I like about this headset:the adjustable volume: it has a volume slider (not sure if that is the right word)the mic: most other headsets I see have mics with bendy wires, and I think this design looks much better.the lights: they look really neat, but don't expect to be using them on a mobile device, as you need to use the USB cable to power the LEDs.the flexibility: the headset is bendable, I don't see any reason for this but I also don't see any reason to not have it, so why not?the noise reduction: noise-canceling works fairly well, but don't expect it to be the absolute best.Things I Don't like (could be improved):The mic: when moving the mic up and down, quite a bit of force is required. it would be better if it moved a little easier.the comfort: I've been wearing them for a few hours, and it's getting a bit uncomfortable, but not unbearably so.all in all, I'd say if you don't have the money to buy an expensive headset like me, this would be a great headset for you. at under 30$ (on the current sale), it's a steal.
title: Really good for the price, but don't expect it to compare to a 200$ headset.

author: And_Marq
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: The sound was ok (you get what you pay for). I got this for my kids Switch. While playing fortnite you couldn’t tell where the enemy was. You knew someone was close by but it’s not like the other headsets that truly have surround sound. Within the description ig wasn’t completely clear that the mic does not work for the switch. Next to Nintendo switch it just says (audio). I didn’t realize that it meant audio only (might want to change your wording to say that to avoid confusion). The build quality seemed to be good though. Headband was comfortable as were the ear cushions. If you’re getting it for another system I’d recommend it but not for the switch.
title: Mic does not work on Nintendo Switch

author: Daaku026
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
review_content: So far I've only tried this on my Nintendo Switch and PS4. The sound quality is fantastic. It starts to get that fuzzy/buzz noise on the PS4 when I max out the volume, but it's too loud at that point anyways. It must be a PS4 thing because the Switch does not do that.The mic works surprisingly well for the price, as it's super hot this summer and I have a lot of fans running. The background noise is essentially non-existent for people who are listening to me on the other end and that's with the fan blowing directly on me and the mic.
title: Works great for PS4/Switch

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: Shiiping was fast, received in 2 days! This headphones will be mainly used for school and possibly light gaming. They cost about $38. They do feel cheap out of the box; plasticy. I put them on and they comfy. They do not crush my head. They fit very well. They are also light. The esr pieces are pretty big however, they are light. Time will tell if they hold up. I plugged them into my new gaming laptop; ine into the USB and one into the audio. The red light came on and looks pretty cool. Like I said, time will tell if money well spent.
title: Very comfy and light weight

author: Mr. Sir
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: I don’t understand how these have so many stars. These are the cheapest, crappiest, pieces of garbage I’ve ever used. There’s no noise cancellation. People on the other end of party chat say it sounds like I’m underwater with a turbo fan blowing directly into the mic. And they’re just a crappy product. Definitely not a 7.1 surround sound. Halfway through ANY game, the sound gets louder and then stops. The mic plugs directly into the Xbox controller.... And then it’s nothing but static and echo.Jesus this headset is pure trash.
title: Don’t Buy These... They Suck.

author: steph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
review_content: My 11-year old had some headphones for playing on the xbox one with his friend that moved and they needed these to hear/talk to each other. The first ones we got were some other brand from walmart, and the mic stopped working after a couple months. He saved his money to buy this to replace it, and it has worked great since. He says they are way better than the other ones. Mic works well, sound is good and clear, and he never hears me when he has them on, even when I'm right next to him. So far, they seem like a great product.
title: great quality and value

author: SM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: I was looking for something that didn't break the bank but was decent, and these were exceptional for the price point. I'd certainly pick these over just a basic single-ear headset with microphone, and I'd be inclined to purchase a pair of these over a high-priced set.I bought these because I was looking for something better than a basic, single-ear Xbox One headset that I could use for gaming. I wanted something that sounded decent and had a nice mic so I could communicate with other players. I was also hoping to find something with surround sound that wasn't overly expensive. This offered that. The sound quality of these sound great IMO and they are comfortable to wear, covering my ears well. It is difficult to hear room noise with these. I thought the LEDs were kinda cool, but really, if I'm wearing them, it isn't like I see them on myself, so I don't necessarily care too much whether they light up or not. It does require that you plug in the USB cord for those to work, however, so for something like the Xbox, where the audio cable is plugged in to the controller for game chat, you'll need a USB extension cable to plug the USB cord into to reach a USB port someplace. Again, I don't necessarily care if the lights are on or not, so this isn't a factor for me and was not a primary deciding factor in the purchase. If I want the LEDs, I can just get a USB extension cable. I don't see it as a negative for me, but if you want LEDs, you'd probably wish that the USB cable wasn't bundled with the audio cable. For a single-user PC, this wouldn't be as much of an issue, because everything would be right there; this is something primarily that would impact someone using it with a controller for gaming.Speaking of the PC, I was impressed that this came with the connector for the Xbox (audio and mic all-in-one) and included a splitter adapter that would allow connecting to separate mic and headphone ports, like a PC would have. This is not my use case, but if I was looking for something for the PC, these would be nice for that, too.There is an inline volume control with a mute switch.  The volume is a wheel control, which is nice for quick volume adjustment, and the housing for it is fairly big compared with other inline controls. It doesn't bother me that it is big. I actually like it because it is bigger, making it easier to find when you want to adjust things, and I also don't feel like it is so tiny and cheap that it will break apart on me if I so much as look at it. The only really negative thing I'd have to comment on is the mute switch. It is not readily apparent if you are muted or not with just the headset controls. There is a red dot next to the switch, but it isn't clear if that means you're muted or not. Once I figured out which way was which, then it wasn't a problem and the switch worked just fine. I recall that when the switch is pushed toward the red dot, the mic is live, which differs a bit from a standard xbox controller, providing both red (mute) and green (live) colors. It is possible to mute several different ways on the Xbox (I can mute in the Xbox party controls or the keypad the mic plugs into on the controller), so this is why a clear label or indication of the switch position would be more helpful.I played Destiny 2 with these and could hear noises move around me, so the surround sound apparently works. I could also hear in-game footsteps I did not hear as clearly before when playing just with the TV.The headphones also have a nice, sturdy feel to the over-the-head band, so I don't feel like the thing would snap or break apart on me. There is nice, thick, soft padding on the band itself for greater comfort.Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase. I can play comfortably, participate in in-game chat, and improve my game with better sound clarity than the TV.
title: Impressed: comfortable and good sound.

author: Jacob Charles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: I really enjoy these headphones. The sound quality is great, and I can use them for both my PC and Xbox as they include the adapter for the PC Mic/Audio ports. My only major issue is that I wear glasses, and the way the headphones sit on my head is not extremely comfortable. I cannot wear them for extended periods of time, as I used to wear my HYPER-X Stinger headset. Another minor gripe I have is the lights are USB powered, and the USB is right next to the headphone jack. Doesn't affect PC gaming at all - but it's a bit annoying to have the USB dangling around the Xbox controller. I use a twist tie to hold it together with the mic plug. Otherwise, my cat thinks it's a toy! I would highly recommend these for youth, and moderately for adults (with the issues I mentioned in mind).
title: Good Headphones - Especially for the price

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019
review_content: The frame is a bit stiff and doesnt seal aroun my ears propperly they also push in to hard on your ears which make it painful for more than 2 or 3 hour sessions. The quality of the speakers is suprising it rivaled my razor Man o wars which are better is all aspects.The mic even when reducing any ambient noise input to the mic it still hot mics and is definitly a cheap mic that does work. I switched to push to talk to fix that issue in discord. Great cheap headset would recommend as maybe a back up or as a temp headset.
title: Suprisingly good for the price

author: D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
review_content: This headset is cheaply made. Very flimsy when adjusting head size. The top padding is more just for show as it flattens with barely any pressure. It works fine. Its nothing fancy. The mute wheel and button have great resistance so you don't have to worry about accidently hitting the volume wheel and not being able to hear.If you are looking for a budget head set, this one will work. But for women its pretty big. The best headset ive found for women that adjusts well are the kraken headsets but those are a bit pricy.
title: Got for the ps4. It's cheap but works. Flimsy head adjuster. Big on women.

author: Dylan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: Here's a small list of what I think are important about the headset. What’s important to know is that this is for PC use.General:I had an adapter so I didn’t need to buy a new one. The product details say that you need an adapter for certain devices, so I wanted to remind that you do need one for the pc. They’re cheap, just don’t forget.The cable itself for plugging is a little over seven feet just like the product details. I think this length is fair and not too long. You can walk around just fine.Sound:The surround sound is good. What I would recommend is logging in to the games you frequent and tweak the sound to make it sound best for you. There were a couple sounds that were a little quiet like thunder and some other sound effects, but overall, it’s really good.Voices in videos, streams and games is perfect. Music is also great.Comfort:The microphone takes a little effort to move, but hardly anything bad. I was used to my previous headsets being quick to move, so it was just a little different.I think I have a big head, so the size for the price was concerning when I bought it, but it fits fine and is comfortable.Noise Cancellation:Noise cancellation is a big thing for me. Not being able to hear people yell at the referees in the game doing something they don’t agree with, dogs barking (from inside the house) being quieter, or having loud people over is great. While this feature is standard, it’s still quality from my experience.LED:The LED cord is a USB that is shorter than the cable jacks. This isn’t an issue for PC when the USB plug ins is so close together. I’m not going to be taking advantage of this feature, but it’s nice to have. You’ll have to unplug it every time you want to turn it off as it doesn’t have a switch.What’s different from my previous Headset:I had two previous headsets from the same company. This headset was around 40$ so when it broke the same way twice, I wanted a change. What I was looking for was something durable around the ear speakers so when I set it down on my chair, the plastic wouldn’t crack, break, then dangle and need to be replaced.I found the price and features of this one appealing, so I got it. We’ll just have to see if it lasts over a year like the previous ones, but I’m pretty impressed so far.All in all, good purchase for the price and I hope it lasts me a long time.
title: Pretty good headset for the price.< Review for PC > DO NOT FORGET TO GET AN ADAPTER

author: Ryan G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
review_content: This headset is very nice for the pricepoint.  For less than 30 dollars you are given a sturdy headset, quality microphone, and adapter that has volume AND mute (very important) on the headset itself, which allows for muting and volume control without having to go through the variety of menus on whatever system you are using this on.Works on modern gaming systems out of the box (aside Xbox One 1537 which requires the propiertary Xbox headset adapter), with noise-cancelling, crisp and clear audio, and great speech.It is not wireless or bluetooth, but for less than 30 dollars, one will not miss those features.This headset is truly GREAT for the price paid, it goes above and beyond in every area that it so humbly states it has capabilities.If you need a headset for casual online gaming, this is the one.
title: Budget headset that offers much more than budget experience.

author: Wimpy Kid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: There is 3 of us in the house that game. Me and my two boys, 7 and 10. They are quick to destroy a headset and I/we've gone through a few different headsets and I and my boys found Runmus headsets to be the most comfortable. Sound and mic quality is good. You are not getting the same sound as a high-end headset (like some like to compare it to), but at the price point I can say the quality of it is good.But the one thing about Runmus that stands out the most is their customer service. I've had one headset that arrived with a DOA mic. I sent them an email and within 5 days I had a new headset.
title: Great headset for the price and excellent customer service

author: L. Myers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
review_content: When I saw the number of reviews on this headset and the overall high rating I felt pretty safe buying this headset. It worked great at first but quickly deteriorated. I had this headset less than 6 months before it failed beyond use. The headset still looks brand new on the outside and was gently used.Feedback into the mic from the headset started becoming an issue just a few months into ownership, before the mic started picking up constant static. When I last used it the feedback was deafening and I found only one side of the headset was outputting sound. I tried troubleshooting these issues and it all came back to the headset.Looking through other reviews I found that other people had similar issues to mine with feedback and audio quality/failure. This, combined with the incentive from the manufacturer to leave a 5-star review gives me the impression that this headset isn't what the star rating implies.Even with a replacement from the manufacturer I intend to look for a different headset after the speed of failure and audio feedback on this one.
title: Good first impression, quick failure after

author: DODS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
review_content: I have a lot of ear piercings and this headset doesn't irritated them at all. I also have a lot of sore spots on my head from head injuries that make wearing headsets often tricky because too much pressure for too long can cause me to get migraines and so far I haven't had any issues with that with this headset. Very clear and crisp audio, I haven't tested out the mic yet but if I have issues then I'll update this review but considering the quality of the other features so far I'm safe to assume that the mic is great as well.
title: Very cushioned and comfortable, can't complain

author: Dell Griffith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: For the money spent, these are great, durable gaming headsets.  I am so tired of spending many times more on headsets that my kids destroy within a few weeks because they're built so poorly.  The Runmus headsets (we have several now) are built more solidly.  My kids are hard on them, but they're all still working, no broken mics.  Now, as far as comfort goes, there are likely more comfortable headsets out there,as these fit pretty tight on my (adult) head and get a bit warm after an hour of gaming, but at this price point I'm not complaining.  If you're looking for a decent gaming headset without shelling out $100, or more, then try these out.
title: Durable budget gaming headset

author: Edeolom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
review_content: Let's face it, at this price I really was not expecting much, but decided to give it a try and, am I glad I did! The most important thing about his headset, besides the obvious quality of the sound, is that it is the most comfortable set I have ever had. If you game or spend hours on end with your set on, you know how painful it can be sometimes. I just love how comfy they are, the quality of the sound is pretty decent and the mic works great as well. I really have no complaints here and am pretty happy with the purchase.
title: Great headset for an affordable price

author: Anand Thakur
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my daughter who's become an avid gamer with her friends during quarantine.  She's primarily using it on a PC and so far so good.  Installation is easy as would be expected for a standard headphone like this - use the supplied adapter and plug in the green and pink cables to the matching colors on the back of the PC.  The USB plug is purely for the lights and optional but we've got them plugged in for a little bling.Sound quality is good and they're pretty comfortable for both of us to wear.
title: Great value headset

author: Gee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: I got this for my husband as I was tires of him screaming on his previous headphones. He had an Xbox headphone and wanted exactly the same one, thankfully I did not listen to him and got this one. Is cheaper and I can be screaming with him and he will not listen to me (which makes me mad but at the same time proves is found it’s job!!) he can have his volume on max and I will he calmly sleeping by his side! You have the choice to use with it without the lights, there is a USB connector apart just for that, and we chose not to use it, and it works perfectly fine!! So far, hood purchase!!
title: Good quality, study headphones!!

author: Jason Coulter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019
review_content: I bought this headset as a replacement to my XBOX purchased headset.  I wasn't sure what type of product I was going to get for this low of a price point.  I know I haven't had them long but the sound is good and they are comfortable.  Some times when I'm chatting with friends I get a little crackling but that might be their end also.  The only part of quality I would say is the ear cushioning seems a little cheap.  Even though they are still comfortable Like I had said above.  I have an xbox elite controller so the piece they said I would need I didn't need!  So another bonus.  Oh did I mention I use these on the XBOX One.  For the price great product I would definately recommend.
title: Sound is good

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
review_content: Package arrived in timely fashion, if not early, and I was impressed by the packaging--everything was well protected inside, no damage to the product. The cushioning is very comfortable; I can wear the headset for six to seven hours at a time and it doesn't pinch or hurt my head. I wear glasses, and it still doesn't press them into my skull like the last generic brand headset I owned. This pair does seem slightly too big for my head, despite being on its small adjustable setting, but I'm not a terribly big boned person and it's not a deal breaker in any case.The manual does a great job explaining various setups for various gaming rigs and how to adapt the headset to fit whatever equipment you're trying to use it with, and an adapter cord does come with it. The red LED lights look great, though there's one close to the mic that does spotlight my mouth a little brightly for my tastes, but again--not a deal breaker. And you can just unplug the lights from the USB port if you don't want them on.The sound quality is great, and my friends have reported no issues from my microphone--they've said I sound clearer than they've ever heard me (and I've tried a handful of headsets in the last couple months).The cord is a long, but not unreasonable length, and seems to be well reinforced. The volume control wheel partway down the cord works fine.My only complaint is that there seems to be something small rattling loose in the left ear piece, but unless I'm shaking my head I wouldn't hear it. I like the headset enough to let it slide.Overall, this seems like a really solid headset for the price, I've had an excellent experience with it so far, and would highly recommend to anyone just starting to get into this type of equipment. If I was already used to higher brand items I might have more to fuss about, but in my limited experience I think it's great.
title: Sturdy, Comfortable, Great Mic

author: Warren Ellis Jr.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: The cable is very good and long. It contains a detachable speaker/mic adapter cord. It lights up red if USB plugged in, but no switch (so unplug to turn of the red lights). Overall a great product for the price.So far my son loves it. He loves the way it looks and lights up. It sounds really good but not as clean as some other cheap headsets. We've used for a week now with lots of hours into them and have had zero issues.NOTE: I was concerned it would not fit my 8 year old's head, but it does at its smallest setting.
title: Purchased for child gaming

author: Chord
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_content: When I wrote into support, I only asked if the headset actually DID support 7.1 surround sound. I did not get a direct yes or no. I got a lot of running around. I've since sent the item back because of this and will return to my Plantronics which DOES do surround 7.1.As far as stereo sound, it's I'd probably give it 5 stars but it is advertised as 7.1 surround and my system is less than 1 year old and the onboard sound card supports surround sound.When I wrote them asking simply "Does the K2 Red Gaming Headset  actually support 7.1 surround sound? or is it just Stereo?"  - I get this answer:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------support@runmus.netHi,Thank you for your reply!In fact,7.1 surround sound is an abstrct concept,it just to make the sound of the headset more three-dimensional.If you are unsatisfacted with the headset,we can provide you the full refund.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(I *already have another surround sound headset and love it - the cable is going bad on it though)I *AM* giving it 1 star only because its falsely advertised as "RUNMUS Gaming Headset Xbox One Headset with 7.1 Surround Sound Stereo" - its at best Stereo and I've changed from 3 stars to 1 stars since I wrote their support to correct this and they haven'tAfter reading other practices (a card to get another item?) and some others - go with something else that is NOT RUNMUS
title: Does not support 7.1 surround sound on all systems

author: AbbicusWabbicus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           I compared my experience with this headset to a similar brand that my husband bought. When I used the headset I would sometimes have issues with people hearing me. Compared to the other headset the microphone was a lot further from my face, the other company had a more compact headset with more solid materials, the microphone piece on the headset would stick more when putting it up and down and the other company's microphone moved smoothly. But it was comfortable overall no big complaints.
title: Ok on a budget.

author: Anahid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I love these so far!  The only part I’m not a huge fan of is how much cord there is, but other than that it works so well!!! The sound is awesome compared to my old headset and the mic is waaaay better.UPDATE:I returned these.  The jack to plug in to your controller would constantly shift and either cause static or just completely disconnect for audio.  It was super annoying and I couldn't handle it especially since I game and use them a lot.  They do let you do a free gift with a review which I did which is why I am giving 3 stars.  They were also comfortable but hurt my cheeks/jaw where it would rest around my ears after a few hours.
title: Awesome headset for Xbox gaming! (updated 10/14)

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: Sorry this headset is NOT 100% compatible with PS4, need to remove that from the Product Description title.  The headset has two outputs, one for the microphone &  one for the headset so you can hear.....BUT the PS4 controller only has one output to plug in to.  I tried to get details from all the Reviews, but they are so confusing and misleading that they don't help at all!!  NEED to clean up the reviews so they can actually help your customers.  I can't imagine the amount of money that has been spent on the returns for this product......
title: Fraudulent Marketing & Product Description

author: cynthia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: I bough this for my xbox one controller, the sound was pretty awesome, however, the padding hurt my ears after a while and the headset felt pretty heavy and uncomfortable, not sure if my head isn't big enough (I am an adult woman)? The mic component wasn't the best, my teammates septs saying that they couldn't hear me very well and that I had a "hot mic" problem, which means that there was a lot of static on my end--well, I also heard the static. After a while, I ended up getting headaches, not sure if it was combination of the uncomfortable padding, and the  "hot mic" problem. Again, the sound was pretty awesome, which is why I would have considered keeping it, but the mic issue was too prominent for my liking. Not sure if I just happen to receive a defective headset, or if this is an actual issue. Note: I had just bough a new xbox controller, so its safe to safe that it wasn't on my end--I even bough a different headset just to make sure it was not because of my controller.If you're not a talker, then these are great starter basic gaming headsets, or for kids that just end up breaking everything, but if you are a  talker, then I'd reconsider.
title: "hot mic" issues

author: J. Ellis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2020
review_content: I bought these to replace my old guard Sony headset that finally just snapped in half. I am in amazement at how clear and crisp the sound is and my friends like that I'm no longer peaking the mic or sounding too quiet during those late night sessions. The lighting is a nice touch, and its not bright enough to distract or reflect against my screen.Though some people complain about the length of the cable, I enjoy it as it allows me to route the cable through with my mouse/keyboard etc. It also comes with a very nice mic/speaker splitter to use with your computer.I'll be taking a look through the rest of their store to see what they offer, cause if they're half as good as these headphones that's a damn good deal!
title: Amazing Headset

author: Samuel M. Sullivan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: I have have brought a set of headphones that cost 280 (not worth naming them email me if you want to know).....for myself and these for my child honestly my child has the 280 headphones and I have taken these. Honestly he said he only likes them because these  are not wireless but the boom and gunshots on these are better.Real world applications these are very very good. I will not say because of the price but the quality of make and soundI feel it will be impossible to be not satisfied with this purchase
title: If you are looking for computer and gaming headphones these are a must have.

author: Rivip
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: This headset works great since it's basically plug-and-play. Connect it to your console controller and you're good to go.The only few issues I'm going to list are suggestions/comments my son (12) has made. Ultimately, he's the one using the headset.Issues:1) The only way to light them up is via USB cable. However, the cable can't reach the USB port on the PS4. It would be fantastic it the USB end was long enough on its own to reach the PS4, or if the headset had the ability to turn lights on (batteries).2) Ears hurt after just a couple of hours.3) Sometimes when splitting the sound between the TV and the controller, only the left ear works.
title: Works great but with minor issues.

author: A.J. Díaz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: The RUNMUS gaming headset is an amazing product and I wouldn’t go anywhere else. This coming from a gamer dad who plays things like Call of Duty Warzone. The noise cancellation is superb and allows me to hear every sound effect to play to the best of my ability. The sound quality is truly flawless, allowing you to adjust how loud or low you want the sound to come through your headphones. I hear every footstep, creak and effect that games have to offer, courtesy of these headsets that are definitely a must have for gaming. The entire build of these headers are perfect for gaming - silencing the outside world, providing cushion on your ears and high quality sound effects they are my favorite headset so far. They are wired and built for console or PC players. If you don’t mind that (which I don’t mind at all),  they are sturdy, reliable and the only headset I use. My daughter broke my first pair (not cause of the company at all, she wedged my wire between a baby gate and pulled down causing my controllers audio jack to break and she bent the audio plug in). After that I knew I needed another headset A.S.A.P. and I didn’t need to go anywhere other than the RUNMUS gaming headset. Thank you for creating a product that has become a part of my daily life.
title: RUNMUS is a must! I highly recommend it.

author: Jared & Cassidy Cornell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: Used them for all of 10 minutes and I’m putting them back in the box for return. They look “cool” I guess, but in my opinion they look and feel very childish. I felt like I looked like an idiot wearing them. As far as sound quality, I couldn’t find a balance that worked for me. These things have WAY TOO MUCH BASS! In Call if Duty, you could hardly hear anything else over the bass from grenades, etc. I tried all different audio settings to find a good balance and it never sounded good. Also I understand that they’re made for multiple platforms and whatnot, but for Xbox One, there’s absolutely no need for that long cord. It creates just a knotted mess that gets hung up and tangled every time you move around. Overall just unsatisfied.
title: Feels like a toy. Too much bass.

author: Michael Youmans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
review_content: I am a full-time gamer (PS4) and I use headset mainly for COD and GTA. I am very happy this headset - the sound is nice, loud if you want, the mic works well, it doesn't pick up background noise so it keeps your speaking clear and understandable. What I really love the most is that FINALLY, someone takes ears into consideration. I hated headsets that squeeze into your ears, after playing a while I would always get a headache. I can play with these for 5-6-8 hours and not have a problem at all. I always have conversations in COD and I have never had anyone complain that they couldn't understand or hear me.They also are good for directional sounds - I can hear that someone is trying to sneak up behind me so I am ready for them. Also, I just plugged them into the controller and they worked immediately. I have been very happy with them so far.
title: Great headsets - and my ears FIT too!

author: Johnny Huynh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: Best headset for the priceI purchased these headset because my original headset broke and I needed one as soon as possible. They shipped within 1 day and I got to say; you definitely get more than what you paid for. You don’t got to worry about these breaking because they’re built like a tank for durability! The sound quality is very good. I use these for FPS games and I can hear when someone walks behind me as if they’re actually walking behind me in real life. The mic is not the best (compared to actual recording mics) but it is very clear and does a great job only catching your voice and not other noises in the room. Noise cancellation is top of the game, if I’m using the headset, the only way for you to get my attention is physically touch me or just yell at the top of your lungs. The cord for the aux and USB connector is very durable. However, it gets very tangled in times due to the length of the cord BUT that’s part of the reason I bought it; for the length of the cord. The only CON I would have to say with this headset is that it fits very weird on my head like it doesn’t completely cup my ear as it should, there’s a little gap. The gap hasn’t caused any real problems though so it doesn’t bother me. 5STARS IN MY OPINION.
title: No regret

author: Raymond
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: So I just finished setting up the headset and tried listening to some audio + testing the mic input level. As for the audio, the sound is very crisp and clear and there is a good, even distribution between both sides. I'm very content with the quality. However, for the mic, I've found that the input is pretty weak. I'm not sure if this is a problem with my laptop, but after checking through all of my audio settings and making sure that the sensitivity is on 100% and whatnot, I'm still having trouble getting it to pick up my voice well. I've had a similar issue with another RUNMUS headset previously, so I don't really know if the problem is with the product or my device. That aside, I still believe this is redeemable because of its good audio quality and comfort (I do have a rather large head, and it fits snugly). The LED lights on the headset are also controlled by the USB jack, so if you don’t want to have them on, you can simply not plug it in. You won’t see a USB icon or disk driver appear if you do decide to plug it in as it only controls the lights.-EDIT- I managed to solve the mic problem by unplugging the mic cable. For some reason, having it plugged in lowered the sensitivity. Taking it out removed the ability to mute/unmute the mic via the little button on the headset cable, but the mic quality shot up and now it’s very clear (I can still manually mute through my system, so no biggie).
title: Good Quality for Price

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: I was looking for something simple. Good sound quality, working mic. I came across this and it looked pretty good for the price. It probably cost half the price of a name brand competitor, but the results were also half the value. First off, don’t get wrapped up on the cool red lights they show you in the pictures. It only works when you plug in the USB portion. Second, it took me hours.. freaking hours to figure out how to make this work for the Xbox one. It’s a newer model so there should be no reason to need an adapter but the headset just wouldn’t work. After hours of screwing around with it, it was like Jesus himself gave a deaf man the gift of hearing. Then there was problem number three. The mic doesn’t work. No matter what I did, the mic just wouldn’t turn on and I couldn’t communicate with my friends.While it may have had some pretty decent sound quality, beware of the good marketing and poor quality. Lights don’t work unless usb plugged in. Sound comes on and off. Mic doesn’t work. Don’t waste your time or money.
title: Buyer beware.

author: Danielle McNelly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: Ok. So I needed a new headset for my xbox1. I found this headset, read some reviews, and liked what I saw. Unfortunately I didn't read far enough down because this headset only let's me listen but I'm not able to use the mic. It only works on certain products. The sound is good but if the mic doesn't work on what I have then what's the point?
title: Eh.

author: Andres
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020
review_content: All in all great microphone for the price.Mic Quality - A:  To my surprise, I consistently get compliments on the sound quality of the microphone when I play with friends and random players online.Comfort - B+ : The fit around my head could be a bit more snug on the ears. Wearing hats, the top part starts to press down on the top of my head a bit too much. Other than that solid, the fit is nevertheless secure and soft on the ears.Sound Quality - B : I do not use it for many games and I am a fairly casual player so I do not ask for much. Does the job well.Loudness - C:  Better for PC gamers. Not that loud for an Xbox One, the only option to increase the volume is on the dial on the microphone, and I believe this limits the maximum attainable volume, because I would prefer the sound output to be louder. When I use the headset with my laptop, I can also use the laptop and relevant application to increase the volume to levels greater than that which is possible on my Xbox One.Value: A: For the price all of this is still an excellent headset.
title: Bang for the buck

author: E&A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
review_content: As consumers, one thing we get hung up on is the price and brand of the things we buy - at first glance, I admit that I was uncertain about the quality of these headphones but after using them for a few months, I can truly say that these headphones are absolutely great for the price!Pros:- Comfortable. As someone who tends to wear them for a few hours a day, I can say that they fit rather comfortably on my head.- Good quality sound - absolutely no complaints about the sound dynamic.- Helpful team - after having issues with the headphones out of box, the team did work with us to troubleshoot and it turned out to be a computer problem. I appreciate them for their help!- Nice lighting. I admit, it's a fun trick to turn these on during Zoom calls!Cons:- The microphone. This is my one complaint because when using the microphones, people often complained about my voice sounding a little distorted but by no means not understandable. More of a minor inconvenience than a big issue.Overall a great set for the low price!
title: Good pair of headphones for the price!

author: NonnasNoodles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
review_content: Great headset for the price! They fit decently, would like a little bit of wiggle for larger heads, feels a little tight on the ears even when extended but that might loosen up over time, these are fresh out of the box.Solid construction, sounds great except if you touch the audio jack while it’s plugged in to something and it turns a little you get that slight static noise that sounds like a wire is frayed inside, but it’s so light it’s not even worth sending back because I don’t anticipate messing with the plug while playing.All in all I would probably purchase again and recommend as a budget headset especially for someone with kids who maybe aren’t going to take care of a $150 pair of headphones like they should.
title: Great for the price, not perfect but better than expected!

author: CelticPrince
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
review_content: I've purchased three Runmus headsets (2 K2 Pro, one K8) and all are great headsets (particularly at their price points).  The K8 is a smaller headset, ideal for kids.  The K2 is great for teens and adults, fitting snugly over the ears and blocks out most sounds.  The surround sound is great in gaming, knowing what is happening behind or to the side.  I recommend the K2 for the price point.Update:  Please note that the K2 Pro headset is snug and wearing glasses could get uncomfortable. I had to raise the stems above my ears to wear these for long periods.
title: Runmus K2 Great For The Price Point

author: Tasha L. Driver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019
review_content: Update: This headset stood up to over a year of heavy use and hard handling by a preteen. I am so impressed that I just bought a second pair to replace it. The sound was only coming out of one ear and the microphone didn't work well, but I blame that on my son's misuse and not the quality of the product. I am very happy with the product itself!!Original review: I purchased these for my 11-year-old son to use while playing Fortnite. He is very happy with them. He says that the set is extremely comfortable to wear for long periods. The sound quality is good and all of his friends can understand him well. I think they look a bit big on his head, but if he is fine with that, I have no complaints.
title: The recipient was very happy.

author: BM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: Out of the box these feel great, and will get even softer after being broken in. Sound quality is good for gaming, nice surround sound. Can control sound and microphone on/off from a spot on the cord. Cable is braided, mic folds up, and mic quality is decent. I like these better than the cheap kind from Walmart for similar prices. These feel like they are heavy duty meaning it should not break easily. it comes with an adapter for the computer, meaning you don't need the adapter for ps4 controllers which i am testing on. Great product.
title: decent quality headphones for the price

author: Alejandro Castillo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: Let me start saying/writing this headset is amazing. It looks bulky but I think that's the way it has to be for gaming headsets. I have another brand of headset that was a little bit more expensive but this one is better. I compared both of them playing the same game (RED DEAD REDEMPTION 2) which has a lot of different sound effects I didn't even heard before on my TV.  I set the game sound to the headset. I was amazed and little scared of every one of the sounds of this game that I could hear. You can actually hear your enemy (a bear) walking towards you before even see it. This headset was the best by far. The headset comes with a Y-splitter to use on a PC, you remove the splitter if you want to plug it in a console controller. I won't doubt in buying again.
title: I was amazed how really good they are.

author: Average Joe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: The Run Mus K2 Gaming Headset just arrived and it was easy to set up on my pc.  I just plugged the two 3.5 mm cables to the input and output and I was ready to go.  My gaming experience was much more enjoyable being able to use the headset to play instead of the push function where I can only talk if I push a button on my keyboard to talk.  The headset was comfortable to wear.  The only drawback was the feedback from my fan blowing air on me.  A player on my team made a note that he heard some background noise while playing.  Once I turned it off, it was fine.  It didn't pick up the typing on my keyboard.  Overall, I'm a satisfied customer.
title: First gaming headset

author: Strider Kiwi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: I expected this headset to be crappy since it was so cheap, turns out, it's nearly identical in quality to the more expensive headsets ($60-$100+ range) that I've used, the differences being it's more bulky, (but probably less likely to break as a result), wired (which doesn't bother me too much) and isn't quite as comfortable as some of the padded headset's I've used. However, it's still more comfortable than the Turtle Beach's I had, and a fraction of the price! This is the go to headset if you're on a budget.
title: Amazing for the price

author: Tyler s.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: Thoroughly surprised for the price. I'm someone who doesn't want to spend much unless I know it's quality. If I'm in a store looking for headphones I'll either buy the pair of sennheisers i like best, or I'm with the $8 sony earbuds. I'm okay with cheap and I'll pay for quality. These are a lot of quality for the low.Start to finish:Packaging - Box is run of the mill, there's too much going on, if it was in a big lots I probably wouldn't have looked twice at it. There's a few misspelling but the fact that it actually lists its compatibility and audio specs on it is a great sign. Nothing in the box is loose and it'd be pretty hard to get damaged during shipping.Set-up - Plus and play, for ps4 go to system settings -> devices -> audio devices -> output to headphones and change it to all audio. Says this clearly in the manual, takes about 10 seconds tops. No issue at all. Usb or seperate headphone/mic adapter are included as well for easy pc hook up. Xbox might be difference but if you bought an xbox, then you probably won't buy this anyways because you make bad decisions.Comfort - shape is perfect, not too tight, i much prefer the padding that this has to the elastic bands that some of the others have. Had to laugh today when i tried on a $150 pair at.. A well known computer store in Detroit.. And preferred the way the random $20 headset i gambled on in Amazon fit. Only complaint compared to high end? Couple grams too heavy, not enough to matter, and the pads could be a bit softer. On a $100 headset, maybe 4/5. On a $20 headset? 5/5.Sound - This was the real surprise, I've tried astro a10's, a few logitechs, a bunch of different turtle beaches and a kraken headset and this beats them all by a mile. Highs and mids are clear and tight, if I hooked it to something with an equalizer to turn down the bass then I'd probably take this over any midrange bose, beats or skullcandy headphones as well. The heavy bass isn't an issue, but if you're into hi-fi or an audiophile (I'm not, but I've heard enough quality and enough garbage to know the difference) then imbalance always sticks out. The 7.1 surround sound is wonderfully accurate, it does a great job with keeping sounds distinct even when there's tons of stuff going on. It doesn't compare to the artis pro steel series, sennheisers, hi-fi man, or even a couple hidden gem koss headphones I've tried (open back koss), but realistically these could easily compete in the $80 range. The noise canceling could do with some work too, but I just turn them up and enjoy. After 2 hours of it at 3/4 I never ended up with fatigue from having them so high.Build quality / durability - this is my only concern. I assume if these don't take a fall they'll be wonderful for ages, and the feel like they can take a little fall and be fine, but since there's no flexibility to them and it is made of a harder plastic any hard hit or say a child going to jump on the couch... Might do them in. The positive note? Instead of being out $50-$150 for any other decent headset, you're only out $20.If every headset under $200 was $50? These would be 3.75-4/5 and I'd say get the gameones, steel series, or gsp.At $20-25? 5/5, order two.
title: $20? Order two.

author: César G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: pretty good quality, noise cancellation and fast delivery, good chooseThese are the single best pair of headphones I have ever used in my life. They are bulky, strong, soft on the ears, beautiful, top quality for the dollar.The sound: It does not oversell the surround sound, you will hear everything from every direction as if you were in the battlefield of the badlands. The quality of sound is beautiful as well, not muffling or diluting despite size, crisp and fresh. Noise cancellation? You'll be able to hear enough outside to make sure no one is going to play a game of SAW with you but give you peace of mind. Want more control of volume? No sweat, it comes with a small volume wheel.The mic: Wonderful work of art. Ignores outside sounds (except mechanical keyboard clicks of a certain type, those are loud.) You will be heard clearly, you will be clearly understandable and able to communicate with the most effect compared to other headsets, and is good at making sure only you are heard. Need to insta-mute that mic? It comes with a button that turns it off before anyone can hear what's going on.How does it feel? It surrounds and cups the ear, instead of pressing tightly against the tips and giving those horrible headaches. It gives your ears breathing room and the protein foam for the top of your skull is so pleasant that you can easily forget it's even there. The mic is comfortable to move around without getting in my way. Out of mind, the only thing you'll focus on is the sound blessing your ears. Want to wear it for three days in a row in your chair without visiting the bathroom and having a system of snacks and drinks at your desk for that ultimate WoW session? Go right ahead, it won't feel any different than when you put it on to begin with.Will they break easily? NO. These things are built like tanks for your skull, if you drop it, it will brush it off and laugh at the poor attempt to even crack it. This thing might even be a good tool for self defense with how strong it is, these aren't poor quality materials.How does it look? It looks like you're about to perform an impossible feat on your new favorite game. It's beautifully designed, has a red glare that will bring fear into your fellow gaming buddies when you hear their every breath in the game. They are equipped for any situation, they are scary to be against, and highly fashionable to show off and brag to your fellow gamers on Twitch and Steam. They are thick, but that makes this beast seem even bigger and more dominating than those sad little Skullcandy mobile headphones.What can I use it on? If it has either a USB port or can take those little round plugs, congratulations, this works on it. PC is what I use it on, but if I wanted to I could use it on any other single device a gamer could ever imagine using. Even old systems take this beast and let them in, it is perfect.Price vs Quality: Anything that claims to be better will either be a liar or something extraordinarily developed and thus be very costly. This competes with other more costly "top rated" headphones. This packs the features, the looks, the comfort, and the durability all for a considerable price that anyone would be right to simply choose this on first sight. I almost was a foolish mortal and thought about others, but no, I made the right choice to take this set and buy it. If it ever breaks I will be surprised and heartbroken. It has improved everything in my games, I cannot possibly appreciate any headphones more than this.You will regret not knowing what beauty is here before you by buying some lame headset for more of a price, because I feel very comfortable that this one will certainly out compete it without a SINGLE QUESTION. Buy it sooner than later, TREAT YOURSELF. I will be getting another for my brother without a doubt.
title: good quality,  amazing price

author: A. Nieves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
review_content: Gotta admit that my review is not fair towards the headphones. For the price they are five stars. They sound great and the mic doesn't have the most gain on the consoles out of the box but its good (can be adjusted) and at about twenty dollars there is no beating it. They good and deep cups that don't get too hot, feels kind of tight but that should loosen with time hopefully.  Not a real complaint but more my preference, nix the usb part of the cable so that I have a cleaner connection to my console controller.
title: Best bang for your buck

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
review_content: So, first off, I’m a YouTuber (sort of). I record my gameplay and post it on YouTube. I’ve never added a voice over as I’ve never really had a headset. And I was wary of buying one, to be honest. Why pay for a headset when I can hear the audio from the TV itself?But this headset was easy to figure out. You just plug it in and it works. If you want to use the mic, just flip the slider switch and there you go. If you don’t want it on, flip it back. And it has both a USB plug in a regular plug in.The biggest thing I want to mention is how much better the games sound now. I can actually experience it as if it were like a movie theater.I highly recommend this headset! And it glows when you plug it in USB ports. Bonus coolness!
title: Really Awesome Sound Quality

author: Vecifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: I am a hard-core gamer and I have no life. So trust me when I say that I use the hell out of these headphones. I’ve had everything from Astro a 50s that are $400, to the cheapest $15 headphones you can buy just about anywhere. I paid $16 for these when they were on sale and I was so incredibly pleasantly surprised. First off, they are some of the most, if not the most comfortable headphones I’ve ever worn.  Second, No, they aren’t the most insanely over boosted audio headsets out there. But what they do delivery is shockingly impactful base at higher volume, clear  and immersive  sound delivery, all while being relatively low weight. They completely cover your ears and don’t give you headaches across where the band rests atop your head like most headphones out there.  There are honestly, truthfully, only two things that bothered me about these headphones. The first being that a plastic  decorative piece at the end of the microphone was not properly attached so it rattled incessantly if I bumped it, which consequently could also be heard by the people in my party chat. My second gripe being that  as convenient as the 6 foot, nylon braided cord may seem on paper, it was kind of a pain in the ass with it just plugged into the controller in my lap. If I moved around a lot, the cord would get caught on things or we just flat out be annoying to deal with. BUT! These are minuscule when it comes to the overall  Quality and reliability and performance you get from such a low cost headset.  PLEASE take a chance on these. I have literally never written an Amazon review before until  I got these. Thanks guys and happy gaming!
title: Best bang for buck , hands-down.  PLEASE READ

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: Just got these in today, so far I can say that the quality of the build is decent. Doesn't look poorly built or pieced together. Band is malleable, but will go back to its original form. Which will be great for others with kids unlike myself.The sound.. the sound is amazing that I now feel like I need all audio to include game and chat to come into my headset after hearing a game start up. Its absolutely amazing and I was astonished by it. Honestly... I was quite shocked to hear so much life from these.I haven't had the time to test out the mic with friends yet, but from the testing of the volume and pick up from my ps4 setting. I heard myself with intense clarity, I will however come back to adjust review once I've had the time to test with with friends.Cushion is great all around, instantly felt comfortable as I placed them on. No complains there, but I'm also not sensitive about these things.The LEDs are great, plugged them into a power bank just to see the red light up. It's nifty and adds a bit more life to your experience, especially at night I would add. Kudos to that!All in all, I would definitely recommend these to all peers and friends alike! PC, PS4, Xbox, honestly for anything.10/10 would buy again and again! Might get an upgrade of these after these eventually meet their end.
title: Great Product and Sound for a GREAT price

author: Ronald Bercaw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020
review_content: I'll preface this review by saying that I've only had these for a ~week and was really only looking for a headset that had a decent mic and passive noise cancellation while being comfortable. On this front, it's at least as good as headsets that cost twice as much.Pros:- Good mic quality. Don't try to record a podcast with it, but more than good enough for any gaming related communication needs.- Pads are too new to say how they'll hold up long term, but they're comfortable and isolate well. They appear to be some sort of styrofoam covered in faux leather.-Surround sound appears to work. At the very least I can play overwatch and hear where footsteps came from.-Braided cable with a built in cable tie and thick couplers between cable and plugs. I wouldn't expect these to have the loose connection failure mode that most 3 mm jacks develop anytime soon.-They're built like a tank. Every component I've tried to bend is sturdy while obviously being designed to bend at the same time.Cons:- It conforms to the shape of your head via a flexible headband rather than having the cups on a swivel ala ATH-M50s. This works acceptably well, but the headband is kind of stiff so I personally have to accept only having one cup fully covering my ear. The headband is ridiculously bendy with some effort though, so your mileage may vary.-Sound quality isn't great. About what you'd expect from a pair of headphones in this price range, especially given that they're true 7.1, but you don't want to be listening to music with these. Good enough for competitive gaming here.-Slightly heavy. This is endemic to 7.1 headsets in general, but worth noting.-Double 3mm jack required. Not a deal breaker, but it doesn't have the chip required to make USB send and receive audio data. USB port is simply for powering the LEDs (optional).Overall, I couldn't be happier. The first con is the only one I'd really consider to be a legitimate problem with them, but if my budget headset only has one real con, I'm more than happy with the purchase. I was looking for a gaming headset, and it does that job at least as well as much more expensive headsets.
title: Good deal overall

author: J.P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I bought these a couple of days ago, and I must say that for the price, the quality is fantastic. The noise isolation works wonders, I can't hear anything or anyone while I'm wearing them. The mic quality is also very good compared to others on the same price range. They are also very comfortable, when I first saw them the first thing that came though my mind was that they would be really and uncomfortable, but it turned out to be the opposite.I say for what you're paying for, you're getting an excellent value.
title: Excellent quality for the price

author: Doomyg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: I have a small head, wear glasses, and sit at my computer most of the day - work in the morning, gaming in the evening.My main problem with most headsets is that is pushes my ears into my glasses' arms, which eventually makes them hurt.With this headset, I don't have that problem. The ear cups are so large they go completely over my ears, so no pain during long stints of wearing them.The sound itself is a little quieter than my other set, but means I can actually turn things up instead of leaving them at minimal volume.I love the mute button on the wire controller.The noise cancellation for me is actually too strong - to the point that I needed to adjust my system settings to turn the microphone's sensitivity up just to be able to hear my talking.The sound quality is great. I'm not a huge buff on quality, but I have no issues with bass or higher pitches.I live in AZ and my room gets quite hot - because this covers my ears, I personally get a little warmer when wearing, so that may be a concern for some folks.But - this headset did exactly what I needed it to - not cause pain after wearing for hours on end with my glasses. Its a bit on the larger end, but I love it anyway.Updated to 5 stars due to the company's customer service providing quick responses to questions I had.
title: Bulky but Great

author: Skjaeret
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: We are not heavy gamers, but we wanted an affordable headset that is glasses friendly, has comfortable ear pads and could be used on more than one platform. We also wanted a decent microphone and full headset for stereo cues.We picked up a K2 Pro red and it fit the bill perfectly. Good quality, sound and comfort.  We had a couple of questions and tech support was very responsive and never once handed us off to the ether or closed the ticket until we were completely satisfied.That’s some of the main reasons why we just purchased a second one, this time in blue. Now the headsets color coordinate with our chairs (OMG) :)
title: K2 Pro, first impressions

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: This is probably the best quality headset you can get for the price. I honestly did not believe the extent of the reviews I was reading about the sound quality for a headset at this price point, but it truly is as good as everyone says it is. The sound quality is the best I've gotten out of a gaming headset. You can hear everything in the game with crystal clarity, even footsteps and other quiet noises you might not hear with another mic. As far as noise canceling and mic clarity, the people I play with have said everything sounds great and I haven't had any issues there.The headset itself is good quality and seems durable. I've only been using the mic for about 2 weeks so I cannot attest to the durability, but based on the apparent quality I'm not expecting to have any issues there. It also has a lengthy cord so I doubt you will have any issue plugging it in anywhere in the vicinity that you game in. I'm using it on Xbox One so I didn't even unwrap the whole cord. It comes with everything you need to play on any platform (except you need a separate adapter for Xbox one depending on your controller type). It truly is a very versatile and high quality gaming headset and I highly doubt that you can beat it for the same price. You'd probably have to pay 4x as much to get a comparable headset.
title: Best headset for the price

author: LeeMack916
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: I needed another gaming headset, but didn’t want to break the bank.  What would be another negative is sacrificing sound quality for something cheap.  I feel there’s a happy medium with this headset.  It feels comfortable for my head size, nicely padded.  Since my prior headsets have been Bluetooth, I had to worry about charging my headsets and the years of use have worn down the length of charge.  I prefer this to be wired as it is when it came to my next purchase.  I like the convenience of not dealing with a wire.  When the charge isn’t as long as it used to be, it’s nice to switch to a headset that is ready to game for gaming.  In my opinion this is a solid price point and it doesn’t mean you’ll get low bar sound quality.  I recommend this gaming headset, don’t shy away based on the price.  This won’t let you down.
title: Reasonable price and decent sound quality.

author: joe hislop
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: I’ve been a gamer for almost 20 years in some form. I’ve been through countless headsets, microphones, headsets.I honestly purchased these k2 pros on a whim. Boy was I in for a surprise.First thing that stands out is the braided cord. GONE ARE THE DAYS OF HAVING TO UNTWIST YOUR CORD! The braided line feels thorough and well attached. The headset it self feels light for the sleek aggressive bulk it carries. It does however feel incredibly sturdy.The ear pad is soft and comfortable as apposed to a thin layer of foam that slips on like most standard headsets. It feels more akin to the high end music studio headphones that only the purest covet.Now to plug them in. HOLY.SMOKES.The braided plug in comes to a compact usable organize bundle. 3 off shoot plug ins emerge. They are easily definable, definite to use, and placed out of each others way to prevent entanglement.Once I regained my focus i had completely forgot i was in the middle of your standard run of the mill battle royals game. Let’s drop!!You know that scene in the matrix where it zooms in on that guy chewing a steak. I can hear that. I know it’s that scene because i can hear my neighbors watching the Matrix across the yard. The sound is bountiful, crisp and independently defined. The low bass delivers from what seems like miles away. And i feel sorry for the guy who tries to sneak up behind so he can have a highlight clip for his stream. I’ll hear what he’s thinking before he does.The noise canceling.Ever have those days where your “roommate” comes home and starts telling you something that in no way improves your day, constantly having to mute the boys and say “ sorry what was that...”Not anymore i didn’t even hear the “roommate” come home!!!! Ah sweet serenity! I could sleep in theseNow if you’ll excuse me I’ve got some gaming to do, in peace and
title: Surprising immersion with sound, well built rig

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: Update on below review. Received card with  link for a free gift with my purchase. The gifts listed on the card were not all available. They asked me to send a copy of my product review and address for the gift. I receive a seemingly automated message expressing concern with my review and asking for details on the issues. (The details I listed in the review). They also proceeded to request a 5 star customer service rating. Since I have been receiving a lot of new spam in my e-mail. I am crediting this to Runmus selling my e-mail address. I have since dropped my rating of a 3 based purely on the product to a 1 based on otherwise poor company communication and increased spam after communicating with them.The headset comes with adjustable settings but the headset itself is a little big to start with and doesn't fit super comfortable though still usable.. The ear padding seems like it might be a little light in stuffing and the headphones don't do much but slightly mute outside sounds without sound playing. The microphone sits a little high for my liking, even on the lowest setting as it is always in the corner of my vision.  It is a little better if I lean the headset forward on my head but with it being a little loose on my head it doesn't hold still as well.  Top Volume is  not particularly loud either. Looks like I may need to go a price point up.
title: Update

author: Willie H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: Don’t look for another headset, stop right here. The reviews all speak for themselves. For the price, sound quality is incredible, noise cancelling is tight and right, and the microphone is great; not too sensitive but also crisp and clear. Right out of the box it’s plug and play (I have the ps4.)They’re big, but they’re rugged. Like others have said it’s a little uncomfortable on the ears but you quickly get used to them, I have a fairly large head and there’s plenty of room to adjust down after they’re maxed out so don’t worry about that. Why spend more when it’s all right here?
title: Click “order.”

author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
review_content: Headset is awesome & comfortable on head I got it mainly for my PS4. Game sounds are very crisp & clear explosions & gunfire sounds are great with great Bass Sports games & Racing Games sound Great as well.Only CON... I had to order a 6ft USB Cable Female to Mail connect.  The USB Cable to run the Headsets LED’s is way too short. Other than that very well satisfied with this headset for the Price. Compared to my $79.00 RIG headset I got for my Xbox One. & with purchase of headset get the USB extension cable.
title: For the money Above Average Headset 4 1/2 stars

author: @GoddessTae_
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: I bought these for my PS4. I’ve had these for about a month finally getting around to a review and I’m kinda torn about them .
