The reviews are so good because the order comes with a gift inside the box saying for a Review they will send a free gift so of course people are going to say nice things. One thing I like about these are they are big and do cancel noise out. Many things I dislike is the screeching static noise it does FREQUENTLY! it’s also strange that it comes with a usb and aux jack literally so close together and the USB is for the led lights but if the aux jack is in your controller you can’t turn on the led lights via the usb to your console ... so kinda pointless . Also the mute button sometimes doesn’t work . Disappointed .
title: A review that’s actually truthful .

author: WRXster
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
review_content: Good gaming headset. Comfortable, great sound for gaming, great customer service.Pros- headset is very comfortable, the material of the pads is soft and good for extended use- 3d sound feature is REALLY GOOD- mic worked well- great customer service.Cons- Didn't notice much noise cancellation- headphone jack caused problems after 2 months with audio cutting out when the cable moved. (But customer service was great and sent replacement)
title: Good product for the price

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: This is actually surprisingly a really good Headset for the price. It’s really comfortable and doesn’t hurt your ears, connects right to your controller, and is really easy to use with a mute and controller panel on the cord for volume. It took a minute to set up, but that’s because we were definitely overthinking it lol. My husband is very happy with this headset. Only thing I would improve is to make the mic stick easier to adjust and let it come away from the mouth with a bendable part.
title: Great headset for the price!

author: david
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
review_content: My system of choice is the Xbox 1 and these sound great especially with the Dolby Atmos app.+ The bass is full and the headset has zero hissing issues even at higher volume levels.+ Clear voice chat with inline volume control and noise cancelation.+ Headset is not heavy with comfortable ear cups so extended wear is not going to be an issue.- For those that love unboxing there will be not much here, just a the box and a headset in plastic.- LED's only work if using USB connection, not an issue for me as it's only cosmetic and it's not visible while  wearing the headset.- no separate volume controls for voice and game so having the chat puck is a bonus.Great headset
title: Don't let the price fool you...excellent sound !

author: BBQHernandez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: Not the best quality sound I've ever heard in a headphone, but it's decent enough. These are remarkably comfortable, though! Usually headphones will hurt the top of my head, and my ears, after a while. Not so with the Runmus, I've worn them for several hours at a time with virtually no discomfort! The only thing I don't like about it is the red light from the microphone - I thought it was cool as first, but not having an option to disable the glow is a big miss. I was going to use these for streaming mostly, but having a red glow on my cheek or lips from the microphone is a little distracting. I'll be investing in a standalone microphone and desk mounted mic-arm to remedy this, but I'll keep using these headphones for non-streaming purposes.
title: Very comfortable! Good quality sound.

author: M M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: Overall the headset feels cheap, it’s VERY bulky and the sound quality is not that good. The speakers don't rotate to allow a better accommodation to one's head, thus it leaves some open space that allows noise in. If you're buying this to a children, then it might work, but could still be very loose on their heads. For anyone else, I recommend expending a bit more on something better, and it doesn't have to be that much more.Mic did not work with my PS4. Not sure why as it seems to work with other people's video-game.
title: Very Bulky, Sound Quality Not Very Good

author: J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: Here’s a non bias review. The headphones are decent, for 20 bucks. Audio is fairly good, but I feel as if they get so loud it’s ear piercing. Microphone is fairy clear, but it’s so clear it’s to the point of where 80% of the audio going through the headphones is being picked up by the mic clearly.These get uncomfortable to wear after 2-3 hours and start to give you a headache, I have a medium sized head so it shouldn’t be a issue. The cord is too  long too, so annoying, it’s like 6 feet or more. Unnecessary.
title: REAL REVIEW

author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review_content: Very bummed about these headphones! They were amazing which is why I did two stars instead of one but they broke within 2 months! I received them November 29 2019 and now February 5 2029 they are not working properly. Here I am playing my game and the right side just completely cuts out and stops working. I’ve tried it on multiple controllers and it does not work on all of them. Super upset because they’re not super cheap and I really liked them. Don’t buy!! Just spend the extra money and get really nice ones!
title: They were great for about a month and a half

author: Utham Kumar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
review_content: Value for the Price: 5/5Comfort: 5/5Quality of Sound: 5/5Will I recommend: Absolute YesOverall: 5/5I use this as primarily a Gaming headset but it is equally good for all other uses like online learning, Skype conversations, etc. Main positives that I noticed were that they are comfortable for long term use with good sound quality and isolationThis wired headset is great for any level of a PC gamer due to its comfortable design, microphone and sound quality. The sound on this is really great which seems to be made for game play and not music which I like as that’s what I am using this for.  It is very comfortable and sounds really good!! It blocks out the surrounding noise which helps make the sound clearer. The microphone picks up only short range sound, so your team will not be annoyed with background and making you mute.  While not wireless, the price reflects the quality and does have a long 3’ cord. To make it wireless you can buy adapters for it. Overall a great buy and would recommend for PC gamer.The ear pieces are large enough for the biggest of ears and are very comfortable for wearing for hours.The built in mic has a surprisingly good clear sound, it is lot better than the last set of headphones I bought that cost almost a 100 dollars. If these headphones hold up for a year or two they will be well worth the money.
title: Best Overall Headset

author: Deja
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019
review_content: This product was definitely worth the investment.The noise cancelling is great. once they go on my ears, I'm  in an entirely different world from when they're off. The sound quality is actually grade A. This applies to when I use them for gaming (great for ambience), and when I use them for voice chatting. I would say they're definitely worth the price.Those are some pros. I would let you know some cons, but after ordering these approximately 3 months ago, I haven't experienced any issues with them so far!If I were to guide a friend to the right headset to use for their computer, I would definitely recommend these.
title: Definitely Don't Regret Buying

author: Germaine Oliver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
review_content: The short of it, is these are good headphones for the price. It's more of an open back headphone. If you aren't sure what that is, google closed back vs open back headphones. These aren't Senheiser HD quality headphones, but they also aren't $150+ headphones so I wasn't expecting that. The ear cushions are soft and it's comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. Everything on it is made from plastic, but it doesn't give me a "cheap" feel. Noise cancellation leaves something to be desired, as I could hear things from outside pretty well and they could hear me. Seeing as these are "Open back" though that is not a surprise, this is something that type of headphone is known for.Be warned that if you are looking for big booms from explosions and great bass you won't find that in these. Sound quality is maybe a bit above average for the cheap price of these. I highly suggest you combine these with an amplifier if buy them. After plugging them in to my cheap $25 fiiO E6 amplifier they easily sound as good in quality as $100+ headphones I have had before. Giving a significant increase to clarity and bass. I give these 3 1/2 stars overall, but combine them with an amplifier and it easily goes to a 4 1/2.
title: Good for the price

author: Sebastian Rodriguez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: Its actually a lot better looking in person than it is over picture. I liked how it looked in the pictures amazon and other people posted but in person I was actually pretty surprised as to how much better it looked. In my opinion at least. The chord is insanely long the adapters have their own im assuming they’re dust covers? I dont know but they’re great. Super comfy to be honest. The sound is insane too, I played Resident Evil i think 3? The one that just came out with Nemesis. It was insaneeeeelt terrifying it felt like I was rightttt there. The mic is amazing quality too. I have rowdy back neighbors and my friends could never hear their loud music or anything which was great, even I had a lot of trouble hearing them im assuming because of the noise cancelation. It was great and such a welcome change from feeling like their music was right in my ear. It has gotten me im trouble because I haven’t heard my name being called hahaha. The lil controller at the side too is amazing and super convenient. Im not sure about others but for me the product came with like a “free” gift as long as I left a review, that being said, they never actually said it had to be good haha. No but honestly the product is amazing so like it’s a bit confusing why they think they need to like sorta bribe people into reviewing. If im being honest they dont need to whatsoever the headset is amazing enough to get five starts on its own. See the best part too? It’s cheap hahahah. These things are usually super expensive but the price is amazing it could easily be sold for a lot more and still be valid. Also I play on ps4 pro but i got curious and used the headset to watch youtube videos on my windows laptop and it worked amazing the sound was great. I honestly love it 100% would get again.
title: Came with a bribe but honestly? It isn’t needed it’s amazing enough to get five stars on its own.

author: Vinh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: Comfort 10/10Fits really well and is snug to my head. Usually headphones start to hurt my ears after a while but didn't have that problem with these headphones.Noise cancellation 9/10The headphones cancelled out most noises pretty well. Foreign noises sound muffled but gets through  the headphones nonetheless.Sound Quality 9/10I am using these headphones for my PS4 and the sounds were cutting off and lagging at first but the product came with an additional attachment that goes over the AUX port. The attachment is intended for voice recording and is spilt into two ends (Mic & Headphone). After I plugged in the attachment, the earlier problems were nonexistent. A very small inconvenience considering the overall quality.Pretty happy with my purchase. You get what you paid for.
title: Great headphones for the price!

author: Kayan Kime
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
review_content: Im not a huge headphones type of person. I have sensitivity issues with things around my ears, mostly issues of having tubes in my ears as a kid.  I've tended to gravitate toward getting the cheap headsets for voice chat with friends.But cheap is cheap, and my last headset barely stayed together.  Sure I could tape it but meh, lazy.My brother suggested I get a headset, so I took a look. Amazon was rating this pretty well.  Other reviewers gave some pretty good insight on the look, feel, sound.  I'm not one for lights, but red/black is my color combo of choice.  So I took a chance.  Bought the headset, and a splitter (cause from all that I could tell, it didn't have one).Got yesterday.  It's a bit chunky, but after a few hours of wear, I couldn't tell I was wearing it.I played around with the sound settings on my PC.  This headset puts out some really good sound.  And it can handle bass very well.  If you have a sound card or on-board sound that can do 5.1/7.1, these headsets feel like they can give you that sound directional and audio.To a point, I play Star Trek: Online. It's got a lot of ambience, little sounds hear and there, with distance and such.  Running around a ship or a base, you can hear just little things.  One place was interesting, as I had been in several times.  But I never heard ships or battle rumbling outside.  These headphones?  I was freaking out a little bit.The lighting effects on the headphones are neat, but to me, novel.  You need to plug into a USB port to get them to work, that's it.  I haven't really played around with the headphones to see if there's some way to ease the lights, so I just ended up not plugging in the USB.  This does not and I repeat DOES NOT affect your sound at all.  It's just for powering up the lights.So overall, its a great buy.Also - it comes with a splitter for single headphone jack.  So if you use a PC, you don't need a splitter.
title: Not what I was expecting, but falling in love

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: As a casual gamer, these headphones exceeded all of my expectations. At first, I was skeptical bout the price being so low (as when most things are cheap, the build quality is not the best), but these things did the job perfectly.The headset is very comfortable on your head, even when gaming for multiple hours without a break. The plastic is firm and the ear cups cover your whole ear so you get a full sound experience. The surround sound is not the best (but of course, this thing is 30 bucks), but you can get a pretty decent sense everything around you as if you were really there. The noise-cancellation is no joke, there is almost no outside sound coming through my ears, and I feel fully immersed in my gameplay.The microphone is sturdy and also moveable if you ever want it out of your vision, and your voice is clear and understandable when talking through the mic. It also comes with a mute/unmute slider so if you need to quickly turn your mic off, you just slide the switch and boom, no one can hear you.The headset itself is near unbreakable, and it won't crack or bend in the event of a dropping (or a good throw across the room in a fit of gamer's rage). The 3.5 millimeter audio can plug into your controller, and it also come with two separate audio and mic jacks if you need to plug the headset directly into your PC.Overall this headset is a great bang for your buck, and outperforms every other 30 dollar headset it it's class by a mile. Also, it comes with LED lights(when the USB is plugged in)! Now who doesn't like that? This product won't disappoint!
title: All-around great headset for the price

author: Carl Franklin, JD/PhD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: The quality of the material seemed high. The plastic didn't feel cheap and the overall build was good. I felt like this was equal to many headsets that cost 2 to 3 times more money. The overall sound quality was good. I use it for gaming, so my needs are fairly limited. For listening to music or watching movies I use a system that is designed for that purpose. From what I can tell, the overall sound quality is close enough between the two make this a good choice for both purposes.
title: Bought this headset to work with my PS4 and PC.

author: Timothy Tinney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
review_content: So I needed a new headset for my call center work, but there were none available on Amazon in time for my needs, so I went with this gaming headset. I have to say, in general, they are wonderful, customers comment on how well they can hear me, they cant hear the background noise I have downstairs (4yo grandson and 3 yorkies), they are OK on the comfort level, even for long periods of time (8+ hours a day). HOWEVER, the 2 major complaints I have are, 1. They do not fit very well, This may be hard to describe, but when you put them over your ears, they 'stick out' at the bottom. They do not hug at the bottom, which makes them just a tad awkward, but you get used to it. 2. The inline thumb-wheel volume control has some serious dead spots in it. This has become an issue. If a customer is talking, and I can not hear them because I have bumped the wheel into a dead spot....that is a significant issue. Overall, I rate them well, but it has a near fatal flaw for me.
title: Awesome.....except...

author: Lisa Doherty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Perfect!  I bought this for my son, without knowing much about Xbox and the attachments, etc. when I received it, I read that you need an adapter if you have an older Xbox one, which is what we have. So I ran to Best Buy to quickly get the adapter the day before Christmas. It turns out Best Buy  did not carry it. But, it also turned out if the gaming controller is newish, an adapter is not needed.  My son had an updated controller so all was well, but I stressed out, not realizing this.
title: Good for older Xbox one IF controller is newer

author: Ashely
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: This is like many headsets. Sounds nice. Good coverage. blah blah blah...but omg the cords. The cord is super long and has different adapters (possibly wrong lingo?). There is also a nifty little thing that allows you to mess with the volume and power on/off mic on the long cord. So if you like to sit on a 7ft tall persons head, while they play video games, and listen to all the action, then this is the headset for you. Seriously though its a decent headset and quite comfortable.
title: Holy long cord Batman!

author: Morgan Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: Full disclosure: I was asked to write a review in order to receive a free gift from the seller. That being said, the review will still be completely honest.As far as shipping goes, I ordered it on Tuesday expecting to receive them Friday, but the arrived on Thursday, a whole day early. I thoroughly appreciate companies with super fast shipping so it was a nice surprise.Out of the box, I noticed they were much larger than I expected them to be, and they don't quite sit on my ears right. They hang down a little low, but are still comfortable, so I'm not too worried about. They just might work better for people with larger heads.The sound is pretty good, but I wouldn't consider them noise cancelling. I use them when playing games and talking on discord, and since my husband and I play in the same room, we mute each other because it's easier to hear each other in person, and I don't need to remove the headphones to do so. So, they work well for our purposes.The mic seems to work well, as I had no complaints from anyone in our discord group, and it doesn't seem to pick up any unwanted background noise, which is great.Aesthetically, they are a little clunky and plasticy, but functionality wise, they do exactly what I hoped they'd do. Overall I'm pleased, and for the price, they are pretty fantastic.
title: Great for the price, and work great where it counts.

author: Jamie Thurlow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: I ordered these for my son to use with an XBox gaming system. So far they sound good, and noise cancellation seems to be good. They are a bit bulkier than our other headset. I didn't realize when we ordered them that you had to plug a separate USB port in for the lights to work. Since my son is using his headset with the Xbox, the lights will not work. Bummer!  The plug into the controller seems to be a tad finicky, there is a bit of static when slightly moved but could possibly be user error.
title: Good Product

author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: I bought these about a month ago, and I love them. I am a very casual gamer, and really only wanted to listen to music with nice headphones that could double as a headset for the few occasions when I actually play. Being my first decent headset I've ever owned, I was very, very happy with how clean and clear the audio is - exactly what I was looking for in the product.One problem I've had with other headphones in the past was the cord getting caught on something causing the cord to be semi-ripped out of the set, ruining the sound and breaking the headphones... but I can tell these are not going to have that problem. The part of the cord going into the set is reinforced with very sturdy rubber, keeping the cord firmly in place. It would probably take the strength of several people to actually rip the cord out of these things.No batteries required is a nice bonus.I don't game often but when I do, the microphone seems to work quite well - no complaints yet. The only thing about this headset that may bother some people is that the mic attachment only folds down when they are worn with the mic over your left ear. If you really prefer the mic on the right side of your head, it will not fold down both ways, only when worn with the mic on your left. It does not bother me, but it may for some.The USB plug powers the red lights on the headset, so if you prefer the lights off, that is easily done by unplugging the USB and leaving the audio plugged in.All in all a great headset, it does the job I need it to do very well. I am very pleased.
title: Great headset for gaming and music

author: Daniel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: I am not a hardcore gamer by any means but after getting the new call of duty, I figured it was time to buy a headset. Took a chance with this one after reading the reviews and for the price, I had nothing to lose. Received the headset after just two days and I couldn't be happier. They fit nicely and since my ears are not huge, the headphone cups fit perfectly without really smashing my ears so I think they are very comfortable and have played for over an hour at a time with no problems. I'm not one to spend 2+ hours in one session so I can't speak on how they feel for hours of straight use but I honestly think I could wear this for hours without discomfort. The sound quality is amazing with so much depth. Feels like I'm literally in the game. Didn't think it could make a difference but it does. How does RUMNUS make a profit selling this thing for such a low price compared to top name brands. If you love to play games and are looking for a headset, you may like these but if you are just a casual gamer or are on the fence of getting a headset, don't hesitate. Get these and you won't be disappointed.Pros:- Comfortable- Doesn't smash ears- Noise cancellation is decent- Sound quality is great- Improves in game experience- Mic is clear according to my friends on the other end (no feedback or picking up nearby noises)- VALUE (can't beat the price)Cons:- The mic isn't super flexible but I don't care- Its wired which I knew when I bought it so not really a con
title: Can't Beat the Value!

author: tamelotte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: The Run Mus K2 Pro has an edgy design that makes you want to put it on and immerse yourself in futuristic games. Check compatibility before purchasing. Not all Xboxes are the same. This works with the New Xbox One but not the 360. An adapter is needed to work with the other Xbox One (which is what we have). I'm sure it says all this in the description but we left it up to our gaming son to research and select. Details and a teen. It is amazing all the things they can pay attention to in a video game but in life outside them their abilities once again are human.
title: Check compatibility before purchasing

author: Obimaru
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: After some fussing around with the 3.5 mm jacks and running the mic through windows setup I got everything to work, and I got to say I'm impressed from what I got for the price both the headphones and mic have good sound quality I do still wonder if the headset is 7.1 surround sound though but my concerns where eased a bit after actually playing a game a and listening for footsteps and things and I could hear everything fine.The headset is pretty comfortable but every now and again I find myself lifting the drivers to relieve a bit of minor pressure this is likely due to me having big ears not a deal breaker by any capacity overall a good buy.
title: Good headset for the price

author: Green Fairy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
review_content: These headset are really lovely quality! I ordered them based on the reviews and how everybody spoke about them being really lovely for sound and even mic quality. I personally use these on my PC and since connecting them, they have worked very smoothly with no issues. The mic quality is very nice from when I transmit it back to myself and will be wonderful to use with friends. Sound quality from videos is perfect, though I am yet to test it in-game. Other reviews said the surround sound feature was not the best, but if that ends up being the case, I honestly couldn't be mad due to the high quality of this headset. Before purchasing these I was very iffy and wasn't sure if I wanted a new pair or not, but I know how often I have troubles hearing things while playing games or talking with friends because I used earbuds from Apple. This was honestly a great upgrade and DEFINITELY worth the price! Great purchase and the set-up was extremely simple and easy. (You can also have LED lights by plugging the USB into your PC, but it's not necessary. I did it even so, and it is fairly bright in the dark! I love it!)(EDIT: I've used the product for almost a week now and my experience has been amazing even now! The only setbacks have been trying to find the sweet spot in the settings, which I still have not nailed down. Regardless of that, I bought a professional microphone and pop filter prior to this and this microphone is EXCEPTIONALLY better and I adore it! I will definitely be buying this headset again in the future.)
title: Great quality headset!

author: Serena Holster
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
review_content: I am so happy and pleased with this headset purchase.  We have been wanting to upgrade my son's headset for a couple months now and I am so glad we chose this Runmus Headset.  The sound is great and the mic works awesome!  My son's old mic would go in and out and with this one there is absolutely no issues!  I try to ask him a question and the noise cancelling is great as well, maybe too great, Just Kidding.  But I would highly recommend this headset, even as a beginner.  It is slightly bigger but the comfort of wearing it is awesome, plenty of support all around.  The only draw back is the length of the cord, but it doesn't seem to bother him.  Very, Very happy with the purchase!
title: This is a great Headset for a great price

author: S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: My son really liked the previous version of this headset so we gave the new model a try.Overall for the price it is a very good product. The quality of the sound is very good.The differences are as follows, with new one in red on the left of the picture and old one in blue on the right:+ the mic on the new model is slimmer and with no foam, the foam keeps coming off in the old one so it’s an improvement- the microphone’s arm length and bend ability are less good on the new model, making it hard to position close enough to the mouth to completely prevent it from picking up background noise. That’s the biggest negative point and the main thing I prefer in the old model+ despite that, the quality of the mic is good and the background noise is minimal+ like previous model it comes with a mic/speaker splitter+ the cord is very long on both models. In the olde models it tends to get twisted and get kinks and I hope the new model has a cord that solves this problem. It comes wrapped in a nice velcro strap so you can unwrap only the length you need.+ just like the older one it is comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
title: As good as previous model with some differences

author: Ramon Antonio
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I received them and so far they are excellent. The sound quality is really good and the noise cancellation is awesome. They are pretty comfortable as well although they do feel a tad bit heavy but I'm sure I will get used to them.The product complies with everything the manufacturer promises and the following aspects can be highlighted:**The headset is quite comfortable, the material of the pads is very soft, which allows them to be used for a long time while the game is going on.**The headset aid is made of excellent materials, which makes it very robust.**The cable is long enough, and the volume control gives the user a lot of freedom to raise or lower the volume quickly when needed, without having to pause the game or get too close to the console or PC.**The maximum volume it provides seems appropriate for long gaming sessions, since the idea is to enjoy the game and not damage the ears.
title: Excellent Headset for Gaming!!!

author: Jose J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: As far as value is concerned, you cannot do better than this. Having used it for 8 months, I have yet to encounter any significant problems with this headset. Qualitative-wise, it boasts a sturdy build, which while it does make it lean more towards the heavy side, it does mean that it can take quite a bit of punishment. It features a 4-foot long braided cable, which while short, is extremely durable, and a very good, albeit stiff and rubbery microphone attached via an axle that swivels vertically.Unfortunately, this headset falls short in two important areas: sound quality and independent volume control. The sound that the speakers emit is oftentimes muffled, although not to a severe or intolerable degree. Likewise, there is no independent sensitivity or input volume control for the mic, or the level of bass for the speakers, which, given the value of the product, should not come of any surprise. Noise cancellation, however, is pretty good.Compatibility-wise, I've been able to use the headset on both my Windows 8 and 10 PCs. Installation is straightforward, as it did not require any manufacturer-specific drivers. Just hook it up correctly and that's it.While it definitely falters in some areas, sound quality being the most notable, this is a great budget alternative for people interested in getting a headset, but unwilling to commit to such an exorbitant investment. Overall, it is assuredly a product I would willingly recommend, especially at its current price.
title: Great headset for gaming on PC.

author: RAINA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review_content: Purchased this item for my teenager. She absolutely loves it! She uses it for gaming. She said that the headset does not hurt her ears after wearing them for an extended time (3+ hours). Quality sound and looks great. It blocks out all outside sounds/noise. (Which she thinks is a great thing because she can't hear me calling her). So far so good. Gaming vocals and sounds come through loud and clear. Arrived in two days, and for a teacher on a budget, the cost was sufficient.
title: Superior headset ... finally!

author: Daniel Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
review_content: These were a great buy for my nephew, but I used them first! We both needed some new headphones for our PS4 and found these. I tried them in my laptop too, good bass and adapter allow me to use the mic for Hangouts calls. This headset has a switch on the cord which is great when you suddenly have background noise (screaming parents, crying baby) while playing the game! It's a little bulky and the cord is very long, otherwise, great find for the price! I plan on ordering another for my son.
title: Good deal

author: Antoine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: Background : Bought this as the next logical step after my Sennheiser G600's earpad tissue tore apart for the second time in two years. Having had more success with a cheap HyperX headset, I figured I'd keep buying on the cheaper end considering they last as long or longer than the more expensive ones.Pros :- I hear the bass and other low sounds much better than on the Sennheiser. I'm not an audiophile, so that's the only thing that stood out to me. The rest sounded the same.- The lighting is eye candy, though I kind of wished it turned off with the computer.Subjective :- The cable is super short. Perfect for me since I can't accidentally roll on it with my chair, but could inconvenience others. For instance with my habit of just setting down the headset on the desk I've already often come close to accidentally pulling it down and onto the keyboard or floor.Cons :- It feels like I need to place them on my head *just* right for the ears to be comfortable.- Even when I do find the sweetspot, it won't be as comfortable as other headsets.- Even though the mic is a swivel, you can't mute yourself by tilting it up. You need to use the on-cable controls (or go through your system's settings).Get this if you're on a budget and don't mind slight ear discomfort that your brain will likely tune out during long sessions (and sometimes tune back in once you take them off). The rest is likely to be worth the price.
title: Great deal for the price, but not without tangible flaws.

author: Tsubasa Ito
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: If you’re looking for a good headset but you don’t want to spend a fortune on one because you’re an occasional gamer like me where you only spend a couple of hours every few days or even just once a week, this is a perfect headset.Pros: For those who have excessive amount of piercings on your ears like me, these headsets  are big enough to fit around your piercings with almost no issue. Depending on how you have the headset positioned, you MAY start feeling soreness but very rarely do I feel any discomfort. The surround sound, noise cancellation, and sound quality is more than good enough but definitely not comparable to the high-end brands like Bose.Cons: I don’t have much to complain about it but the structure build quality could be improved but for this price range, I’m not even gonna complain because if I wanted something stronger, I’d spend more on something stronger but it’s still strong enough for my big head. To emphasize on this, I have a huge head and so when I have the arms extend, I can hear it crackle (not crack but sounds like it is) which worries me that it would break apart but it hasn’t yet so it’s not too big of a concern for me yet lol.Overall, GREAT headsets. Buy it if you want something good but don’t want to break the bank.
title: Best bang for the buck

author: Billie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: Edit: Also got an email trying to have me remove this review. Couldn’t respond because email couldn’t be found? DON’T PURCHASE FROM THIS COMPANY.My PC won't use this as a headset at all. I can hear audio, but can't use the mic via discord. I've seen and followed suggestions offered by answers on here by other people / the company. I don't have any device that uses audiojack/USB (other than my laptop)... so I can't even test it out on my iphone/ipad. Considering I wanted a mic for gaming, this is pretty useless... I'd rather use a bluetooth headset.
title: Can't Use Mic - PC

author: CB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2019
review_content: UPDATED 4/10/2020My headphones are not working AT ALL. Randomly just stopped working altogether. I literally bought these about 6 months ago and BOOM. DONE. USELESS.  They are in PERFECT condition and look like I just opened them.How are you going to fix this problem team?  I'll send them to you guys so you can see they are clean AF.The headphones are soooo comfortable, have a good build, and after doing a full sound test I would give these a rating of 7/10 1 being a low quality pair of headphones, 5 being good, 7 being excellent, and 10 being full professional headphones(professional being $500+ for a headphone).I would say an equivalent gaming headphone of this quality would cost $200. I am blown away how great the surround sound is in these headphones.You can't go wrong if you are trying to get a solid gaming headphone for little money.
title: Pure Quality

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: The sound quality of this headset is amazing. However the microphone sucks. I bought 2 of these and both microphones went out within 2 weeks. They just stop working. You can still hear but you cannot talk. I exchanged them a week ago and the microphone on one has already stopped working again. Now I'm trying to get a refund and try another headset. It's a shame because the headset's sound cancelling is amazing. However 2 out of 3 headset's microphones not working. Shame.
title: Great sound quality but crappy microphone

author: dawnE27
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: UPDATED POST:I have grown accustomed to wearing them, and they are actually quite comfortable. I had some issues and the company's service was great and very personable, so I updated their score to 5 stars.I've now used them for playing game like Horizon Zero Dawn and Destiny 2. The surround sound is great and helps you pin down enemies. Heck, even Minecraft has good surround sound through these. It's been a few months and I like them now more than when I first got them.ORIGINAL POST:The sound quality is amazing, the mic quality is also great. Mic cancels background noises like people talking/TV noticeably well. While wearing them you can still hear your surroundings like 90%, so I don't know that I'd really call them sound canceling for the wearer. Once again though, the mic is masterful at canceling background if you're using these for gaming or recording.The headset is a little heavy which made them uncomfortable until I got used to them, and the plastic feels cheap, but they look really cool. I'm worried that if you didn't get used to them while playing games for hours, it might start to get uncomfortable. This is my first pair of gamer headphones though, so if you've owned a pair before that wasn't made for comfort you probably already know that feeling.I love them for my setup. They feel like professional headphones but are a very reasonable price. The glowing is sweet, you need an extra USB slot for it though. Also, you have to unplug it to get the glowing to stop, even if your computer is asleep.Would recommend, they're great.
title: Amazing headset for the price

author: Robin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
review_content: The size and quality of these headphones are outstanding! The mic works properly and the sound is just incredible, whether you're listening to music or playing games and has AMAZING surround sound. The lighting works perfectly and the size and adjustments on these headphones are absolutely incredible.I used this product for playing game on my pc and it really brought the experience and joys of playing it to life. This product was worth the money and I would recommend these headphones to anybody!
title: Best Sound Ever :)

author: Laura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: Honestly, I value sound quality in gaming headsets. I typically lean to Turtle Beach, as well as some of the others in the 200-300 range. Recently, the ones I had fell apart, and I needed a quick replacement. Seeing good reviews, I figured it wouldn’t a loss if I was going to throw 30 bucks at something. That in mind- this is a really good quality headset! Sound is spot on (I need it for directional as well as overall sound), fit well, and my ears don’t hurt after an hour.The only negatives would be that you cannot adjust the position of the mic (it has some play, but very little after a certain point) and the lights only work if you plug it into a usb. Both aren’t deal breakers, and for the fact that I spent over $100 less than the cheapest I have ever spent- well worth the minor issue.Would certainly buy again, and won’t be replacing them anytime soon.
title: Much better than expected for the price!

author: Chan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: This headset too heavy and bulky. I don't know how other buyers gave good stars on this headset. The cushions for comfortable, I have no complaints and also the sound quality. I try it for 5-10 minutes and put back in the box because I feel dizzy. I haven't try and see if the microphone works. But I know that this headset definitely not for me. I ask my son to try on and see if he like it then he can keep it but he doesn't want it after put it on for less than a minute.
title: Too heavy and bulky...

author: Floridian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
review_content: I was lucky enough to receive the offer of a free gift if I reviewed this headset. Truth be told, I would have done it without any outside motivation.  After years of service, my on-ear gaming headset gave up the ghost. I take exceptional care of my gear so I was disappointed when the cable separated at the connection to the 3.5 mm plug. As you can see by the attached photo, that won't be happening again any time soon since my new Run Mus headset has a beefy cable with a braided strain relief shroud. In fact, beefy is a perfect way to describe these earphones. Unlike their predecessor, these heavy-weights completely cover my ears instead of resting on top. The silence is deafening and I mean that in a good way. Now I can fully appreciate the surround sound with booming bass and clear highs. The payoff has been an amazing increase in spatial orientation, situational awareness and most importantly K:D ratio. Nobody is sneaking up behind this guy anymore! They came with more than enough connection options and plug straight in to my xbox 1 controller. I get my choice of 6 gifts but you know what? I may just get another headset in a different color. Yeah, it's THAT good.
title: Substantial...feel and sound

author: Lepi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: The cord makes a static noise that irritates my friends and myself that have to listen to it. If you hold the cord just right you can avoid the static. But the slightest movement brings on the worst noise. I would not recommend this headset. I had another one that was a $25 one thatasted for about a year but the cord wore out at the connection to my controller. It was perfect. Do not buy
title: Lots of static noise in the headphones!

author: Nora
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
review_content: I'll start off saying I'm not an audiophile by any means and can't claim any expertise in reviewing this headset, all I can give you, reader, is the meager opinion of the average consumer.I bought this headset after ditching an old wireless Logitech one and some immediate things I liked in comparison (besides it being functional) is that it was a bigger, more comfortable fit and the audio doesn't randomly cut out.  That's about the only comparison I can give as otherwise I just use speakers or earbuds.  Here's a stream of thoughts I have on this headset:- Audio quality is great.  I use it for gaming and I can clearly hear my teammates without sacrificing the audio of the game- Set up is easy: just plug in the USB, mic, and audio jack and everything worked like a charm- Others have said the mic quality is solid- Definitely has good noise cancelling.  I have a house with two kids, a dog, and birds and that world basically vanished with this bad boy on- A critique might be the big bulky look. I personally don't mind it, even though I probably look ridiculous.  Turn on the LEDs so everyone knows you're a PRO GAMERReally I think it's a super headset for the price!  Can't go wrong with it.
title: Quality Headset

author: Tijon Norman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: This headset is actually quite good for the price. The inline volume and microphone mute feature comes in handy so you don’t have to fumble with in-game volume settings. The headset is very bulky but is still fairly light and everything—including the led lights  (powered by the usb cable only), works as advertised. The 7.1 surround sound is an incredible feature, especially if you’re into first person shooters like call of duty, because you can hear every and any direction your enemy is coming from. The majority of the headset is plastic and fits over your ears but if you have a smaller head, it probably won’t sit very tightly. As for noise cancellation, i think it performs for its price range. You’ll still be able to hear a low muffled version of your surroundings with no sound coming through the headphones but when immersed in gameplay, the game is mostly what you’ll hear. I think it’s a good buy and I would recommend these gaming headsets if you’re looking for a pair that sound great with no feedback or static, fits over your ears, is flexible and durable, 7.1 surround sound (a must for heavy gamers) and won’t break the bank.
title: Performs Well For The Price!
